covntesse pembroke arcadia written sir philip sidney knight since first edition augmented ended london printed william ponsonbie anno domini 1593 deare lady sister covntesse pembroke haue deare worthye bee deare lady idle worke mine feare like spider webbe thought fitter swept away worne purpose part trueth cruell father among greekes woont doe babe would foster could well finde heart cast desert forgetfulnesse childe loath father desired doe desire heart absolute commaundement done onely keepe selfe friend weigh error ballance good hope father sake pardoned perchaunce made much though naturall rest still forced thought worke vpon place wee last ala word last long last graze eye vpon euer florishing beautie still crie within v ah base minded wretch thought deeply bemired trade ordinary worldling respect gaine paultry wool may yeeld let much time passe without knowing perfectly estate especially troublesome season leaue shore vnsaluted whence may see island dwelleth leaue step vnkissed wherein vrania printed farewell beautie well remembraunce commaunded obeyed find remembrance came euer cloathed vnto v forme place place giues newe heate feauer languishing remembrance yonder claius vrania lighted verie horse thought bewayled disburdned thee poore claius thou wentst helpe downe saw reuerence desire deuide thee thou didst one instant blushe quake stead bearing warre readie fal thy selfe sate vouchsafing cloake gorgeous vnder yonder rising ground shee turned selfe looking backe toward woonted abode parting bearing much sorrow eye lightsomnes wherof yet natural cherefulnesse made euen sorrow seeme smile turning shee spake v opening cherrie lip lord greedily mine eares feed vpon sweete word vttered laide hand ouer thine eye shee saw teares springing would conceale yet selfe feele thy sorrow woe yonder yonder shee put foote boate instant diuiding heauenly beautie betweene earth sea imbarked marke windes whistled sea daunst ioy sailes swell pride vrania vrania blessed thou vrania sweetest fairnesse fairest sweetnesse word voice brake sobbing could say claius thus answered ala strephon said needes skore recken vp onely loss doubt light place doth cal thoughtes appeare court affection held racking steward remembrance aswell may sheepe forget feare spie woolues misse fancy see place made happie treading choose saw thinke stayed walkt turned spoke truely place serued v thinke thinges thinges serue place call memorie excellent matter let v thinke consideration consider acknowledging acknowledge admiration admire loue loue ioy midst woe let v sorte thinke say poore eye inriched behold lowe heart exalted loue maide greatest thing world shewe beautie least thing may praysed beautie certainely eyelid pleasant behold two white kiddes climing vp faire tree browsing tendrest braunches yet nothing compared dayshining starres contayned breath sweete gentle southwest wind coms creeping ouer flowrie fieldes shaddowed water extreeme heate summer yet nothing compared hony flowing speach breath doth carrie eye see though haue seene else shall euer see drie stuble clouers grasse matched flocke vnspeakeable vertues laid vp delightfully best builded folde deede better consider sunnes beautie marking guildes water mountaines looking vpon owne face glorious weake eye may conceit able beare sunstayning excellencie better way workes vpon meaner subiect employed ala better witnesse whose experience grounded vpon feeling hath onely loue made v beeing silly ignorant shepheards raise vp thought aboue ordinary leuell worlde great clearkes doe disdaine conference hath desire seeme worthie eye made v others sleeping sit vewing course heauens others running base runne ouer learned writing marke sheepe two marke selues hath shee throwne reason vpon desire giuen eye vnto cupid hath louefellowship maintained frindship riuals beautie taught beholder chastitie going praise strephon bad stay looke perceaued thinge floted drawing nearer nearer banke rather fauourable working sea selfe industrie doubted bee till cast vp euen hard time fully saw man wherupon running pitie sake vnto found hand appeare constanter frendes life memorie fast griping vpon edge square small coffer lay vnder breast el selfe shew life boord seemed beere carrie land sepulchre drew vp young man goodly shape well pleasing fauour one would thinke death louely countenance though naked nakednes apparrell sight increased compassion compassion called vp care lifting feete aboue head making great deale salt water come mouth layd vpon garment fell rub chafe till brought recouer breath seruant warmth companion liuing length opening eye gaue great groane dolefull note pleasaunt dittie founde onely life strength life therefore continued charitable office vntill spirit well returned without much thanking paine gate vp looking round vttermost lymittes sight cry vpon name pyrocles seeing hearing cause comfort said shall musidorus liue pyrocles destruction therewithall hee offered wilfully cast himselfe againe sea strange sight shepheards seemed beefore apparance dead yet saued life comming life cause procure death ranne vnto pulling backe feeble force stickled vnnaturall fray pray said honest men right haue suffer doe selfe list pollicie haue bestowe benefite counted iniury hearing speake greeke naturall language became tender hearted towards considering calling looking losse deare friend great cause sorrow tolde poore men bound course humanitie preuent great mischiefe wisht opinion body perishing bred desperate anguish cōforted proof lately escaped apparant danger might said attend high blissefullnes since take care pray find meās bark may prouided go hauen possible wee maye find bodie farre farre precious food fish hire said haue within casket value sufficient content claius presently went fisherman hauing agreeed prouided apparrell naked stranger imbarked shepheards sooner gone beyond mouth hauen way sea might discerne stayne water colour time sparkes smoke mounting thereout young man sooner saw beating brest cried beginning ruine intreating bend course neere vnto could telling smoake small relique great fire driuen friend rather committe themselues cold mercie sea abide hote crueltie fire therefore though abandoned ship course bee met withall steared therefore neere thetherward cold came neere eies ful master obiect saw sight ful piteous strangenes ship rather carkas shippe rather bone carkas hulling part broken part burned part drowned death hauing vsed one dart destruction floted great store rich thinges many chestes might promise lesse amidst precious thinges number dead body likewise testifie element violence chiefe violence growen humane inhumanitie body full grisly wound bloud filled wrinckles sea visage seemed sea woulde wash away might witnes alwaies fault wee condemne cruletie summe defeate conquered kept field spoile shipwrack without storme ill footing wast fire midst water litle way saw mast • e proude height lay along like widdow hauing lost make held honor vpon mast saw yong man least hee man bearing shew 18 yeares age sate horseback hauing nothing vpon shirt beeing wrought blew silke golde kinde resemblance sea sun neare westerne home shote beames haire young men greece vsed weare long stirred vp downe wind seemed haue sporte play sea kisse foot himselfe full admirable beautie set foorth strangenes seate gesture holding head vp full vnmoued maiestie held sworde aloft faire arme often waued crowne though would threaten world extremitie fisherman came neere time throwe rope hold might draw simplicity bred amasement amasement superstition assuredly thinking god begotten betweene neptune venus made terrible slaughter went vnder sayle held vp hand made prayer musidorus saw though almost much rauished ioy astonishment lept mariner tooke corde hande saying doest thou liue arte well answered thou canst tell best since well beyng standes thee threwe alreadie shippe past beyond pyrocles therefore musidorus could perswade mariner cast againe assuring hee man although diuine excellency promising great rewardes paine alreadie come vpon stay one saylers discried galley came sayles oares directlie chase streight perceaued wel knowne pirate hunted goodes body men imployed eyther galley slaues sell best market maister vnderstoode commaunded forthwith set al canuasse could flie homeward leauing sort poore pyrocles neere reskewed musidorus saye hee offer perswade venture fight feare stāding gate eares put backe perswasions nothing wherewith accompanie pyrocles eye succour wish therefore praying casting long looke way saw galley leaue pursuite turne take vp spoiles wracke lastly might well see lift vp yong man ala saide hee himselfe deere pyrocles shall bodie thine enchained shal victorious hāds thine cōmaunded base office shal vertue becōe slaue slaues viciousnes ala better bene thou hadst ended nobly thy noble day death euil vnworthy seruitude opinion soone ceased sawe gallie setting vpon shippe held long strong fight began fresh feare life friende wish well pirate whome hated least ruyne might perish fisherman made speed hauen absented eye beholding issue entred could procure neither put themselues sea ful sorrow beyng vnable doe thing voide counsel doe anything besides sicknesse grew something vpon honest shepheards strephon claius themselues true friend perfectly iudge iustnesse sorrowe aduise mitigate somwhat woe since gotten amendment fortune come assured persuasion death haue cause dispaire life one lamented death sheepe know strayed would receiue pleasure though readily knew finde sir saide thus selues profession shepheards countrie laconia little better straungers therefore neither skill abilitie power greatly stead wee present vnto arcadia countrie little way hence euen vpon next confines dwelleth gentleman name kalander vouchsafeth much fauour vnto v man hospitalitie much haunted passe diuers shewe one wanting store thother hauing store want country answered claius cast shore past laconia poore barrennes soyle though selfe passing fertill ciuill warre two yeares within bowel estate betweene gentleman peasant named helot hath sorte disfigured face nature made vnhospitall haue founde townes neither one side willingly opening gate stranger stranger willingly entring feare mistaken countrie set foot arcadia euen hard house kalander whether lead country thus decked peace child peace good husbandrie house see scattered men two liue vpon commoditie sheepe therefore diuision arcadian estate termed shepheards happie people wanting litle desire much cause saide musidorus made venter leaue sweet life put selfe yonder vnpleasant dangerous realme guarded pouertie gaue maiestie aduersitie man whose age could aboue one twenty yeares good olde man euē enamoured fatherly loue towards rather became seruaunt bondes vertue laid vpon acknowledged selfe badge diligent attendance palladius hauing gotten health onely staying bee place vvhere might heare answere shippes set foorth kalander one noone led abroad well arayed ground behind house hee thought shew going place thē delighted backside house neither field gardē orchard rather field garden orchard soone descending stayres deliuered downe came place cunningly set tree moste tastpleasing fruites scarcelie vvhich extraordinarie meanes deliuered vnto knovving much though long acquainted shal find eares faithfull treasurer sitting downe tvvo chaires sometimes casting eye picture hee thus spake countrie arcadia among prouinces greece hath euer beene singular reputation partly svveetnesse ayre naturall benefites principally vvell tempered mind people vvho finding shining title glorie much affected natiōs doth deed helpe little happinesse life onely people vvhich iustice prouidence geue neither cause hope neighbour annoy sturred vvith false praise trouble others quiet thinking small revvard retired himselfe wife child certaine forrest hereby calleth desert wherein besides house appointed stable lodging certaine person meane calling houshold seruices hath builded two fine lodge one selfe remaines younger daughter philoclea cause three matched together picture without hauing creature liuing lodge though bee straunge yet straunge course hee hath taken princesse pamela hath placed lodge thinke accompanied truly none one dametas arrant doltish clowne thinke euer without priuiledge bable wife miso daughter mopsa witt deuise anie thing wherein may pleasure exercise patience serue foile point hath obserues decorum hauing froward minde wretched body betweene two personage neuer agreed humor disagreeing issued foorth mistresse mopsa fitte woman participate perfection pleasant fellow acquaintance set foorth praise verse wil onely repeate spare mine owne tongue since go woman verse haue often caused song haue without booke length verse serue braue mopsas good shew whose vertues imagine rather faine pleasant deuise recount truth prince banished owne wit could possibly make vnworthie choise truely deare guest prince whose doings haue beene often soothed good successe thinke nothing absurde cannot make honourable beginning credite prince straying way one time hee hunted meeting fellow asking way falling question found answeres dog sure could speake wit enough describe kennell vnsensible vttered rudenes interpreted plainnesse though great difference betweene basilius conceauing sodaine delight tooke court apparant shew good opinion flattering courtier sooner taken prince minde straight reason confirme prince shadowes vertues found dametas silence grew wit bluntnesse integritie beastly ignorance vertuous simplicitie prince according nature great person loue done himselfe fancied weaknesse presence would much mended like creature owne making hee liked thus hauing first giuen office principall heardman lastly since tooke strange determination hee hath manner put life himselfe child hand authoritie like great sayle small boate doth ouersway poore dametas weare good foole chamber might bee allowed comedie doubt mee feare deede master end cost finde office make men vse men men horse taught hunt asse mannage sooth afraid haue geuen eares great surfette grosse discourse heauie peece flesh zealous greefe conceue see great error lord hath made bestowe word confesse base subiect deserueth thus much haue tolde nothing effect arcadian know moued strange solitarines hath bin imparted thinke one person liuing selfe coniecture deede coniecture accident tell haue onely sonne name clitophon absent preparing owne mariage meane shortly shalbe celebrated sonne mine prince kept court bedchamber since breaking vp thereof returned home shewed among thing gathered coppie hee taken letter prince read laid windowe presuming body durst looke writing sonne tooke time read copie trueth blamed clitophon curiositie made breake dutie kind whereby king secret subiect reuealed since done content take much profite know letter euer since good liking haue caried read vnto must tell came nobleman countrie named philanax appointed prince regent time retiring worthy liues man whose excellent witte simplye imbraseth integritie beesides vnfained loue master wherein neuer yet could make question sauing whether loued basilius prince better rare temper men either seruilely yeeld appetite obstinate austeritie looking fansie good effect neglect prince person man whome worthie prince cheefly loues seeme letter haue ghesse prince vpon returne delphos philanax lying sick written vnto determination rising euidently appeares vpon oracle hee receaued whereunto wrote answere philanax letter basilius redouted beloued prince aswel pleased going delphos haue vsed humble seruice better season better purpose haue spoken speech preuailed haue time way danger much quietnes would haue saide wisdome vertue destiny appointed man follow whence wee ought seeke knowledge since guide cannot faile besides inwarde comfort lead direct way proceeding either prosperitie must ensue wickednes world oppresse neuer said euil happeneth falles accompanied vertue would haue said heauenly power reuerenced serched mercy rather praiers sought hidden councels curiositie kind soothsaying since haue left v ourselues sufficient guide nothing fansie wherein must either vanitie infalliblenes either respected preuented since weakenes much remember haue beene done commandemēt stretcheth know done deare lord humble boldnes say manner determination doth sorte better please cause going thirtie yeares haue gouerned region nether subiectes haue wanted iustice obedience neighbour haue found hurtlesly strong though better rest friendshippe make new trial enmitie haue proceeded good constitution state wise prouidence generally preuent thing might encōber happines vvhy novv seeke nevve course since ovvne ensample comfort continue certaine though please tell vvords oracle yet destinie inflvence vvhatsoeuer bring man vvit higher point vvisdome goodnes vvhy depriue selfe gouernment feare loosing gouernmēt like one kil selfe • feare death nay rather oracle accoūted arm vp courage yt vvho vvil sticke abandones selfe let subiects haue eye let see benefites iustice dayly must needes rather like present surety vncertaine change lastly whether time loue betweene lippes would daintiest eloquence stirre pittie towarde philoxenus vvhy sure said selfe helen afraid hart cannot vvant pittie vvhen vvould extoll deed philoxenus vvho indeede vvaited therin ala thought good philoxenus hovv euil doth become thy name subscribed letter vvhat saie nay vvhat say noble knight vvho ashamed nay delighted thus expresse mine ovvne passion dayes paste eagernes friend neuer decreased affection euer increased length vvay ordinarie curtesie obteined vvho suspected matter picture onely amphialus feare shall euer enioy grovven bolder madder bould vvith madnes discouered affection vnto lord shall neuer forget anger curtesie one instant apeared eye vvhen harde motion hovv vvith blush taught shame summe left nothing vnassayed vvhich might disgrace himselfe grace friēd svveet termes making receiue resolute refusall himselfe found presence far perswade himselfe speeche could doo frend hee left court hoping forgetfulnesse commonly wait vpon absence woulde make roome friende whome hee woulde vtter thus much thinke kinde feare grieue perchance though care litle certain honorable gratefulnes yet discouer much secret seeme meant trauell farre countryes vntill friend affectiō either ceased preuailed within philoxenus came see onward fruites friend labour trueth cared much tooke found sitting beholding picture know affectionate countenance sure affectionate mind straight found ielousie disdaine tooke holde yet froward paine mine owne harte made mee delight punish esteemed chiefest let way humble gesture vehement speech sued fauor told would heare willingly hee woulde speake amphialus well amphialus done neuer answered pale quaking went straight away straight heart misgaue euill successe yet though authoritie inough haue stayed fatall thinges falles hieworking power make second cause vnwittingly accessarie determination sent footman mine whose faithfulnes knew place place follow bring word proceeding ala haue brought foorth feare must euer rewe hee trauailed scarsea dayes iorney countrey farre place ouertooke amphialus succouring distressed lady bene stayed called fight protesting one two die may easily iudge straunge amphialus whose hart could accuse selfe fault much affection towarde refusing fight woulde faine haue made philoxenus vnderstand seruant since tolde amphialus went back followed calling traytor coward yet neuer telling cause strange alteration ah philoxenus saide amphialus know traytor thou well knowest coward pray thee content thy selfe much let satisfie thee loue thee since beare thus much thee hee leauing wordes drew sworde gaue amphialus great blow two goodnes armour would haue slaine yet farre amphialus containe himselfe stepping aside saying well philoxenus thus much villany content put vp longer thy sake haue cause loue since thou dost iniury mee wilt tell cause thy vertuous father sake much bound pray thee goe awaye conquer thy owne passion thou shalt make mee soone yeeld thy seruant would attend wordes still strake fiercely amphialus end nature preuailing aboue determination faine defend selfe withall offend vnluckye blow poore philoxenus fell dead feete hauing time onely speake wordes whereby amphialus knew sake amphialus sawe forthwith gaue token true felt sorrow seruant said imagination could conceiue greater woe vnhappye occasion made amphialus passe himselfe sorrow philoxenus newelie dead come thesame place aged vertuous timotheus hauing heard sonnes sodaine passionate manner parting court followed speedily coulde ala speedily hee founde dead hee coulde ouertake though heart bee nothing stage tragedy yet must confesse euen vnable beare miserable representation thereof knowing amphialus timotheus haue done ala sorrowe amasement shame amphialus hee sawe deere foster father finde killer onely sonne heart knowe hee wished mountaines laine vpon keepe meeting timotheus sorrow sonne thinke principally vnkindenesse amphialus deuoured vitall spirites able say amphialus amphialus haue sancke earth presently died tongue though daily vsed complaint heart nothing sorrow turned tongue durst vndertake shew vnspeakeablenes griefe serues make know fortune threw away armour euen haue vppon first sight vainely hoped hee put againe ashamed light hee ranne thickest wood lamenting euen cry pitifully seruant though fortune vsed much tendernes could refraine weeping told ouertooke amphialus drawing sword onely part armes god knowes purpose carried threatned kil followed withal bad deliuer bitter message wel inough found cause mischiefe man would go ouer world kill bad assure myselfe creature world hated mee ah sir knight whose eares think time tired rugged way misfortune weigh case least know loue cause haue left countrie putting hazard people time deale aduenturing perilles dishonor might ensue onely follow proclaimeth hate bring necke vnto may redeeme trespasse asswage fury sir saide haue request pray take paine guide next towne may gather company againe valor hath left palladius willingly condiscended ere began go came clitophon hauing bene something hurt one pursued good way length ouertaking ready kill vnderstoode seruants faire queene helen cause enterprise nothing make amphialus prisoner whō knew mistresse sought concealed sorrow cause sorrow frō body clitophon sory accident came backe comfort queene helping hurt best sort could framing friendly construction rashly vndertaken enmitie come till time vnseene armed beuer downe first looking round vpon cōpany soone spied palladius drew sword therein daring open creature euer spake hart made silent complaintes within selfe sens attentiue thereto cunning iudges might perceaue minde hee knowne loue though hee denied rather better knowne hee conclusion ill apparelled knight haue precedence deliuered figure mistresse phalantus asking certainely said liueliest picture could see hart best comparison could make sunne heauenly beauty perhappes gaine concluded sport basilius see young folkes loue came maskt great pompe goe little constancie phalantus first professing great seruice basilius curteous intermitting solitary course sake would yet conduct artesia castle cecropia whether desired goe vowing himselfe neither hart mouthloue euer intangle resolution left company whence dismissed among black knight went away repining luck kept winning honor knew haue done picture pamela ill apparelled knight desired stay basilius meant shew zelmane puld helmet knowen himselfe zelmane morning told others busie stolne prince stable mile lodge gotten horse knowing basilius pleasure obeyed borrowing homely armour want better come vpon spur redeeme philocleas picture said could beare one little wildernessecompany captiuitie cunning learned countrye noble amazon could withstand vnder pretext faine would haue giuen secret pasport affection act painted one instant rednesse philocleas face palenesse gynecias brought forth countenance admiration speech commendation besides loue thinking honoured themselues honouring accomplished person zelmane dayly sought sport delight purpose basilius house farre • seruants though came vncalled yet call redye many day spent many way vsed zelmane like one stoode tree waiting good occasion shoot gynecia blauncher kept dearest deere day come according apointed course sheapheards assemble make pastorall sport afore basilius zelmane fearing lest many eye comming diuers way might hap spy musidorus went warne thereof could come arbour sawe walking herward man sheapperdish apparrell sight lodge might seeme allowed long cloke cast vnder right arme wherein held sheephooke finely wrought gaue brauery pouerty rayments though meane yet receiued hansomnes grace wearer though himselfe went kinde languishing pace eies sometimes cast vp heauen though fancy straue mount higher sometimes throwne downe ground earth could beare burthen sorrowes length lamentable tune song fewe verse come shepheards weedes become master minde yeld outward shew inward change tryes abasht since guest finde whose strongest hope weake comfort lye come shepheards weedes attend woefull cryes disuse selues sweete menalcas voice tune sorrow tyes cleere note freely may reioyce power plaint oneword say helples plaint spoyles himselfe blisse hauing ended strake himselfe brest saying miserable wretch whether thy destenies guide thee voice made zelmane hasten pace ouertake hauing done plainly perceaued deare friend musidorus whereat maruailing little demaunded whether goddesse wood powre transforme euery body whether enterprise else done meant thus match newe alteration ala said musidorus shall say loth say yet faine would haue said find indeed lipwisdome want experience woe try loue doo zelmane resist must either haue wit put eye man resist creation certainely loue made loue made beast cannot discerne beauty let role beast doo honor perfect friendship zelmane bare great pitie good triall case could keepe smiling remembring vehemently cryed folly louers therefore litle punish deere cousin said last day hie pulpit louers become meane auditor remember loue passion worthie man reason must euer haue masterhood recant recant cryed musidorus withall falling downe prostrate thou celestiall infernall spirit loue heauenly hellish title thou list haue effect finde selfe haue compassion let thy glory great pardoning submitted thee conquering rebellious saide zelmane see well enough make enterlude mishap doo counterfaite thus make see deformitie passion take heede iest one day turne earnest beseech thee said musidorus taking • ast hand euen truth friendship altogether vnhappy man thou hast rememberance secret flame know haue likewise neerely touched thee make iest hath ernestly pearced thorow let light thee burdenous able beare musidorus word behauiour liuely deliuer inward griefe zelmane found indeede thorowly wounded rose new ielousy minde lest might philoclea whome zelmane thought right harte eye inherited therefore desirous cleered doubt musidorus shortly hast full passionate perplexednes thus recounted case vnto day said parted mind returne towne whence came hether horse tired would scarce beare mile hence benighted light candle saw good way guided young shepheards house name menalcas seing straying stranger right honest hospitalitie seemes harboured arcadian brest though curious costlines yet cleanly sufficiencie entertained hauing talke found manner countrie something particular kalanders report agreed soiourne secret faithfully promised obserue hether arbour diuers time repaired meanes sight neuer bene nay might euer goddesse definite compasse set forth infinite beauty zelmane racked iealousie went saide lying close truth thinking saying thus selfe sweet pyrocles art thou bewitched thy vertue vse thy reason much inferior thee state mind yet know heauens cannot bring thraldome scarcely thinke spoken word whē lady came foorth sight thinke word returned backe againe strike soule least vnmeasurable sting felt selfe spokē word sight said zelmane able beare longer said musidorus know suspition banish feare must pamela safe sayd zelmane proceede deare musidorus said impute late solitarie life yet prone affection much thinking though cald consideration loue mind euer neglected exaltation venus reuenge cupid euen planet nay goddesse onely shield must sepulchre first saw presently striken like foolish child thing hit strike himselfe againe vpon would need looke againe though would perswade mine eye deceiued ala well haue found loue yeelding hart king resisting tyrant argument shaked stake planted ground harte deeper still sanke meane speake cause loue impossible describe measure backside heauen let word suffice loue may know doo came black armour defende picture preuented beaten waited seruice haue selfe need succor whereupon got selfe aparrell said zelmane forgotten tell said musidorus though one principall matter speech much master owne minde thus happened returned menalcas house full tormenting desire faynting vnder weight courage stird vp wit seeke releefe yeelded perish last came head euening purpose last vsed horse armour tolde menalcas thessalian gentleman mischaunce hauing killed great fauorit prince country pursued cruelly place either fauour corruption would obtaine destruction therefore determined till fury persecutor might asswaged disguise selfe among shephards arcadia possible one allowed prince presence woorst fall discouered yet hauing gotten acquaintance prince might happen moue hart protect menalcas honest disposition pittied case face inward torment made credible giuing largely let haue rayment instructing particularity touching himselfe selfe desired know yet trusting much constancie would lay life life life vpon hired goe thessalia friend mine deliuer letter coniuring bring speedy answere could imported greatly know whether certaine friend yet possesse fauour whose intercession might vse restitution willingly tooke letter well sealed indeed conteyned matter wrote trustie seruant calodoulus whome know assoone deliuered letter keepe prisoner house suffering haue conference regarded first againe finde moste sweete affection snare like tune quire sent backe againe sweete sower dispairefull care third time likewise thus dispaire hope doth beare answere hope feeles despaire round sight power inuoke dwelles eye charme haunt day night dorus farre case ô muse sorrow try bent one whome selfe must say nothing mend point lie circle rare force beares sway whose sprite sprite foile raise damne saue charme holdes hir well possesse may possesse doth make soule slaue eye bandes thought fatall knot thrall like inward bondage haue thyrsis kala length conclude lingring lotte disdaine although faire heir many hundreth sheep doth beawties keep neuer sunne burne stormes doo turne fairnes serues oft wealth yet health place good ô doo bestow see still shall finde constant kind sheep foode shall breed wooll weede musique yeeld flowrie field day begin twentie ginnes small bird take pastime make nature thing hath made shade meete mirtle bowes loue allowes pleasure enrich thought doth passe worldlie pelfe dorus lady selfe whome neither name dare title spot worth heare plaint come forth dungeon mind noblest kinde reiects others woe haue shewes wealth wealth beauty hewe beames health deed minde weed vertues liuerie weares foode teares tune wamenting yeeld dispaire fielde flower spirit warrs day new care ginnes daily sight doe light small bird thought orethrowne pastime none time passeth fall nature made dolour made find shade sunne doth burne place turne without within fry helpe life death liuing dye thyrsis kala thus sute denyes much reason beares let crowes pick mine eye much sawe shee still hate loues lawe earthy mould doth melt watrye teares dorus earthy mould doth melt watrye teares againe resolue aire sighes sighes harte fire turne doth ash burne thus doth life within selfe dissolue thyrsis thus doth life within selfe dissolue growe like beaste beares bytt weaker force doth guide yet patient must abide weight hath full possest dorus weight hath full possest become vision hath others head liues fancie seing wretched state man selfe diuision thyrsis wretched state man selfe diuision well thou saiest feeling declaration thy toong hath made cupid deepe incision hoarse voyce doth faile occupation others long tell loues condicion singing thou hast got reputation dorus singing thou hast got reputation good thyrsis mine yeld thy abilitie hart doth seek estimation ah muse would thou hadst facilitie worke goddesse thy inuention cast eye shine nobilitie seene vnknowne hearde without attention dorus well answering thyrsis euery one desired heare sing something alone seing therfore lute lying vnder princesse pamelas feete glad haue errand approch came came dismaied grace bloud stirred betwixt feare desire playing vpon sweetenes euery bodie wondered see skill shepeheard sang vnto sorrowing voice elegiake verse dorus — fortune nature loue long haue contended misery cast worme — fortune thus gan say misery misfortune one misfortune fortune hath gift — strong foe land sea contrary tempest still doo crosse wretch taketh hand — tush tush said nature trifle man selfe giues happs mishapps eun ordreth hearte — humor frame mould choller adusted delight life shall dolorouse — loue smiled thus said want ioynd desire vnhappy nought desire heraclitus aile — none workes desire desire haue kindled soule infernall agony vnto bewtye diuine — thou poore nature leftst thy due glory fortune vertue soueraine fortune vassal — nature abasht went back fortune blusht yet replide thus eun loue shall reserue spite — thus thus ala wofull nature vnhappy fortune wretched loue awakes desire dorus soong hauing free beholding faire pamela could well haue spared honor defended assault gaue vnto hir face bringing faire staine shamefastnes vnto let fall armes remained fastened thought pamela graffed growe continuall imagination zelmane espying fearing much forget himselfe came tooke hand lute laying fast hold philocleas feares abash still possible hope nature seeme rebell seeme fooles vaine sute vnheard condemnd kept thence seeke abide selfelost wandring banished place doe come meane ala hope losse recouer place left may hope woe recomfort vnto heauns wing short earth think v burden aire still sighes encrease fire want none yet outward heate teares would quench inward fire liquor coole neptune realme would auaile v happy shepheard thanks god still thinke thankfull thy aduauncement wisdomes haue thee abased dorus vnto god thanckfull heart thankes render aduauncement wisdomes haue abased yet ala yet ala happs hard happs must frame contempt fittest purchase honnour well may pastor plaine ala plaint esteemde silly shepheards poore pype harsh sound testifis anguish faire looker pastime passion enters wood brooke make dreery recitall pang beare whence pang deriued pleasd receaue name rebounding answere echo may hope therby ease inward horrible anguish tree daunce pype swift streames stay musicke echo begin vnmoud sing loue song say vantage get trade pastor since estate base loue vouchsafeth arrow since refuge doth serue woundes carry v since outward pleasure halting helpes decayd soules saue dayly may discerne fire burne farre happy whose greatnes get free accesse whose faire bodily gift framd louely ey vertue haue vertue haue left proofe whole world vertue gratefull bewty richnes adorned neither doubt awhit time passion vtter hardly remains fyer hid skill bent hiding minde would flame repressed nature worketh enough small help reuealing giue therefore muse great praise whose likenes doo approch fruite onely desirs gather zelmane first shall fertill ground yeeld increase good seed first riuers shall ceasse repay fludds occean first may trusty greyhounde transforme himselfe tigre first shall vertue vice bewty counted blemishe ere leaue song praise praise solemnize praise whence world praise hath beginning yet well doo finde man wise owne case none speake wound skill haue wound felt great thee state seemes thy state blest iudgement yet neither v great blest deemeth owne selfe yet weigh ala great great greater iudge doth hillocke shew lofty olympus minute greatnes doth seeme compard greatest cedar ground fall downe weight emmott rich ruby iust price worth walnut sun wonder seeme small spark candle high cedar rich ruby shining sunne vertue richesse beawties mine shall great reputed oh worthy shepeheard worth neuer enter title proofes iustly teach thus matcht worth nought worth let puppet abuse thy sprite king crownes helpe cruell headache shooes golde doo gowt heale preciouse couch full oft shakt feauer boddily euill boddily gloze hidden shall morning deaws ease heate loues fire dorus glittring misery man fortune fortune lull small rest rest kingdome maruaile tho prince transforme himselfe pastor come marble bowres many time gay harbor anguish vnto silly caban though weake yet stronger woe thy word begin famous lady gather comfort soule finde find blessing chaunced life muddy abundance carking agony state still adherent desteny keepes aloofe state thy vertue ioynd thy beauty adornd meanes greefes abolish neither helpe thou canst clime vp thy fancie yet fancy drest receiue plausible hearing thinke deed better priuate sorrow torment tyed pompes pallace nurse inwarde maladyes haue scope breathd • perforce disgest bitter ioyces horror silence man owne selfe company robbed better yet liue though thought plunged liues bondage yet • disburden passion opprest ruinouse conceites helpe outcrye limited whispringe note lament courtier sometimes wood somtimes heaun decyphire bolde clamor vnheard vnmarckt seeke suffer mee • e tree earth faire liuory clothed ease feele ease fall one wholy diseased finde parte state represented lawrell shews seeke mirre showd seeke oliue paintes peace must aspire conquest mirtle make request request crownd willowe cyprus promiseth helpe helpe come recomforte sweete iuniper saith thoh burne yet burne sweete fire evve doth make thinke kind bow boy holdeth shootes strongly noyse deadly without smarte • firr tree great greene sixt hye hill barrein lyke noble thoughtes still new well placd fruteles figge yeeldes pleasante frute shaddow hurtefull thus giftes sweet thus danger neere palme marke doth rise vnder burden may say gett vp though grief weightie pine maste shippe shippe shall hope maste serue pine hye hope hie sharpe leaud sharpe yet hope budds • elme embraste vine embracing fancy reuiueth popler changeth hew rising sunne setting thus sonne yeeld lookes beames aforde olde aged oke cutt downe newe work serues building desire feare cutt downe frame honour ashe make speares shieldes resist force repulse take palmes reioyce ioynd match male female shall sensiue thing sencelesse resist sence thus thought disperst thus thinking nurseth thinking thus tree thing ell bookes fancy cedar queene wood lifte beteard eye shape selfe forme raigns • thinke ther dwell heare plant vtter noble toppe doth nodd beleeue salute winde maketh noyse thinke doth answer kneling ground oft thus speake image onely iuell iuell deseruest men hart thy seate endlesse fame thy seruant descende greate height behold nought el behold else nought worth beholding saue worke thy selfe wrought since altred thus thy worke disdaine thy selfe done meane caues oft treasure abides hostry king come behinde foule clowdes full oft faire starres ly hidden zelmane hardy shephearde thy meritts may insight iustely graunt thee rewarde e • uie beare thy fortune selfe wish make salue sorrowes nature seemes debarr meanes helped meane found fortune thwhole course hinders plagde frame soare hope amendemente whence may show minde light possible escape bownd bownd noble bandes loth vnbownd iaylor selfe prison prisoner myne owne selfe yet hope thus plast fixd liues recomforte deare dyamond wisdome holdeth sure seate whose force force transforme nay reforme length perceaue flame beames kindled pitty wound festred strangely within graunte euent god euent giue sure sacrifice dayly oblation offer mine owne harte thought temple sighte aultar ceasse worthy shepheard nowe ceasse weery hearer monefull melody enough greefes reuealed party ment meaning rightly marked sorrow require respitt vnto sences exclaming praise basilius gaue ecloge man may ghesse knowes loue better paire spectacle make euery thing seeme greater sene neuer tongue tied fitt commendation whereof womankinde likerouse offered vnto came supplie place zelmane hauing heard shepheards chaunce name strephon klaius supposing thereby bene present desirous heare fame frindly loue know kindenesse towardes best loued frinde much grieued basilius desire mistresse bee vnsatisfied therefore represent vnto hir aswell absence might commaunded lamon large sett country pastime first loue vrania sing whole discourse manner shepheards tale height stile desire raise word effect lowe plaining songe plainesinging voice requires warbling note inward chearing flow whose burdned brest thus aspires shepheards two seely case show nede stately mus helpe inuoke creeping rime often sighings choke ô thinke teares deare spend harm although touch deigne deeme neighbor mischefe neare although meaner parent gott inuite easie eares heare pooreclad truth loues wrongordred lot may glad glad share woe weygh others haue much ther ô seldome blessed word paire frends rather one cald two traind life shortbitten grasse shine storme must sett doubted shoe yeares passe gift year distribute doe klaius cald ah klaius wofull wight later borne yet soone strephon hight epeirus high honest klaius nest strephon aeoles land first breathing lent east west ioind frendships hest strephons eare heart klaius bent klaius soule strephon rest still flock flocking togither went would owner humour eke pipe well frends agree klaius skill hearbs shepheards art among wisest accounted wise yet wise vnstained harte strephon yonge yet markt humble eies elder ruld flock curd smart graue word despise free minde cleardealing loue skill verse voice moue chearfull mind till poisned cheare honest sport earthy lodging proue clodlike hare fourm peere bolt cudgill squirrel leape moue ambitiouse larke mirror cleare catch foole make loue keel trie harmles chaunce curr teach fetch daunce mery may first early call morne mery maid mayeng go pull sharpe niggard thorne plenteous sweet sweet sharply grow grene gown lass worne chastest play till home walke rowe daunce maypole begun nede could quintain run thus ran low leaueld race thus liud indede life nature pleasd content present case free proud feares braue beggry smiling strife climefall court enuyhatching place restles desire great men rife visite low folkes much disdaine though poore themselues raigne one day ô day shinde make darke ward sunbeames shady bay klaius taking yongling carke lest greedy eies might challenge lay busy oker shoulder marke marke piller deuoid stay bragging free passion mone well might others beare leane none strephon leauy twiggs laurell tree garland made temple weare chosen dignitie villagelord whitsontide beare full poore foole boyish brauery triumph shews would shew nought feare foreaccounting oft make builder misse found felt lease blisse ere either purpose done behold beholding well doth deserue saw maid thitherward runne catch hir sparrow hir swerue blacksilke cap begunne sett foile milkewhite serue chirping ran peeping flew away till hard stay well see kept themselues vnsene saw fairest maid fairer minde fortune meare nature borne queene well apaid hir birde finde tenderly hir tender hand betweene iuory cage micher binde rosy moistned lipps beake mouing seemd kisse speake chastned thus thus lesson tought happy wretch putt hir breast eies bowles venus brought seemd made euen skiemettall best bias hir bloud wrought betwixt two peeper tooke nest snugging well well appeard content haue done amisse shent done done captiuekilling grace motion seeming shott beauty bow length laid downe deckt lonely place proud grew grasse vnder hir growe tree spred armes shade hir face elbow leand sigh show grasse tree yet hir sparrow might longperplexed minde breed long delight troubled ala mought tedious brawlings parent deare would haue hir worde agree wedd antaxius neighbour neare heardman rich much account whome euill raigne good appeare one likd desire faine would free dreadeth parent ire kindly sweete soule vnkindnes take bagged baggage miser mudd price hir market make golde guild rotten piece wood yeeld found hir noble heart ake striue feard vertue stoode doubting cloud orecasting heaunly braine length rowes kissecheeke teares raine cupid wagg lately conquerd wise counsellor stout captaines puissant king tide fast leade triumph badd glutted play meanest thing oft feast costly chaunges cladd crammed mawes spratt new stomake brings lord sport stagg hearon full sometimes vse small bird nest pull pray shepheards two tooke whose mettall stiff knew could bende hearsay picture window looke one good dawnce letter finely pend court well proportiond hooke piercing witts quickly apprehend sences rude plaine obiects moue must see great cause loue therfore loue armd hir take fielde making hir beames brauery might hir hand piercd soules seaundouble shield dart leauing wonted fight braue crest hir scorngold haire yeeld compleat harneis hir purest white fearing lest white might seeme good cheek lipps tyran threatens bloud besides force within hir eies kept fire burne prisoner gaines whose boiling heat encreased wept eun forge colde water fire maintaines thus proud fierce vnto heart stept poore soules cutting reason raines made owne wist could shephookes resist klaius streight felt groned blowe cald wounded purpose aide strephon fond boy delighted knowe loue shinde shining maid lickrous poisond faine would goe newlearned manner staid vrania homeward arise leauing paine welfed hungry eies went staid rightly say staid went thought hyr klaius deede would faine haue puld way mote eye inward burre proud rebell gan gainsay lesson late learnd furre meaning absence refresh thought hir presence feauer brought strephon leape ioy iolitie thinking iust therein delight good dog faire field shading tree haue sene trim bookes veluet dight golden leaues painted babery seely boy please vnacquainted sight rod began play part faine would could fly golden smart quickly learnd vrania name streight failing graud heart knew hir haunt haunted taught shepe hir shepe food thwart soone batefull question frame might knee confesse faulty part yeeld himselfe vnto hir punishment nought game selfehurt wanton ment nay eun vnto hir home oft would go bold hurtles many play try parent liking well simple goodnes shined eye make hir laugh spite woe good thought arise none doubt loue sinke himselfe loue thinke glad desire late embosomd guest yet babe milke sight nurst desire suckt sought brest like dropsy folke still drinke thyrst till one faire eaun howr ere sun rest lion caue enter fyrst neighbor praid went abroad therby barly brake hir swete swift foot trie neuer earth round shoulder bare maid traind vp high low degree doings better could compare mirth respect word curtesy careles comelines comely care selfgard mildnes sport maiesty made hir yeeld deck shepheards band still beleue strephon hand field goe many looker thou sekesorow klaius among dede thou saidst thy frend see strephon whose absence seemd vnto thee long hir lesse kepe thee spite wisdomes song absence wisht loue plaid victor part heaunloue lodestone drew thy iron hart couple three streight allotted end middle two doe flie two mid place hell called must striue waiting foot watching eye catch hell beare aswell hell may supplie like seeke salue blotted name others blott till tast shame may see soone middle two coupled towards either couple make false fearfull hand vndoe brother brother frend doth frend forsake heeding himselfe care fellow doe straunger mutuall help doth take periurd coward aduersity sight feare frends frembd flie sport shepheards deuizd fault show geron though olde yet gamesome kept one ende cosma whose loue pa past woe faire nous pa lott hell sende pa thought hell cosma fro end vran strephon lend happymaking hand whome one looke nous cosma beauty tooke play began pa durst cosma chace entend next bout meete nous geron turnd race whome ioyne fast ran vrania sweet lightlegd pa gott middle space geron straue hard aged foot therfore finding force faint thought gray haires afforded subtletie pa handreached take fox knee elbowes tombled downe pa could stay ouer rake crownd earth first touching crowne heel grown proud seme heaun shake nous slipt pa catch clowne laughing yet pa ease dell geron vran condemnd hell cosma strephon safely came second barlybrake bent two hell toward cosma frame pa would preuent pa mad fall madder shame mad beames thought cosma sent mad haste cosma goe hir breast gaue noysome blowe quick proud pa despise vp hir fist tooke face another time quoth become wise thus pa kisse hir hand little grace way luckles yet humble guise hold hir fast feare disgrace strephon might preatie nous haue met another course fet vrania cosma ran rauished sight gracefully moud hir lims drew aged man left nous coast loued beauty ny nous cride chafd till vran seing pa cosma fly strephon single turned strephon chasd seme milke swimme ran ran eye ore shoulder cast marking hir himselfe goe like numid lion hunter chasd though fly yet backwardly glowe proud aspect disdaining greater hast rage loue show god giues instinct man shun law barlybrake must run heate running augment much sight encreast hote desire best nature spent aire hir swete race moud doth blow fire hir foot purseuants cupid sent whose fine stepps loues ioyes conspire hidden beauty seemd waite lye downe proud heart would willing dye thus fast fled followd sore still shunning nous lengthen pleasing race till spied old geron could slack loueenstructed pace vrán whose arme old geron bore laid hold layholding grace caught seemd caught ioyes bel • thought heaun drawn hell hell go nous must dwell nous sware right default would caught go hell must third assault barlybrake among six befell pa cosma matcht yet angry fault end geron vrán garde thinke thinke strephon bent thitherward nous counseld strephon geron pursue olde easly would cought drew hir loue fancy drew take gemme vrania sought geron olde came safe cosma true though meete sturred nought pa whither feare loue moud himselfe suffred hir moue three togither idly stay deare vrán whose course pa meet staying thus faine abroad stray larger round shun folowing foot strephon whose eies hir backparts play loue drawne fast pace vnmeet drew dainty nous able runne brake hand let goe single thus hopd soone hir nothing earthly fire aire though soft leggs run fast thrise reacht thrise deceiud hir beare hope dainty turn doth flee down see neere wilton faire hastned hare greedy grayhound goe past hope chapps frustrate straunge race straunge conceit yeeld victor seemd ruine brought seemd orethrown mistresse field fled tooke folowd cought haue heard pierce pursuing shield parent traind tartar wilde tought shaft shott backturned bow ah hir dart farre depely goe venus bird white swift louely doue happy doue art compard hir doth hir wing hir vtmost swiftnes proue finding gripe falcon fierce furr vran narr swifter moue yet beauty still fast sturre till long race deare breathles brought phoenix feared cought among rest take delight see sportes doubleshining day tribute wondring sight nature heir faire vrania pay tolde klaius haples wight earnest found accounted play doe homage eies eies heart sacrifise gazing look short sigh vnsettled foot stood turnd girosol sun fancy still hir halfway meet soule fly seen run sum proud boreas neuer ruled fleet neptune webb daungers distaff spun greater powr make wend way age praise bend till spieng well welnigh weary surely taught loueopen eye eye eun marke hir troden grasse would faine catch strephon flie giuing reason pasport passe whither would would let dy shund hir shun harmes runnes take hir clipping armes pretence strephon hir garde met hir full full warefulnes inbowd bosome well hir prepard strephon cursing owne backwardnes came hir back double warde emprison hir possesse heartbound slaues happy embrace vertues proofe fortune victor beauty place hir race hir beauty beames augment euer best degree yet setting foorth way lent ruby lustre rubbed dainty dew face body went sweet flowrs morning drop see breath short seemd loth home pa moud sweeter happy ô happy might bide see hir eies true humblenes looked triumph ouer pride sweet sawes blamd sawcines feele panting heart hir syde beate hand durst neere presse see feele heare tast know besides hir earth could show neuer medea golden weed creon child poison sooner throw delight sinew breed creeping serpentlike mortall woe till brake armes although deed going could go farewelling flocke homeward wend euen barlybrake end ended others woe began began least conceiud woe wise klaius found absence help hir sight foregoe found man vertue part man part must folowe whole man doth goe found reason self reason found fasten knotts fancy first bound doth yeeld take yoke knowing draw therin strephon poore youth saw smoke conceiue fire within greater rage broke till life full conquest win first killing mirth banishing rest filling eies teares sigh brest sport grew paine talking tediouse thought feed lookes figure chaunge day seemes long night odious sleep dream dream vision straunge till finding still euill encreasing thus one day flock abroad raunge comming hopd alone thus hillock set made mone ala weight lode heart dull wintersterued sheep tirde iade ouerloden carte yet thought flie though scarcely creep vision seeme euery bush start drowsy yet rarely slepe sure bewitched euen late neere crosse met ougly cat charm fall thing eies heaunly apple bene eies nothing like themselues see faire vrania fairer greene proudly bedeckt aprills liuory shot vnheard gaue wound vnseene inuisible hurt none vnuisible spirites goe see sinewes shake feare yet deare soule know hurteth none amid flock woe voice teare bewitchd flock would mone chery lipps milke hand golden haire still see though still alone make thinke fende hid angel shape lîfe would ende sportes wherin wonted well come sweet aire open brest faile would well amazd fellowes iest sometimes newes selfe tell go best wry word stamring el doltish dombe say enchantment come nay thing bewitcht know case nightingale woe song refraine riuer lookd pining face pind face mine saw againe courteous mountaines grieud disgrace snowy haire teare melting paine dropping tree wepe faire euenings blush shame see pipe whilome chief delight till straunge delight delight nothing ware flock care carefull sight cause care thou dogg whose truth valiant might made wolues inward wolues ewe spare go master woe let suffise himselfe forgoe though like waxe magique make waste like lambe whose dam away fet stolne yoong theeues vnchoosing hast treble beas helpe none get though thus worse though last game ere met remember still mine till eies curse blessed • ine vnheard cry score loss winde heart write ere die wit binde still aye flie sprite fancy blinde doth daily ha • nt mine become much louing lesse combersome ala cloud hath ouercast mine eies yet see shine amid cloud ala ghostes heare gastly cry yet seemes heare singing loud song singe commaunding wise come shepheards boy let thy heart bowd make selfe least looke slaue leaue sheepe leaue piecing haue ala ala wilt thou haue haue away raggd ram care murraine kill shreaking pipe made • ome witched tree go bawling curre thy hungry maw go fill yond foule flocke belonging dogge henst flocke curst yet kissed first pipe burst said done rase euen tird rest heart carefull carelesse grace shrinking legges swelling brest eye threatned would drowne face fearing worst knowing best giuing sight wandring race saw behind bush klaius sate well knowne friend yet vnknowne mate klaius wretch lately yelden beare bondes time wit could breake blushing soule sight iudgements glasse guilty thought accusd reason weake morne alone lonely walke passe himselfe hir deare self • speake till strephons planing voice nearer drew word selflike cause knew hearing oft wordes woe vrania name whose force knew well quickly knew witchcraft gaue blow made strephon think himselfe hell perfect image show owne witt thought vpon thought swell breeding huge stormes inward parte thus breathd earthquake hart lamon would haue proceded basilius knowing wasting torch night also farre wasted withall remembring zelmanes hurt asked hir whither thought better reserue complaint klaius till day perceiuing song alreadie worne much time knowing lamon would ende euen stepping ouer new matter though much delig • ted spoken willingly agreed vnto side went recommend themselues elder brother death end first booke second booke covntesse pembroke arcadia pastorall pastime great number day sent follow flying predecessours cup poison deepely tasted noble companie left sinewe without mortally searching yet neuer manifesting venomous work til night parting away angry could distill sleepe eies louers sooner giuen place breaking morning light sunne bestowed beames vpon top mountaines woefull gynecia rest ease left loathed lodging gotten selfe solitary place desert full going vp downe vnquiet motion grieued hopeles minde wont bring forth appeered vnto eies iudgement euils like run ougly infamie waiting vpon shee felt terror owne conscience shee guilty long exercised vertue made vice fuller deformitie vttermost good could aspire vnto mortal woūd vexed spirit lastly small part euils wise see euils much hauing great throwne countenaunce ghastly shee called power world witnesse wretched estate length casting vp watrie eye heauē sunne said whose vnspotted light directs step mortall mankind art thou ashamed impart clearnesse thy presence dustcreeping worme heauens continually keepe course allotted vnto none influence preuaile much vpon miserable gynecia make preserue course long imbraced desert desert fita guest since hart people wild rauenous beastes wanting vertue doost thou hide thy selfe hideous thinge doeth eclips thee true thou weart neuer vaine name essentiall thing hast thus left thy professed seruant need thy louely presence imperfect proportiō reason much foresee little preuent ala ala said one hope paine one excuse faultinesse wretch torment beyond succour euill deseruing doth exceed euill fortune nothing el husband take straunge resolution liue solitarily nothing el haue windes deliuered straunge guest country nothing el haue destiny reserued life time onely wretched become plague selfe shame womankind yet desire vniust euer might take effect though thousand death folowed euery death followed thousand shame yet sepulcher receiue mee without contentment ala though sure zelmane answer loue yet sure disguising must need come foretaken cōceipt wretched gynecia canst thou find small ground plot hope dwel vpon philoclea hart sett vpō daughter haue borne supplant bee life haue giuen thee vngratefull philoclea sooner handes bereaue thee birth shall glory hath bereaued desire shame comfort bee beyond bound shame hauing spoken thus began make piteous war hir faire haire might heare far frō extremely dolefull voice suppressed kind whispering note could conceaue wordes distinctly lamentable tune sweetest musicke wofull mind shee drewe thether heereaway hope find companiō misery paced stopped number tree thickly placed together afraide shee rushing thorow stop speach lamentable partie shee desirous vnderstand therefore setting downe softlie could distaunce heare might first perceaue lute excellentlie well played vppon dolefull voyce accompanyinge verse vaine mine eye labour amende flowing teares fault hasty sight since hart shape sende see though lose light vaine hart sight burnd sighes seeke coole hotte desire since sighes mine inward fornace turnd bellowes serue kindle fire reason vaine haue lost hart head seeke strongest forte since mine eye haue played false parte strength foe haue sure resorte since vaine find strife strange death vainely yeeld life ending song serued beginning new plaint mind oppressed heauy burthē care faine discharge self al side paint hideousnes paine sortes coulours wofull person lute euill ioined voice threw ground like word ala poore lute much art thou deceiud think misery thou couldst ease woe careles time thou wont please fancy time changed lute time changed ioyfull minde receiue euery thing ioyful consideration carefull mind make ech thing tast like bitter iuyce care evill inward lute euill inward thou doost doth serue make thinke freely ala thy harmony sweete meat sorrow discord thought lute doth ill agree concord thy string therefore ashamed leaue thy master since hee afraide forsake himselfe thus much spoke steede conclusion closed vp harty groning gynecia could refraine shew selfe thinking griefes could serue fitly nothing owne fortune came little arbour sorrowful musicke eye met eye zelmane party thus indited selfe miserie either remained cōfused sodaine astonishment zelmane fearing least heard part complaint risen vp morning early purpose breath secret selfe gynecia great stood still kind dull amasement looking stedfastly vpon length returning vse selfe began aske zelmane cause carried early abroad opening mouth zelmane opened great floodgate sorrow whereof heart could abide violēt issue sanke ground hāds ouer face cry vehemently zelmane helpe zelmane haue pittie zelmane ranne maruelling sodaine sicknesse thus possessed beginning aske cause paine offering seruice imployed gynecia opening eye wildly vpon pricked flame loue torment owne conscience zelmane zelmane said doost thou offer phisicke art poyson wilt thou doo seruice hast alredy brought eternall slauerie zelmane knowing well marke shee shot yet loth enter excellēt ladie said best retire selfe lodging better • ay passe sodaine fitte retire selfe said gynecia retyred selfe selfe thou vnfortunate guest camest draw selfe blessed bene neede counsaile ala forced flie thee succour accuse hurt make thee iudge cause art author mischiefe zelmane astonished vnderstood madam said whereof accuse cleere selfe wherein may steed may command ala answered gynecia shall say take pitty zelmane zelmane disguise word know thou doost apparell zelmane much troubled worde finding selfe brought streight thinking answere might see olde basilius passe harde without euer seeing complayning likewise loue freshly ending complaint song loue hauing renewed inuention voyce let old age disgrace high desire heauenly soule humaine shape conteind old wood flamde doth yeeld brauest fire yonger dooth smoke vertue spend ne let white haires face doo grow seeme eye disgracefull hewe since whitenesse doth present sweetest show make eye doo homage vnto old age wise full constant truth old age well stayed raunging humor liues old age hath knowne euer youth old age orecome greater honour giues old age since selfe aspire let old age disgrace high desire done looked verie curiously vpon himselfe somtimes fetching little skippe saide strength yet forsaken zelmane hauing time gotten leasure thinke answere looking vpon gynecya thought wrong madam said acquainted word disguising neither profession amazon neither partie bee vsed seruice may please imploy long wrong misiudgeing mee ala zelmane said gynecia perceiue know full little howe percing eye true louer one beame thought haue planted able discerne greater cloude doo goe seeke conceale selfe mee force passion loue violent extremity nowe zelmane brought exigent king turning eye waye thorow tree perceiued wife mistres togither framing louely countenance hee could hee came straightway towardes first word thanking wife hauing entertained zelmane desired shee woulde returne lodge hee certaine matter estate impart ladie zelmane queene nothing troubled ielousie point obeyed kinges commaundement full raging agony determinately bent would seeke louing meanes winne zelmane woulde stirre vp terrible tragedy rather faile intent went lodgeward battaile thought deadly • ouerthrow giuen best resolution euen bodie fielde fought oppressed withall making languishing sickenesse waite vpon triumph passion preuailed made ielousie watchfull ouer daughter zelmane hauing euer one entrusted owne eye soone basilius ridde wiues presence falling downe knee lady saide hee hast onely power stirre vp againe flame long layne deade mee see mee power beautie make olde age come aske counsaile youth prince vnconquered become slaue stranger see power loue lest since although see nothing loued worthy prince answered zelmane taking vp kneeling manner speech straunge vnto know answere better silence silence please said king shall neuer displease since heart wholly pledged obey otherwise would vouchsafe mine eares happinesse heare shall conuay word mind humblest degree reuerence receiue disdaine speake mightie prince said zelmane disdaine speake matter may bring honor question therewith braue counterfeited scorne departed king leauing sorie short answere proud himselfe broken matter thus king feeding minde thought passe great time writing verse making himselfe wont doo little helpe would haue growne prettie kind dotage zelmane ridde louing littleloued company ala said poore pyrocles euer one receiued wrong could blame body hauing desire still want woulde truly loue must needes say thus much thy behalfe thou hast imployed loue loue deserued recompence hast sent loue euer desired wilt thou doo pyrocles way canst thou finde ridde thee thy intricate trouble would knowne liue darkenesse reuealed would secret shift shall finde diligent loue basilius shield violent passion gynecia done yet neerer quench fire consumes well well sweete philoclea whole confidence must builded thy diuine spirit cannot ignorant cruell wound haue receiued sicke folkes alone thinke companie would relieue yet hauing company find noysome changing willingly outward obiects indeed euill inward poore zelmane weery basilius selfe basilius gone euer turned eye become owne iudges tyred wherewith longed meete friende dorus vpon shoulder friendship might lay burthen sorrow therefore went toward lodge among certaine beech found dorus apparelled flanen goat skin cast vpon garland laurell mixt cypre leaues head wayting master dametas time teaching sheephooke catch wanton lambe cast litle clod one strayed companie dorus practising one might see dametas holding hand vnder girdle behind nodding wast vpwards swearing neuer knew man go aukewardly worke might talke bookelearning would part neuer saw vnfeatie fellowes great clearks zelmanes comming saued dorus chiding beginning speake number master sheepe prouince arcadia bare finest wooll drewe follow countrie discourse till dametas hearing vehemencie passion though hart would clime mouth take tongue office declared vnto vpon brier rose affection grew time still seemed forget bestowing one houre comfort vpon remaining stil one plight ill fortune sauing much worse continuance euill doth selfe increase euill ala dorus said thou seest long languishingly weekes past ouer v since last talking yet miserable onely stronger longing weaker hoping fell pitifull declaration insupportablenes desire dorus eares able shew woundes discourse gaue vnto procured eye teares giue testimonie much suffered suffering till passion cumbersome guest selfe made zelmane sooner shake earnestly intreate dorus also like freedome discourse would bestow mappe little world vpon might see whether troubled vnhabitable clime colde despaires hot rage walking vnder palme tree louing nature seemed giue shadow willinglier held discourse loue dorus thus entred description fortune ala said deare cosin hath pleased high power throw v estate onely entercourse true friendship must bartring misery part must confesse indeede huge darkenes sorrowes crept cannot say lightsomnes certaine dawning rather peeping possibilitie comfort woe farre marke desire rather thinke light come small hole dungeon miserable caitife may better remember light depriued like scholler onely come degree knowledge finde himselfe vtterly ignorant thus stand meanes exalted serue yonder blessed lodge furnace agony refreshing seruice done killing beare pleased princesse whome indeede statelines shine courtesie let fall gratious looke vpon sometimes see exercise sometimes heare song part hart would suffer omit occasion whereby might make incomparable pamela see much extraordinarie deuotion bare seruice withall straue appeare worthy sight small desert ioyned great affection might preuaile something wisest ladie well ala found shepheards seruice considered shepheard acceptation limitted proportion good seruant countenance giuen notice lay affection vnder sawe straight maiesty sitting throne beautie drawe foorth sword iust disdaine remayned man thunderstriken daring able behold power make estate knowen seemed againe impossible reason suspitiousnes dametas miso young ebbing flowing estate star iudge rightly haue wicked intent made selfe pray fancie idle lustes framed hart fit impression let plague dayly encrease till name made odious womankind extreame vnresistable violence haue oppressed euer sacrifice ô starres succour help help sinne must mother shame daughter affection yet childish obiections simple philoclea impossibilitie dooth torment vnlawfull desire punished effect enioying vnpossible desire punished desire selfe ô tenne time vnhappie since hope kindleth loue despaire bellowes affection despaires miserable drawen impossibilitie woman zelmane away vaine examination thou louest excellent zelmane loue thee embrasing ground whereon lay said selfe euen selfe ashamed speake word zelmane gouerne direct wholy giuen ouer vnto thee came hether loue farre thou seest blind eye philoclea straight found therefore draw deed said haue often wondred selfe excellency could meane person belike fortune afraide lay treasure staind many though subiects delight hearing thereof gaue himselfe indeede full currant disposition especially warre thessalia wherein though trueth wrongly deemed vnsuccesse proceeded vnwillingnes haue prosper thinking himselfe contemned knowing countermine contempt terror began let nothing passe might beare colour fault without sharp punishment wanted fault excellencie grew fault sufficient make one guiltie power guiltie humour impudent pouertie cannot make itselfe seruiceable enow desperate ambition would build house vpon others ruines fall like practises seruitude came mainly vpon poore people whose deedes onely punished word corrected euen thought meane puld suspition bred mind crueltie effect crueltie stirred new cause suspition plight full watchfull fearefulnes storme deliuer sweete pyrocles stormie minde tyrant men wrong rare stranger whose countenaunce deserued pitie admiration condemning themselues much heart brag force bloudy king knew order cosin musidorus much feared come thessalia assuredly thinking euer thinking worst force prouided glad perishing thought musidorus determined publique sort put pyrocles death hauing quite lost way noblenes straue clime height terriblenes thinking make men adread make one enemie would spare feare kill great prince lastly hauing nothing make friend thought woulde take away enemie day appointed thing appointed cruell blow solemne order would set foorth tyranny gorgeous decking princely youth inuincible valour yet vniustly subiected outragious wrong carrying demeanure constantly abiding extremitie one might see cutting enterchanged may omitte worke friendshippe pyrocles speache countenance musidorus well shewed thought himselfe iniured releeued asking euer seene could beare extremity mortall accidentes well man enuie glorie suffering death friendes cause robbe owne possession notable contention conquest must conquerers destruction safetie punishment conquered musidorus preuayled welcome praie vniust king chearefully going towardes pyrocles went frowardly fromward death deliuered king could inough sure without fed owne eies vpon one begon feare soone began yet would one acte make ostentation owne lackes bellie glad sight doth fill iustly entitled cupid hill hill fitte master spotlesse mine alablaster like alablaster faire sleeke soft supple satten like sweete seate boy doth sport loath must cliues whitenes passe hanches smooth looking glasse bow knee knee tongue doth tell fancie see knottes ioy gemmes loue whose motion make grace moue whose bought incaud doth yeeld sight like cunning painter shadowing white gartring place childlike signe shewes easie print mettall fine againe flesh doth rise braue calues like christall sky whose atlas smallest small white whitest bone thereout steales round cleane foote noble cedar pretious roote shewe sent pale violet whose steppe earth beautie set back vnto back muse leda swanne feather mewes along whose ridge bone met like comfit round hewe ah woe woe renewe course doth leade hand first loue fatall band whitenes dooth euer sitte nature selfe enameld strange compact dooth lie warme snow moyst pearle softe iuorie fall saphircoloured brooke conduitlike curious crookes sweete ilands make sweete land finger hand bloudy shaftes cupid warre amatists headed thus hath part beauty part grace doo impart limmes speciall grace becomming euery time place doth euen beautie beautifie bewitch wretched eye faire inne fairer guest dwell within whose high praise praisefull blisse goodnes penne heauen paper inke immortall fame dooth lende foorth ether contemning repining father besides growen mother stepmother read eies owne fault made conscience guiltines thought still presence caried condemnation much vnchastly attempting wonted fancie • found reuerence father bed bitter refusall • breeding rather spite shame shame shame fault repulse onely hating thirst reuenge fearing harm form endeuoured doo harme vnto therefore trie vttermost wicked wit ouerthrow foundation strength fauour father saw strong nature desert required cunning vndermine therefore shunning ordinary trade hireling sycophant shee made praise accusation aduancing ruine first word neerer admiration liking would extoll excellency goodlines shape power witte valiantnes courage fortunatenes success father might finde singular loue towards nay shee shunned kindle fewe sparkes ielousie thus hauing gotten opinion father shee farre meaning mischiefe sonne fell shee praise lesse vehemencie affection much cunning malice set foorth liberty mind high flying thought fitnesse beare rule singular loue subiects bare doubtfull whether wit greater winning fauours courage imploying fauours borne liue subiectlife action bearing maiestie kingly entertainement kingly magnificence kingly harte enterprise especially remembring vertues successor honoured subiects suspected prince would shee puttingoff obiections bring obiectiōs husband head already infected suspitiō nay would say dare take vpon death sonne many like might haue bene loued greatnes well build greatnes vpon father ruine indeed ambition like loue abide lingring euer vrgeth owne success hating thing may stop god forbid euer dreame thing perhaps might content world know power hath hurte admirable praise hurt euer remembring strengthen suspition estate priuate ielousie loue excessiue honour whē presence repeating pretie speaches grace absence besides causing imployed dangerous matter ether perish hee preuailed increase glorie made weapon wound vntill found suspition began already speake selfe husband eares growne hungry rumour eies prying euery accident tooke help seruant neere husband whō knew hasty ambition one wanting true sufficiencie raise would make ladder mischiefe shee vseth deale plainely alleaging cause iealousie making knowe fittest time husband already stirred way two diuers wayes nourished one humour like musitians singing diuers part make one musicke sometime fearefull countenaunce would desire king looke himselfe court cittie full whisperinges expectation soddaine change vpon ground himselfe knew another time hee would counsell king make much sonne holde fauour late keepe vnder seeming feare himselfe said plangus loued none great father lastly breaking directly making sorrowful countenance humble gesture beare false witnesse true meaning found onely souldiery people weary gouernment affection bent vpon plangus queene concurring strange dreames thing else minde already perplexed might breed astonishment within plangus action began translated language suspition though pl • ngu found yet could auoid euen contrary driuen draw one yoke argument magnificent spent much aspiring intent spared hee heaped much aspiring intent hee spake curteously angled people hart silent mused vpon daungerous plot summe hee could haue turned himselfe many formes proteus euery forme haue bene made hideous fell meere trifle gaue occasion proceeding king one morning going vineyard lay long hill vpon castle stood saw vinelabourer finding bowe broken tooke branch bowe want another thing tied place broken king asking fellow marry said make sonne binde father word finding king alredy supersticious suspition amazed streight presage owne fortune returning breaking wife much misdoubted estate made gainesaying answeres straue straue ouercome euen doubtes boiled thus nourished vnderhand dealt principall men country great parliament bee held name estate perswade king stept deeply old age make plangus associate gouernment
