people safely ruled king agreed thereto accomplished counsell indeed keeping promise vehement perswading shee knew husband woulde feare hate cause feare plangus found humbly protested desire accept hee protested father thought dissembled accounting integrity cūning face falshood therefore delaying desire subiects attended fit occasion lay hand vpon sonne wife thus brought passe caused minister go vnto plangus enabling word great shew faith endearing desire secresie tell found ruine conspired stepmother certaine noble men country king himselfe giuing consent day shoulde passe putting practize discouering truth indeede cunning stepmother proceeded agreing plangus owne opinion made giue better credit yet far flie country according naughty fellowes persuasion attend see whereupon fellow direction mistresse told one day night one clocke king appointed haue wife noble men together deliberate manner proceeding plangus therefore offered himselfe would agree hee woulde bring place hee heare passed haue reason himselfe world seeke safetie poore plangus subiect onely disaduantage honest hart credulitie perswaded arming himselfe late going closely conueied place appointed meane time stepmother making al gesture cūningly counterfait miserable affliction lay almost groueling flower chā ber suffering body comfort vntill calling husband held long enquiry length tolde euen almost cry euery word wery life since shee brought plunge either conceale husband murther accuse sonne euer beene deare sonne vnto many interruption exclamation tolde sonne plangus solliciting olde affection betweene besought put helping hand death king assuring though lawes world would marrie king fully said thus much many pitifull digressiōs come fellow brought plāgus rūning breath fell king foot beseeching saue man sword drawen next roome king affrighted wēt called gard entring place foūd indeed plangus sword hand naked standing suspiciously inough one already suspicious king thinking hee put vp sworde noise neuer tooke leasure heare answer made prisoner meaning next morning put death market place day sooner opened eies eares friend follower little army came force deliuered although number side abused fine framing report took armes king plangus though might haue vsed force friend reuenge wrong get crowne yet naturall loue father hate make suspition seeme iust wherein harte sacrificed zelmane coulde stirre bene poppet whose motion stoode onely vpon pleasure basilius seruiceable steppe gynecia greedie eye would follow basilius mind gynecia well knew could haue found hart laugh mirth could haue borne proportion fortune gynecias action interpreted basilius proceeding iealousie amorousnesse zelmane betwixt like poore childe whose father beates make prince watched two wakefull eye loue iealousie ala incomparable philoclea thou euer seest dost neuer see thou hearest willingly dare say dare say fit thee heare ala euer imprisoned libertie banished fortie winter comming zelmane found giuen ouer musical mus great pleasure good old basilius retired himselfe behinde tree sweete voice vtter passionate verse loued yet complaine loue louing accusd loue die pittie craue cruell proue still seeking loue loue found much flie burnt selfe muse others fire call wrong doo bard haue beyond desire waile want yet chokt store thy worke thou god euer blinde though thousand old boy entitled still thus child doo silly bird finde stroking hurt much cramming kill yet thus much loue loue craue thee let loud el loued bee basilius made great haste behind tree opinion lightnesse haue emboldned base fancy towards enioying quoth little ioy come yeeld enioying poore basilius appalled legges bowed vnder eye lookt though would gladly hide himselfe old blood going hart generall shaking ouer bodie possessed length wanne mouth giue stammering answere came zelmanes head deuise make profite folly therefore relented countenance thus said vnto word mightie hath made princesse felicitie minister ruine choyse hath made goddesse safetie let let powred vpon destruction faire face hath manie token amazement word thinke amazement whence come since word carry degree zelmanes word creepingly entred philoclea till pleasure fully made vp manifesting hope ouercome hope yet doubt would faine haue playd parte minde cald question assured zelmane pyrocles loue streight stood vp deposed lie could come mouth zelmane • besides certaine sparke honour rose welldisposed minde made feare alone whome alone desired contradiction growing mind neither absolutely clime rocke vertue freely sinke sea vanitie sparke soone gaue place lest gaue light minde candle doth sunnes presence euen sicke surfet ioy fearefull knewe newly findes huge treasure doubt whether sleepe like fearefull deere lookes come best feede shrugging kinde tremor principall partes gaue affectionate word answere ala painefull thing deuided minde make wellioyned answere hard bring inward shame outward confession handsomnes trow obserued speeche made one knowes shall say ô zelmane ala word shall say prince pyrocles wretch shew manifest may well say continued ought philoclea either neuer bene euer bene zelmane either neuer attempted change set hope neuer discouered stopt despaire feare behauiour ill gouerned gaue first comfort feare affection ill hid hath giuen last assurance feare indeed weakenesse gouernment made thinke maske would gratefull vnto weaker gouernment since make pull visar shall doo shall seeke farfetched inuentions shall labour lay marble coulours ouer ruinous thought rather though purenes virginminde stained let keepe true simplicitie word true ala true ô zelmane loue call thee since name loue first began shade name loue shall best lie hidden euen thou wert eye bewitched know passion fitter desire desired shall say sory loue must turned hate since thou art turned pyrocles may wel since thou wert zelmane despaire thou mightest thus torment thou hast victorie needed proofes one would haue fallen herselfe rather make contrarie coniectures zelmane speech imbracements seemed soules desired meete hart kisse mouthes faine pyrocles would haue sealed chiefe armes desire philoclea commaunded contrary yet passed promise mariage philocleas entreaty willing purloine occasion remayning zelmane told storie life time departing erona rest already vnderstood sister saide haue vnderstood first companie noble cousin musidorus parted thessalia diuers aduentures daunger glory passed till comming succour queene erona ende warre might perceiue selfe vnderstood prince plangus since course doings vntill came many victory make conquest poore know fame thereof hauing rather shewed piece deliuered full forme therefore deere pyrocles mine eares sweetly fed heare liberall vnto thing haue made indeede pretious worlde doubt tell peril since haue euen remembrance pleasaunt pyrocles easily perceiued content kindnesse put occasion kindnesse wherein loue shewed himselfe cowardly boy durst attempt feare offending rather loue prooued himselfe valiant durst sworde reuerent dutie gainestand force many enraged desire though knewe discourse entertaine streight parley yet durst kisse rod gladly make much entertainement allotted vnto therefore desirous sigh chastning brest much desiring sweete princesse life said trophees triumph monument history might euer make fame yeeld sweete musicke eares pleaseth lend minde knowledge thing touching pyrocles onely therefore value pyrocles therefore grow proud thinke worth hearing since vouchsafe giue hearing therefore onely height hope vouchsafe know death tiridates setling erona gouernment setled left howsoeuer since perceiued speech last day vngratefull treason illchosen husband ouerthrew thing trueth neuer till time either heard suspected could thinke without hauing minde antiphilus great beautie eronas indeed excellent could haue held affection great goodnes could haue bound gratefulnesse high aduancement could haue satisfied ambition therefore true wickednesse may well compared bottomlesse pit farre easier keepe one selfe falling fallen giue one selfe stay falling infinitely cosen vpon cause parted erona euardes braue mighty prince fortune kill combat erona three nephewes sonnes sister three set among foremost rancks fame great mind attempt great force perfourme attempt especially eldest name anaxius men would willingly haue yeelded height praise nature bestow vpon himselfe could giue vnsupportable pride deed might wel stir enuie demeanor rather breed disdaine bee true gyants euer made war heauen bene fit ensignebearer company nothing seemed hard though impossible nothing vniust liking iustice war flatly refused aid could brooke worthy prince plangus cosen tiridates preferred allowing weight sword speare iudging desert howmuch esteemed himselfe plangus much would haue allowance seruice vnderstood vncle slaine think rather scorne kil vncle kindnesse vnvsed guest arrogant soule made seeke reuenge must confesse manner gallant enough sent challenge vnto meete place appointed confines kingdome lycia would proue vpon trecherie ouercome vncle el many hundred could haue withstood youth successe made mee willing enough accept bargaine especially heard cosen amphialus yeares hath vniuersally borne name best knight world diuers time fought neuer bene able master left euery man thought anaxius one vertue curtesie far short match anaxius still deeming himselfe superiour therefore would goe would need goe alone vnderstood certaine must confesse desirous something without company incomparable prince musidorus hart acknowledge owed presence thing selfe whatsoeuer done indeed worldly cause must grant receiued euer may good taught word best example giuing mee liuely image vertue ignorance could cast mist ouer mine eye see loue deare friendship care ô heauen life euer requite vnto made indeed finde selfe kind depending vpon without found weakenesse mistrustfulnes selfe one strayed best strength time mist humour perceiuing ouerrule straue vnwilling depend vpon iudgement weakenesse would though held made vnworthy therefore desired leaue obtained confidence preferring reputation owne tendernesse priuately went hee determining knew secret maner far place appointed meete preuent foule play might offered vnto full loth erona let v depart forefeeling harmes fel ridde fully comber kindnesse halfe dayes iorney way toward anaxius met aduēture though self smal importance wil tel large occasion thereof brought great comber danger lightly might escape past laund ech side whereof bordred high tymber tree copse farre humble growth might easily bring solitarie minde looke companion wild burgess forrest heard certaine cry comming paw mine eares within wood right hand made mee well assured greatnesse crie voice man though verie vnmanlike voice crie making mine eare guide left many tree behinde sawe bottome one gentleman bound many garter hand foot well might tomble tosse neither runne resist coulde vpon like many eagle vpon oxe nine gentlewoman truely one might wel enough say hansome eche held bodkin handes wherewith continually pricked hauing bene beforehand vnarmed defence wast vpward onely shirte poore man wept bled cried praied sported themselues paine delighted praiers argumentes victorie moued compassion much hee straight cald succour desiring lest kill deliuer tormenter myselfe could resolue much lesse tell would resolue came cholericke hast towards seuen eight knight foremost willed get away trouble lady taking due reuenge ouermastring maner pride truly heart could brooke therefore answering howe woulde haue defended lady knew would began combat first particularly death others lesse good maners ioyntly ende kept fielde death flight others much woman afraid angrie victorie would bring forth ran away sauing onely one flesht malice neyther fight gaue anie truce crueltie still vsed little instrument great spight wellwitnest paine impatient patient put eye spared doe discomfort seeing preuayled ouer came much adoe brought conference sometime would harken would speake shee would speeche leaue sharpe remembrance bodkin length puld headpeece humbled entreated pardon knowledge cruell breath choller increased owne exercise paine tooke much purpose gaue griefe vnto knowledge gentleman said much forbeare time executing iust reuenge vpon • naughtie creature man nothing deceiuing woman see yoong like enough haue power would haue mind much mischief content vpō bad subiect read lecture vertue man called pamphilus birth must confesse noble shalbe staine dead auncestors haue left offspring shape see vncomely indeed fit maske disguised falshood conuersation wittily pleasant pleasantly gamesome eye full merie simplicitie wordes heartie companablenesse one whose head one would thinke staied thinke mischieuously delighted thing imparting delight thers make vser therof welcome musick daunsing hunting feasting riding like conclude one keepe armes end need neuer wish better companion vnder quality lie poysonous addar wil tell gift nature fortune place acceptable creepes nay say truely fly fauour poore sillie womē would much ashamed confesse reuenge hande well shame cheekes hart wholy delighted deceiuing v could neuer warned rather one bird caught serued stale bring gat still shewed gaue away new mistresse hee betrayed promise former cunning flatterie readines teares infinitenes vowes among weakest threedes nette stirring owne passion entrance make himselfe lord force lay master part cunning making v iealous enuious proud desirous giuing one triumph see prince many subiect estranged looke making feare losse minde indeede could neuer neuer ceasing humblenes diligence till imbarked v disaduantage wee could returne dryshod suddenly tyrant craftie tyrant would hee vse imperiousnes delightfull feare awe made v loath lose hope strangest sometimes late repentance thinke must confesse euen greatest tempest iudgement neuer driuen thinke excellent yet could set minde get keepe though therein laien felicitie like haue seene play ball growe extremely earnest haue ball yet euery one knew ball end bitter sauce sport wee ether harte broken sorrow estate spoyled direction honour euer lost partly owne fault principally faultie vsing fault neuer man could scornefull eye beholde whose feete lately laine vnmanlike brauerie vse tongue disgrace lately song sonets praise naturally inconstant maruell soule findes way kill bodie whereto beene long vnited hath dealt v vnhappie fooles could neuer tell whether hee made greater haste liked enioy enioyed forsake making glorie owne shame delighted bee challenged vnkindenesse triumph vnto haue mercie called hee thought fresh colour beautie painted nothing well ruines louers yet farre engaged selues vnfortunate soules listed complaine since complaint could carrie greatest accusation selues euerie v selfe laboured meanes recouer rather daily sent v companion deceipt euer returned sound faithfull manner till length concluded wronges betrothing himselfe one must confesse worthie liked worthinesse might excuse vnworthie changeablenesse leauing v nothing remorse past dispaire might followe deede common iniurie made v ioyne fellowshipp till time employed endeuours one wee thought nothing condemning v iustifiing loue mariage despaire made feare valiant reuenge gaue shame countenance whereupon saw deuised get among v alone hee suspecting matter often abuse thought made tame still abused easily gaue v opportunitie man may see euen soone ruler grow proud theyr pride foolish came authoritie among v planet done inough v v beene delighted wee began courteous maner one lay vnkindnes vnto seeing himselfe confronted many like resolute orator went deniall iustisie cruell falshood al iestes disdainfull passage iniurie coulde bee made greater yet conceites made apter apprehend among answeres forsooth shall neuer forget howe hee woulde proue inconstancie chaunge one loue another great constancie contrarie call constancie chaungeable said euer loued delight delighted alwaies louely wheresoeuer found occasion obtaine constantly followed constant fooles speake though mistres growe sicknesse foule fortune miserable yet still loue commit absurdest inconstancie may changing loue fairenesse foulenesse loulinesse contrarie like one content leaue friend streight giue ouer himselfe mortall enemie whome call inconstant euer constant beautie others delight selfe iolly scoffing brauerie went ouer v saying left one ouerwaiward another soone wonne third merrie inough fourth ouergamesome fifth shee growne griefe subiect sicknesse sixt foolish ielous seuenth shee refused carrie letter another loued eight secret ninth liberall named dido indeede haue mette false aeneas say ô vngratefull villanie could finde fault obiect perdie met many fayrer thus plaide carelesse prince hauing seruants readines lately manfully ouercame laide holde beginning first trifling reuenge foūd v busie meaning afterwardes haue mangled haue lost credit euer abusing haue made fellowes flie away part greatnesse wrong ouershadowes iudgement greatnesse daunger inough haue deceiued deceipt abused mee abuse forsaken hee must company company lay want beautie charge many fairer trow euen iudgement sir eies beguile many fairer know whosoeuer say contrary many fairer receiue reproch hath best cause know many fairer therefore howsoeuer fellowes pardon iniuries parte euer remember remember reuenge scorne scornes afresh surely would haue put eies lay mute shame hee sometimes crie feare lept horse mingling force intreaty staied furie perswading meekenes come number friend forthwith cried kill woman thus betraied disgraced faine forsake ensigne vnder serued spend vttermost force protecting ladie well preuailed ende faithfull peace promised sids leauing place securitie thought went iourney towards anaxius faine stay two day apointed place disdaining waite till sure patientlie abide angrie pleasure till space tyme came indeede according promise alone may say little wont say much like man whose courage apt clime ouer daunger assoone euer came neere fit distaunce purpose much fury fury skilfully guided ran vpon best sort could resisted hauing kept selfe ready vnderstood obserued complement matter armes proud anger indit • vnto putting horse full careere hit vpon head launce think felte blowe parte must confesse neuer receiued like thinke though sens astonished mind forced quicken themselues learned little fauour woont show matter aduantage indeede hee turned comming vpon sworde drawne staues hauing beene broken encounter ready answere truely knowe gaue first blowe whosoeuer gaue first quickly seconded second indeed excellentest ladie must say truly time well fought betweene v vndoubtedly singular valour would god abased much loftinesse occasion combate winning loosing ground chaunged place horse happened come vpon point brokē speare fallen ground chaunced stand vpward lighting vpon hart horse died driuen dismount threatned like much horse fortune done whether would beholding fortune part victorie descended began footefight sort well entred bloud side come vnconstant pamphilus deliuered easie knowne bare faced dosen armed men dido ladie sharpely punished riding vpon palfery following vnmanlike crueltie beating wandes hande cry sense paine hope succour pittifull sight vnto mooued require anaxius deferre combate till day performe duty knighthood helping distressed ladie hee disdaines obey thing passion hee cals minde bad mee leaue thought hee killed mee hee woulde perhaps go succour well finding fight would bee long betweene v longing hart deliuer poore dido giuing great blowe somwhat staied terme right flatly ran away towarde horse trotting companie mine armour put paine vse made mee nimble vnto followed horse anaxius followed mee prowde harte dis 〈1 page missing〉 〈1 page missing〉 time bitterlye warne daughter bringing costlye mate vnder roofe grieuing desired much know name thinke partlye kindnesse remember done something partlye assured selfe one would make enen miserminde contented done accordingly demaunded name estate earnestnesse loue robbed selfe another told directly name condition whereof gladde father might well perceaue ill fauoured cheerefulnesse first began wrinckle selfe face cause ioyes farre different shepheard butcher may looke vpon one sheepe pleasing conceipts shepheard minde profit himselfe preseruing butcher killing reioyced finde mine benefit tyed friend prince greatnesse louingly reioyced ioye grew danger perceiued occasion queene artaxias setting head sale hauing slaine brother tiridates summe hundreth thousand crownes whosoeuer brought aliue hand olde wretch ouerliued good nature though lying idly much yet aboue thing louing money monies owne sake determined betray well deseruing haue determined neuer vse knowing next morning resolued go place left anaxius sent speed captaine garrison neere though belonged king iberia yet knowing captaines humor delight riotous spending cared came meanes maintaine doubted halfe gaine would playe quarter part treason therefore night agreeing fittest place might surprise morning olde caitiffe growne ceremonious would need accompanie myles way sufficient token nature made apte suspect since churles curtesie rarely come either gaine falshood suffered stumble point good manner purpose came clownes horst vpon cartiades furnished good faith thought selfe thrift wisht none freends subiects euer thriue daughter gentle dido would also conscience farre better minde prolong time farewell long went togither old wickednes could looke face freely talke whose life alreadie contracted till comming falling way ledde v place eachside whereof men might easilye keepe themselues vndiscouered encompassed sodainly great troupe enemy horse foote willed yeelde selfe queene artaxia could haue vsed worse eloquence haue perswaded yeelding knowing little good artaxia bare therefore making necessitie iustice best sword shielde vsed weapon well could sure little ease good number trusting number valure valewing money higher equitie felt guiltlesnesse alwayes ease oppressed chremes withdrew himselfe yet guilding wicked conceipts hope gaine content beholder taken make pray growne wearie supported selfe anger strength excellent musidorous came succour hauing followed trace well could found left fight anaxius came niggard castell found burnd spoiled countrie people bare mortall hatred couetous man tooke time castell left almost without garde come leaue monument malice therein musidorus staying either impeache came vpon spurre one voice many tolde company good meant vnto extremitie found saw cosen mine thought life doubled thought noble death thought noble victorie feare hath musidorus many killed straunger number straunge blowes wherwith sent weldeserued death might well delight speak holde long euery particular trueth euer euer euer man musidorus shew himselfe second none able valour yet vnmeasurable excesse number woulde haue done ende knowe triall thereof cutte chaunceable comming thither king iberia father worthy plangus hath pleased sometimes mention yeelding ouer olde age countrie delight especially hauking time following merline brought see iniurie offred vnto v hauing great number courtier waiting vpon straight known souldiers assaulted v king withdrew themselues authoritie knowing captaines owne constrained confession motiue mischieuous practise misliking much violence offred countrie men ranke chiefelye disdaining done respect niece must confesse wrongfully hated interpreted brother maintained sonne plangus caused captaines head presently striken old bad chremes hanged though truely part earnestly laboured life eaten bread one thing notable conclusion miserable life owne chamber pleased instrument frame relation brought knowen vnto time spent curing dangerous wound acquainted acquainted sooner selues expected continually almost haunted v till long dooing discouered violent bent affection strangely might well see euill minde authoritie dooth onely follow sway desire already within frame selfe new desire thought equall ardour affected v greatnes disdaine shamefastnes content acknowledge hauing many time torne vaile modestie seemed last delight delighted infamy often vsed husband shame filling men eares reproch hoodwinkt kindenes lest men knew badlydiligent minister often cloyed eares praise would need teach v way felicitie seeking fauour found deafe thē dumb thē lifted lōger stay suburb foolish desire directly entred vpon thē making trauell found purposed vse meanes could depart thence importunatenes craued good maners either v desired granted truely faire euerye way excellēt lady would haue wōdred haue seen v would confes contention mind louely indeed louelye broūnes musidorus face colour mine deceiuable stile affection would intitle beautifull eye wandred like glutton feast one word would begin half sentēce disciplined leaue throughhandling gentle wife foorthwith caused v put prison hauing slept depriued v armes prison indeede iniurious prison el well testifying affection respect commodious prison might indeede placed might houres seene many though cared much many seen come vnto v fell sause desire threatnings great perplexitie restrained vnworthie bondage yet restrained loue cannot tell noble mindes certain duety claimes answering much loue might moue v much faultines minde remoued v beauty balanced shamelesnes tie v captiuitie graunt ben wickedly iniurious saued liues accuse lady loued v loue vnto v esteemed almost dishonorable one way sawe likelyhood going place word would iniurious eares expres manner suite yet many time earnestnes died cheekes colour shamefastnes wanton languishing borrowed eye downcastlooke modestie mean time farre louing often assuring would recompence husbandes sauing liues ridiculous degree trusting brought caused send v worde vpon liues doo whatsoeuer commaunded v good man knowing pleasure directed preseruation estate made v rather pittie obey folly fell seruile entreating v though force could haue bene schoole loue honest courage would rather striue yeeld iniurie yet could make v accuse though made v almost pine away spight loose time troublesome idlenesse thus full wearinesse past doubt follow loue thinke course life hath spot sometimes poyson rose sometimes heale wormewood brought forth remedy vnto v though helped distres ala cō clusion must euer liue think worse wracke haue bene preserued king queene sonne tender age great expectation brought vp hope themselues already acceptation inconstant people successour father crowne wherof worthy considering partes vnworthie respect wrong thereby done noble plangus whose great desertes either forgotten vngratefully remembred men set sayles fauourable winde blewe fortune young prince perchaunce hart surely mouth giuing plangus yeares champion poore comfort calamitie pittie youth therefore accounted prince region name palladius vehement affection loue yong ladye brought vp father court called zelmane daughter mischieuouslie vnhappie prince plexirtus already haue sometimes must make neuer honorable mention left father intricate changeablenes estate motherside halfe brother queene andromana therefore willinger committing care loue ala doth alwaies reflect selfe fell zelmane though truely reason enough loue palladius yet could euer perswade harte yeelde thereunto paine palladius feele feele vnloued loue yet louing indeed therefore constant hee vsed still intercession diligence faith euer hoping would put selfe hell hopelesse vntill time come captiued brought foorth ende truely deserues degree sorrow teares therein ill destinie young ladye zelmane like vnwisely liberall delight giue presentes pay debtes chose ala pittie rather bestowe loue much vndeserued desired vpon recompence whose loue besides many thinges might seeme euen court honour iustly claime ala whereby came passe nothing doth naturally follow cause care preserue benefite doth follow vnfained affection felt felt captiuitie streight laboured redresse paine paine could better meanes vsing helpe therein palladius true louer considering commaundements indeed concealing affection shee intituled compassion immediatly obeyed imploye vttermost credite relieue v though great beloued son mother faultye otherwise hardharted toward yet could preuaile procure v libertie wherefore sought haue practise could praier allowed often visite v indeede restraint lesse according ague passion sport learned lady loue chast cōtinuall martiall exercise without bloud made perfect bloudy art sportes carried rich knowledge vpon stream delight behauiour selfe lady builded chastitie vpon nether wisedome doubted honor blemished god doth better become wisedome discerne worthy louing agreable goodnes thē loue discerned greatnes hart constant loued time loue publikely known death philoxenus search amphialus hath made seemed haue leasure send thither diuerse choise knight court might bring lest knowledge perchaūce honor triumph wherin behaued thēselues three day carried prize came forth iberian whose manner entring bagpipe steed trumpet shepheards boy page dozen apparelled like shepherd fashion though rich stuffe caried launce though strong giue launcely blow indeede yet couloured hook neere mourn pretilye represented shephooks furniture drest ouer wooll enriched iewels artificially placed one would haue thought mariage betweene lowest highest impresa sheepe marked sang eclogue one answering another shepherd pulling recorder possest place pipe accorded musicke others voice eclogue great praise onely remember sixe verse hauing questioned one fellowshepheards sodaine growing man armes cause thus said thought staues mist much amisse would hit euer yet misse said brake crosse full well might neuer man crossely crost cryed well broke foole full gaily blest failing shame breaking best thus haue digrest maner liked well began run lelius neere growne though great loue euer bene betwixt quarell philisides breaking staues great commendation lelius knowne second none perfection art ranne euer ouer head finely skilfull eye one might wel see shewed knowledge missing others hitting gallant grace staffe came swimming close ouer crest helmet would represent kisse stroke mar philisides much moued thought lelius would shew contempt youth till lelius therefore would satisfie friend made know bondage many course tyed whose disgrace graced excellencye whose iniuries could neuer otherwise returne honor lelius willingmissing oddes iberian side continued next excellent running knight though fostred mus many time rusticke people left delight profites harken song yet could well performe armed sport neuer pen launce hand came like wilde man wildenes shewed eyesight tamed full withered leaues though fell still threatned falling impresa millhorse still bound goe one circle word data fata sequutus corinthian knight absolutely preuailed especially great noble man corinth whose deuise come without deuise white like new knight indeede new newnes shamed others passage went vpon spur little house forrest neere thought would fittest resting place till wee might goe mother fury wherat shas lesse angry ashamed desirous obay zelmane mother learned since vnderstanding gard sonnes conuaying v away forgetting greatnes resining modestye quiet thought flew place cried accompanied herselfe would follow v rather vehemencie passion conduct reason made entred anothers dominion hauing threescore horsmen streight cōmanded take v aliue regard sonnes threatening therin attempted doo first speach force neither liking eloquēce fearing might esteemed fewe swordes iust defence able resist many vniust assaulter musidorus incredible valour beating downe let made palladius good way little doo ouercome weake wrong victorie effect without bloud palladius heated fight angrie mother fault pursued assaylers one heard since comming bene speciall minion andromanas hated v hauing dispossest hart taking one v traiterous blow slew young prince falling downe eye specially deliuered iudge sweetest lady whether anger might called iustice case wrought v many subiects body left dead wait faithfully world disdaine strengthened furie furious loue made andromana stay last combat whē saw v light see help might doo helplesse palladius came running madly vnto v lesse threatning power hurt perceiued onely sonne lay hurt hurt deadly already life lost vse reasonable almost sensible part onely misfortune lay owne ouglinesse vpon fault make see done come especiallye finding v rather detestation pittie considering losse young prince resolution presentlye departe still laboured stay depriued comfort eye full death ranne sonnes dagger aware else would haue stayed strake selfe mortall wound loue though person awaked pittie v went musidorus laboured obout palladius wound past cure better surgeon selfe could receaue fewe dying word cursings ill set affection wishing vnto many cross mischaunces loue soeuer loue wherein feare feare praiers aboue granted noise fight issue thereof blazed countrye people nobleman thereabouts came thither finding wrong offered v let v go iourney hauing recōmended royall body vnto conueied king iberia philoclea seeing teares stand eye remēbrance palladius much thervpon grew would need drink kisse eye sucke another frō lippes wherat blushed yet kissed hide blushing almost brought pyrocles another discourse sweete rigor forbad durst rebell though found great warre keepe peace faine goe storie absolutely bad durst know disobey said parting place sunne much abased himselfe greatest height sawe sitting vpon drie sandes yeelded time verie hotte reflection faire gentlewoman whose gesture accused much sorow euery way shewed cared notwhat paine put body since better parte minde laide vnder much agonie dulled withall could come neare heare speech yet perceiue hearer lamentation wel might vnderstand time say thou dost kill thy vnkinde falshood greeues die greeues thou art murtherer neither doth mine paine much vexe thy errour god knowes would trouble slain thee much torment slaine thee thou art vntrue pamphilus thou art vntrue woe therefore oft didst thou sweare vnto sunne loose light rock runne vp downe like little kiddes thou wouldst falsifie thy faith sunne therefore put thy shining rockes runne madde sorrow pamphilus false ala sun keepes light though thy faith darckned rockes stand still though thou change like wethercocke foole thought could graspe water binde winde might well haue knowen thee others would rather wished learne poison drinking selfe loue helped thy word deceiue wel yet would thou hadst made better choise thou didst forsake thy vnfortunate leucippe matter baccha thy new mistres wil reuenge wrong baccha let pamphilus liue happy though dye much like phrase spake occasion know something pamphilus stept comfort though could doo yet gotte thus much knowledge leucippe whome vnconstant pamphilus betrothed himselfe moued lady indignation tolde neither worthines trueth great owne suffering woont endeare affection could fetter ficklenes mariagedaye appointed taken wife baccha whome complained one diuers place heard blazed impudently vnchaste woman asia withall imperiousnes therein would stick employe whome made vnhappie fauour drawe companion follie multitude whome lesse glorie captaine would doo followed braue souldiers waiwardly proud therefore bold extreamely faultie yet hauing good thing redeeme vnlouely part little beautie disgraced wandring eye vnwaied speech yet pamphilus left leucippe withal left faith leucippe one look cleer iudgement would haue bene acceptable kindness prodigallie bestowed selfe remembrance cruell handling dido ioyned stirred seeke reuenge vpon thought gayne lose life matched therefore leauing punished owne election conueyed leucippe house thereby dedicated vestall nunnes resolued spend yeares youth promised many bewayling wrong yet praying wrong doer next morning hauing striuen sunnes earlines thought seen face great alteration fortune made far distant memorie liking well yong gentleman tooke admitted daiphantus well shewed seruice like serues loues though born prince bloud brought vp tēderest education vnapt seruice woman full thought strange estate yet loue enioyned diligence apprentise bondslaue could euer feare readie commaundementes yong princesse often ala eye say vnto loued yet looking matter conceipt open vnderstand often would come creeping betweene gladnes neere feare offend truely remember meruailed see receiue commandements sighes yet cheerefulnes sometimes answering riddle thought childish inexperience since returning remēbrance haue come cleere vnto knowledge pardon onely deare lady vse many word affection deserues affectionate speach sort serue kingdom bythinia two moneths space time brought good end cruell warre long maintained betweene king bythinia brother excellent cousin diuiding selues either side found meanes triall made selues get credit brought great peace themselues loue towards v hauing made peace done intended returne kingdome galatia towarde thrace ease care father mother sure first shipwracke danger dayly past haue little rest thought till saw v entred kingdome noise great fight guided pleasant valey like one circus great city somewhere doth giue pleasant spectacle running horse either side stretching selfe narrow length hemd wooddy hilles indeed nature meant therein make place beholder behelde one cruellest fightes betweene two knight euer hath adorned martiall storie must confesse stood bewondred another delighted rare brauery therof til seeing streames bloud threatned drowning life gallopped toward part preuented dosen armed knight rather villain vsing time extreame feeblenesse together set vpon common daunger brake particular discord though dying weakenes liuely courage resisted help draue away slue murdering attempter among hapt take aliue principall going disarme two excellent knight found lesse wonder v astonishment themselues two valiaunt indeede famous brother tydeus telenor whose aduenture afterward made vngratious wretch confesse thus fallen noble prince leonatus father death succeeded kingdome galatia forgetting former iniuries receiued naughtie plexirtus streight degree fauour goodnesse apt deceiued others craft deceiue till plaine proofe finding vngratefull man went poyson yet would suffer kindnesse ouercome iustice selfe calling vsed word purpose plexirtus said wickednesse founde thee good deedes mine haue bene able keepe downe thee men counsell take away thy life likely bring foorth nothing daungerous wicked effect cannot finde harte remembring father sonne thou art since violence ambition perchaunce pul thee thine owne iudgement see whether satisfying may quiet ill working thy spirites farre hence great cittie trebisonde territorie aunciently pertained vnto crowne vniustly possessed vniustly abused haue neither title holde vertue rule conquest thy selfe lende thee force giue thee right go therefore lesse vnnaturalnesse glut thy ambition done possible learne vertue plexirtus mingling forsworne excuse falsemeant promise gladly embraced offer hastilie sending backe two brother time v succouring gratious queene erona vertue chiefly onely obteined conquest goodly dominion indeede done gaue authoritie though raigned effect ruled men honouring onely deserued honour many thinking therein please plexirtus considering much bound vnto likewise • certaine sincere boldnesse selfewarranting friendship accepted openly plainely thinking nothing euer plexirtus thought much since rule mind could construe end men doings selfe seking sodenly feared could doo sodainely suspected would doo sodainly hated hauing might minde doo dreading power standing strongly owne valour others affection durst take open way hard take secrete continually followed best euery way hablest region therefore vsed diuelish sleight tell doubting wicked man turne owne friendship toward owne destruction knowing well knew friendship betweene new king pontus neuer since succoured leonatus v ouerthrow gaue vnderstand late passed secrete defiance betweene meete priuately place apointed though fit thing men greatnes yet honour engaged could go backe yet faining find himselfe weake counterfait infirmitie day drawing neere requested go stead making either thē sweare keepe matter secret euen ech deliuering selfe particularity told tydeus king would meet blew armour telenor black armour wicked subtiltie bene apointed caused tydeus take black armour telenor blew appointing way go knew meet till came place appointed promised keepe silence lest king discouer plexirtus wait laied murtherers ouerliued dispatched daring trust enterprise yet thinking till themselues themselues weakened learned chiefly chiefe waybeaters death two worthie brother whose loue lesse valour well might finde much thereof pitifull lamentation knew mismeeting saw despite surgerie could doo vnto striuing runne fastest goale death bewailing dying himselfe cursing owne hand breastes sooner suffering detesting vnfortunatelyspent time hauing serued vngratefull tyraunt accusing folly hauing beleeued could faithfully loue loue faithfulnes wishing v take heed placed good vpon ground proofe vertue since length acquaintance mutuall secrecy height benefit could binde sauage harte man good good himselfe hope beseeching v leaue care besought onely looke found themselues v possibilitie desired ioined embracing crauing pardon denied themselues gaue v sorrowfull spectacle death leauing • ew world behind match thing soone inough knowne ground limit friendship wofull harte caused body conueyed next towne bythinia learning thus much haue tolde caused wicked historian conclude story owne welldeserued death must tell found wofull countenance daiphantus could much maruaile finding cōtinew beyond first assault pittie case stranger conceiue could deepely pearce truth indeed partly shame sorrow tooke father faultinesse partly feare hate conceiued would vtterly disgrace opinion whensoeuer know vehemētly perplexed fayre colour decaied dayly hastily grew extreme working sorowfulnes oft sought learne helpe fearefull louing still concealed decaying still excellencie fairenesse whatsoeuer weakenesse tooke away pitie seemed adde yet still forced selfe waite care diligence might well shew bene taught schoole loue returning againe embarke selues greece vnderstood mighty otanes brother barzanes slaine musidorus battaile six prince entred vpon kingdome pontus partly vpon pretence crowne principally would reuenge vpon knew loued losse brother thincking indeede cause wheresoeuer hearing extremitie would come relieue spite whereof doubted preuaile onely vpon confidence owne vertue power especially company two mighty giant sonnes couple slue realme hauing bene absent father death returned willingly entered seruice hating v king pontus therfore speede went thetherward way fell whensoeuer remember without sorrow must forget withall humanitie poore daiphantus fell extreme sick yet would need conquere delicacie constitution force selfe waite till one day going towarde pontus met one great hast went seeking tydeus telenor whose death yet knowne vnto messenger seruaunt knowing deerely loued plexirtus brought word since departing plexirtus present daunger cruell death valiantnesse one best knightes world reskewed enquired matter glad losse finde vnprofitable treason bene vnto dismember himselfe two friend let messenger part sticking make know master destruction falshood plexirtus griefe finding bodie alreadie brought last degree weakenesse ouerwhelmed little remnant spirit left daiphantus fell sodainely deadly sounding neuer comming selfe withall returned make pittifull lamentation straunge vnto v farre ghessing ground thereof finding sicknesse began print death eye made hast possible conuey next towne could lay bed might find herselfe harbinger ouerhastie death prepared lodging daintie body vndoubtedly feeling weake chearefulnes shewed comfort therein desiring v come neere bodie el might present pale yet euen palenes louely lip neuer neuer indeed time said speake thanke death giues leaue discouer suppressing whereof perchance hath bene sharpest spur hath hasted race end know lord especially lord master pyrocles page daiphantus vnfortunat zelmane sake caused vnfortunate louer cosen palladius leaue father court consequētly aunt mother loose liues sake selfe haue become princesse page sake haue put apparell best could tendernes goodwill pretending indeed better hope recouery inward ambassador tyrant shortly would oppresse deere master said neither hope desire liue know would neuer haue loued word wept ala bene reason considering manie wayes vnworthines sufficeth strange course haue taken shall remembrance witnesse loue yet breaking hart would discouer paine make hope thinke altogether vnmodest thinke deare master thought shall life languishingly looking vpon pray said euen dying eies mine onely sorrie dye shall lose sight pouled locke mine long ornament sex short curles testimonie seruitude maners word rather plentie order oft vsed actor tragedy learned besides slidingnesse language acquaintance many passion frame face beare figure long vsed eye eares men recken fault shamefastnesse nature notable coward yet strangely rarely venturous priuie practises fellowe become neere trust cecropia amphialus mother priuy mischieuous deuises wherewith went ruine basilius child aduauncing sonne though education made full tongue yet loue taught euill secret mistresse bene vsed euer since strange retiring basilius whisper rumor people eares time finding great aptnes multitude one chiefe called skirmish betwixt reason passion seuen shepheards named reasonable shepheards ioined themselues foure making square two going little wide either side like wing maine battell seuenth man formost like forlorne hope begin skirmish like order came seuen appassionated shepheards keeping pase foot voice sundry consorted instrument held armes first formost reasonable side began sing r thou rebell vile come thy master yeeld met answered p tyrant mine mine shall field reason reason tyraunt counted bee passion reason passion free r reason reason gouerne p passion passion rule rost r reason reason p hath reason doth misse r whome passion leades vnto death bent p let die die content r nature reason faith haue sworne p fellowlike togither borne r passion doth ensue liues annoy p passion doth forsake liues void ioy r passion blinde treades vnknowne trace p reason hath eye see owne ill case approched nearer two reason side shot thus sang r dare passion abide reason light p reason dimme passion might r foolish thing glory doth destroy p glorious title foolish toy r weakenes dare strength fight p weaknes weakeneth might r sacred reason helpe vertuous toiles p passion passe feeble reason spoiles r selues abide daily strife p gladly vse sweetnesse life r yet strife sure peace end doth breede p haue peace peace doo neede two square battailes meete steed fighting embrace one another singing thus r strong reason seekes blood p weake feigne good r though cannot orecome cause iust p let v orecome let v vniust r yet passion yeeld length reason stroke p shall winne taking reason yoke r ioyes haue shall made permanent p shall griefe learne repent r repent deed shall blisse p know since present ioyes misse r know reason therefore know p reason yet euer skill show r let v heauenly rule giue place p passion kill reason deface embraced one another came king framed prayses according zelmanes liking whose vnrestrained part mind eie free course delicate philoclea whose looke short well requiting although shee knew hatefull sight iealouse mother dicus time taken great liking dorus good partes foūd aboue age delight taste fruites wit though subiect himselfe despised entred speach manner following eclogue dicus dorus dicus dorus tell thy wonted motion make wood resound thy lamentation thy sainte dead dead thy deuotion doth holde loue estimation witnes thinkes thought delicious think make thing badge sweet passion dorus doth make thee dicus suspicious due faith need must immutable others vertue doubt themselues vicious although mettals mutable beames haue wrought therein faire impression force chaunge nothing sutable dicus harte well set doth neuer shunne confession noble thy bandes make notorious silence doth seeme maske base oppression glory loue doth make loue glorious doth feare bideth muet wilfully shewes guilty harte doth deeme state opprobrious thou framst wordes voice skilfully yeeld eares sweet sound relation loue tooke thee force caught thee guilefully dorus sunnie beames shame heaunly habitation threeleaud grasse seeme sheepe vnsauorie base sowre loues high vocation sheepes cry helpe sunnes owne brauerie may hope pipe may haue abilitie helpe praise deck slauerie word ennoble selfe nobilitie doubt voice deceaued eye force beyond possibilitie dicus thy word well voycd well gracde almost heaued quite selfe loue loues contemplation till thought thy sodaine ende bereaued goe therefore tell v fashion thy owne proofe get straunge possession possest strengthens invasion dorus sight roote thought progression child hood wonder prentizeship attention youth delight age soules oppression doubt sleepe waketh inuention fancie foode clothing carefulnes beautie booke play louers dissention eye • urious search vailde warefulnesse wing desire oft clipt desperation largesse hand could neuer skill sparefulnesse doth might perswasion conquere conquest ratifie experience doubt schooles hold disputation dicus thy sheepe may thy good wish satisfie large encrease wooll fine perfection thy loue eye thy eye may gratifie thou wilt giue soules deare refection telling framed helpe hurt thee owne infection dorus blest name wherewith mistres named whose wound salues whose yoke please pleasure doth staines beames vertue fault blamed hart eye eare onely find treasure doth numbring artes endlesse grace number time place life • witt scarcely rare gift measure doth rage sunne sommer hot yet haruest brings doth ala absent selfe sunne hid kindly shadow cumber giue grace doth content herselfe shine heauns distributed venus seemes make vp spent herselfe thus say mischiefes haue contributed greater good diuine reflection harmes blisse attributed thus framd eye direction loue life anger distruction lastly thats protection dicus thy safetie sure wrapped destruction construction thine owne wordes beare man feare woman moodie eye make reason lie slaue seruile sense weake defence weaknes thy force remorse follie dearly bought dorus thought heare blasphemous wordes brest sword soule hell haue solde rather would thus mine eares defile word vile viler breath doth breed heards take heed woolfe haue found hunting round strongest kill breast doth fill earth others woe loden pull downe pulld downe destroyes sheepheards boyes eschue tongue venome enuenome soule sens best defense flie adder tongue like ladder made clime dishonour iudge honour hath scope slander dicus dorus wander farre great reproches loue encroches charmed reason season end singing anger bringing fancie sickemans frenzie rather take compassion rage rage rather wish send thee thou soone may haue helpe change passion oft lookes starres fauour bend thee fortune store nature health loue grant perswasion quiet mind none thy selfe lend thee thus amphialus translated zelmane present seemed many tedious clog thralled obligation seruice diligent exprobrate thought vnto vnworthie estate euen seruice authoritie commanding onely construing seruitude owne nature esteeming right right bitter seruitude shot well soeuer leuelled carried awrie marke storme mislike prince amphialus affectionately languished cecropia spitefullie cunning disdained barrennes successe willingly cecropia would haue reuenged saw hurt could diuided sonnes mischiefe wherefore bethought selfe attempt pamela whose beautie equall hoped shee might bee woon • sonnes thoughtes would rather rest beautifull gratefulnes still tormented disdaining beautie therefore giuing new courage wicked inuentions vsing industry mist taking euen precept preuailing pamela fayling philoclea shee went chamber according owne vngratious method subtile proceeding stood listning dore circumstance present behauiour might kindly arise fitte beginning intended discourse shee might perceaue pamela walke vp downe full deepe though patient thought look countenance setled pace soft almost still one measure without passionate gesture violent motion till length awaking strengthning selfe well said yet best sure soeuer wrong cannot ouermaster god darkenes blind eye iayle barres else flie succoure therewith kneeling downe euen stood thus said allseeing light eternall life al thing nothing either great may resist small contemned looke vpon miserie thine eye mercie let thine infinite power vouchsafe limite proportiō deliuerance vnto thee shal seem conuenient let iniurie ô lord triumphe ouer let faultes thy hande corrected make mine vniuste enemie minister thy iustice yet god thy wisdome aptest chastizement vnexcuseable follie low bondage bee fittest ouerhie desire pride notinough humble harte bee thus bee broken lorde yeeld vnto thy ioyfully embrace sorrow thou wilt haue suffer onely thus much let craue thee let crauing ô lord accepted thee since euen proceedes thee let mee craue euen noblest title greatest affliction may giue selfe thy creature thy goodnes thy selfe thou wilt suffer beame thy maiestie shine mind may still depende confidently vpon thee let calamitie bee exercise ouerthrowe vertue let power preuaile preuaile destruction let greatnes praie let paine bee sweetnes reuenge let seem good vnto thee vexe punishment ô lord let neuer wickednes haue hand may carie pure minde pure bodie pausing ô gracious lorde said euer become preserue vertuous musidorus parte cecropia might well heare latter prayer musidorus hart helde iewellike treasure woulde scarce trust owne lippes withall prayer sent heauen heauenly creature feruent grace deuotion borowed bodie make selfe beautifull representation eye lifted skieward one woulde haue thought begunne flie thetherwarde take place among fellow starres naked hand raising vp whole length kissing one another right ben picture zeale left humblenesse vnited themselues make suite acceptable lastly sens rather token instrument inwarde motion altogether straunge working power euen hardeharted wickednesse cecropia founde loue goodnes yet felt abashment goodnes kindly remorse yet yrksome accusation naughtines put biasle foreintended lesson well shee found way time take mind lest image vertue figure thereof hart knew yet prodigally spend vttermost eloquence leauing argument vnproued might force inuade excellent iudgement iustnes request marriage worthinesse suiter owne present fortune shoulde onely haue amendment felicitie besides falsely making belieue sister would thinke selfe happie shee might haue loue shee contemned obliquely touching daunger sonne accept philoclea marriage match next heire apparant shee powre yet plentifully periuring extreamely sonne loued excusing little shewes hee made duetifull respect bare vnto taking vpon selfe restrayned since shee found shee could set limit passion shee philoclea tribute gift seeke bring mind seruitude meanes might either establish beholdingnesse lest awake kindnes reason imprisonment one sister knew wooed might thinke onely shee sought philoclea sweet humble dealing auoid assault maiestie vertue beate day speach sooner broken reason stood watche vpon top keepe onely see great dust arise earth sent vp would striue haue clowdes well aire might spie sometimes especially dust wherein naked winde apparaile selfe caried side shining armour like flashing lightning wherewith clowdes seeme bee childe sunne guilding beames gaue sight delightfull abide terrour watch gaue quicke alarum souldiers within whome practise already hauing prepared began vnabashed harte lest countenaunces looke charge obedience allotted vnto onely clinias amphialus exceed bound mediocrity one naturall coldnesse cowardise heate courage clinias bold onely busie whispering euen whisperingnes rather indeede confident cunning bee bewraied way bolde euer bee bewrayed enemy gaue dreadfull aspect vnto castle eye saw terror eare heard martiall sounde multiplied hideousnesse mated minde comming many time felt dreadfull expectation yet minde willing ease selfe burden offeare somtime • aine vnto selfe possibilitie let death basilius discord nobilitie cause fayled nature chaunce serued cause vnto sometimes hearing men speake valiantly quietnesse vnassailed sens woulde make himselfe beleue hee durst doo something present shallow walles thin misdouted ech man treason coniectured euery possibilitie misfortune onely forecasting likely peril planet together coulde scarcely haue conspired already began arme selfe though betweene v two resolue lest ruinous want gouernment dissolue let one princesse yeeld vaine equalitie contention field let haue giftes remaine let beautie chastnesse fully raigne preuaile giue giftes lay office resteth onely v two precedence shall accorded like hereby doth lie youth beckned vntome yet spotlesse truth may doubt discerne better witt lot becommeth v v fortune determines crowne amber faire amber crowne held worthiest let giue hath beheld saith venus glad heare proffer made well showd smiling cheere though paris doome chiefe goddess beautie ouercome smirkly thus gan say neuer sought debate diana deare minde loue hate euer apt pastime despise neuer spited thought ouerwise kindnesse profred none kinder ready meane peace trie let iudge lad doth please well thus come began tell togither spake loth behinde solemne oth deity would binde stand vnto made know first agast first saw showe bolder waxt waxt prowde sway must beare neere acquaintance dooth diminish reuerent feare hauing bound fast styx obaye decreed thus verdict saye ill rule well hath discord taught ne yet ought see beauty merit ought yonder nymphe therefore mira point crowne aboue euer appoint would haue spoken crie fie fie haue done vngodly rebell fie need must yeelde othes require yet thou shalt go free quoth venus fire beautie kindle shall within thy foolish minde thou full oft shalt wish thy iudging eye blinde nay diana said chastnesse giue ash despaire though burnt shall make thee liue nay thou said shalt see beames shine face thou shalt neuer dare seeke helpe wretched case cursed curse thou ô traytour sleepe made rest hast thou framde paine wherewith opprest cowarde cupid thus doost thou thy honour keepe vnarmde ala vnwarnd take man asleepe laying onely conquest hart conquerour foot would faine haue made aunswere remembraunce philoclea serued forcible barrier betweene anger angry effect said woulde put trouble giue counsaile hee might returne hee listed presently philanax glad career fro cloth needle self wold haue ben loth haue gone frōward mistres hoped return thitherward quickly againe cloth loking many eies vpon louingly embracing wound gaue sheares also hand behead silke grown short time put mouth bite seemed beene long making rose hand shee would instāt make rose lip lillie semed haue whitenesse rather hand made matter wherof made grew therby sūnes eys refreshed indiscō fort comfortable ayre vnwares sigh might bestow vpon colour ground well chosen neither sullenly darke glaringly lightsome wel proportioned though much cunning yet serue ornament principall woorke without maruaile see mind could cast carelesse semblant vpon greatest conflictes fortune could commaund selfe take care small matter neither neglected daintie dressing selfe mariage time affliction rather semed remember owne worthinesse vnworthinesse husband wel one might perceyue reiected counsaile glasse hand pleased themselues paying tribute vndeceyuing skill high perfection nature sight whereof diuerse sister rather suffered sorrowe dresse selfe beautie would bestow intertainment vnwelcome guest made cecropia take suddaine assurednesse hope obtaine somewhat pamela thinking according squaring owne good nature beautie carefully set foorth woulde soone proue signe vnrefusing harborough animated wherewith shee sate downe pamela taking purse affected curiositie looking vpon worke full happie saide least hee knew owne happinesse purse maner hand wrought dedicated faith shall haue cause account purse treasure treasure selfe worthie bee pursed vp purse owne hart thinke indeede saide pamela halfe smiling promise wrought make tedious houres beleeue thought else valued euen verie purse right nature saide cecropia beauty worke vnwitting effectes wonder truely saide pamela neuer thought till outward glasse intitled beautie pleaseth lay thinke vnguiltie charge pleasaunt mixture naturall colour delightfull eye musicke eare without consequence since thing onely beastes haue euen stone tree many doo greatly excell thinges answered cecropia haue portion take away excellencie indeede doth excell since see euen beastes tree stone name beauty onely highly praised beautie humaine person beyond al thing great likelihood reason since onely giuen iudgement discerne beautie among reasonable wightes seemes sex hath preheminence preheminence nature counteruailes al liberality wherein may bee thought haue dealte fauourably towarde mankind doo men crowne thinke themselues glorie hauing either force brought others yeelde minde long studie premeditated oration perswaded would haue perswaded see faire woman shall onely commaund without authoritie perswade without speaking shall neede procure attention owne eye chaine eares vnto men venture liues cōquere conqueres liues without venturing serued obeyed notable lawe commaund become lawes themselues obey parent sake sake need dispute whether gouerne feare loue since without thinking thereof loue bring foorth feare feare fortifie loue shee neede seeke offensiue defensiue force since onely lippes may stande ten thousand shieldes tenne thousand vneuitable shot goe eye beautie beautie deere neece crowne feminine greatnes gifte soeuer heauens therein nigardly bestowe without question bound vse noble purpose created onely winning preseruing since indeede right happines onely itselfe happie also deriue happines another certainly aunt said pamela feare make think selfe fairer euer think fairenes matter greater valew heretofore could imagine euer til conceaued conquest speake rather proceed weakenes conquered strength conquering power say crane ouerthrow whole battailes pygmees much cranish courage pygmees wee see young babe thinke baby woonderfull argalus liue request life went aside fear hurting would haue begun cōbate afresh amphialus cōiured held monarchie mind euen noble hart melting cōpassion passionate sight desired withhold hāds giuing mercie neyther af • ected ouerliue dishonour argalus much striuing amphialus like sorte like sorte woulde haue dealt labouring owne power chiefly despised set himselfe forward stretching strength vttermost fire strife blowen inward rage boyled bloud aboundance hee driuen rest vpon pommel sworde thing beginning turne round daunce death eye sight dazled dimmed till thinking sit downe fel sowne parthenia amphialus hastely went vnto amphialus tooke helmet parthenia laid head lap tearing linnen sleues partlet serue wound bind shee tooke hairlace woulde haue cut faire haire herselfe squire iudges came fitter thing purpose bewayled selfe lamentable sweetnes inough haue taught sorrow gladdest thought haue engraued mindes hardest mettall parthenia parthenia said art thou seest thou thy blisse moment fallen art thou euennow lady example perfect happines nowe gasingstocke endles miserie god hath bene desert thus punished haue bene desert selfe punished wandring life wildernes thee amphialus arcadia forsaken knight wisheth health courage hand thou maiest receyue punishment thy treason according thine owne offer wickedly occasioned thou hast proudly begun accursedly mainteyned presently thy minde faint thee owne guiltinesse meete thee thy iland order hath former beene vsed thou likest time place weapon ready take thine owne reasonable choise thou doo perfourme substaunce make answere may shewe thou hast taste honour leaue thee liue till meete thee amphialus read deepe sigh according humour inward affliction seemed euen condemne selfe though indeed reproches true howsoeuer dulnes melancholy would haue languishingly yeelded thereunto courage vnused iniuries desired helpe anger make answere forsaken knight though namelesse challenge might carry selfe excuse seemed gape carrion onely raynes snake finely wrapping themselues one within head came together cheekes boss bit might seeme bite horse horse champte bit bite white foame ingendred poysonous furie combatt impresa catoblepta long lie dead moone whereto hath naturall sympathie want light worde signified moone wanted light poore beast wanted moones light headpiece whippe witnesse selfepunishing repentaunce horse coleblacke hauing much one starre giue light night blackenesse one would haue thought bene two sonnes sorrow come thether fight birthright sorie inheritance aliance passion moued amphialus alredy tenderminded affliction loue without staffe sword drawne trotted fairely forsaken knight willing haue put combat melancholy hart euer like occasion misgiue therefore saluting good knight said men know reason doo thing tell cause make thus eager fight affirme answered forsaken knight thou dost rebellious iniurie lady whome men owe seruice shall fight saide amphialus vpon quarrell confesse proceeds owne beauty inforce loue offer force maintaine said forsaken knight thou art worthy loue confesse said amphialus since world richly blessed bring forth thing worthie thereof vnworthy since none worthy loue yes vnworthy selfe said forsaken knight though deserue contempt thou deseruest contempt hatred amphialus thinking though wrongly indeede mistaking riuall forgat minde reconciliation hauing thought bound vp choler neuer staying either iudge trumpet owne launce drew sword saying thou lyest false villaine vnto word blowes came quick together one seemed lightning others thunder found barren ground seede yeelded owne encrease though reason amazement go rarely togither yet reasonable eies saw found reason amazed fury combat neuer game death better plaid neuer fury set selfe forth greater brauerie curteous vulcan wrought curteous wiues request aenaeas armour made hammer beget greater sounde sword noble knight needed fire forge made fire shine meeting sword deceiued stand still beholder rare match neither could amazed eies discerne motion sunne breath winde stirred either feare would come among blow delight eies busie forgot open mouth fight cruell since loue hatred conspired sharpen humour hard say whether loue one trumpet hatred another gaue lowder ala • um courage spite rage disdaine shame reuenge came waighting vpon hatred side came louelonging desire inuincible hope fearelesse despaire riuallike iealousie although brought vp within doores schoole cupid woulde shewe themselues lesse forward dustie band mar make themselues notable notablenes combat eyther side confidence vnacquainted losse assured trust ouercome good experience ouercome seconding terrible blowes cunning labouring horse winne ground enimie vnlookedfor parting one win suffring fire fuell put hungrie still deuoure strake vnsatisfied striking verie armour piecemeale fell away yet flesh abode wound constantly though lesse sensible smart senselesse armour blood place stayning blacke couler would giue liuely coulour mourning blacke doo long space fought neither vertue fortune seemed partiall either side tormented vnquiet hart amphialus resolued see quicke ende therefore violence courage adding strength blow strake wise vpon side others head remembrance left battered lodging quite • rom himselfe casting armes abroade redie fall downe sword likewise went hand fast chaine arme could loose amphialus vsed fauour occasion redoubling blowes horse weary beaten well master carried master away til came vnto could haue seene might well haue discerned shame cheekes reuenge eye setting teeth togither rage came running vpon amphialus reaching arme gathered vp sword meaning blow haue cleaued amphialus two amphialus seeing blow comming shunned nimble turning horse aside wherwith forsaken knight ouerstrake himselfe almost came downe owne strength hungrie purpose bard food disdaining resistance force fortune returned vpon spurre againe ranne violence vpon amphialus horse force shocke rose vp almost ouerturned amphialus perceauing rayne spurre put forth horse withall gaue mightie blow descent horse vpon shoulder forsaken knight whence sliding fell vpon necke horse horse man fell ground scarce downe vp feete againe braue gesture shewing rising corage falling fortune curteous amphialus excused himselfe hauing kild horse excuse thy selfe viler fault answered forsaken knight vse poore aduantage best thou canst thou shalt quickly finde thou hast neede thy folly said amphialus shall make forget selfe therewith trotting little aside alighted horse would haue fortune come claime part victory curteous act would haue mollified noble harte forsaken knight done besides iaylor mistres sufficient defeazaunce firmest bond good nature therefore sooner displeasing sight philoclea philoclea whō alredy extreame sense sorrow brought dulnesse therein face without token beautie bene many misery cruelly battered yet shewed perfection beautie coulde remaine vnouerthrowne enimies zelmane set downe woman gone away might better perswaded body heard say would bee perswaded began first eye speake hart crie sorrow would nedees speake owne language without vsing tongue interpreter last zelmane brake silence spake onely eloquence amazement long methodized oratione inherited onely kinde speech deare ladie extreame necessity must ala vnfortunate wretch liue see daye take heauen earth witnesse nothing brest swelled spite griefe breath leasure turne selfe word sweet philoclea alredie dyed pamela side heauines hart something quickned beloued sight zelmane ghessed somewhat zelmanes mind therefore spake vnto sort pyrocles saide shee knowe exceeding comfort presence brought vnto mee goodwill owned vnto mee suppose make perswade saue life ransome mine honour although bodie shoulde bee vnfit pleader cause selfe yet perchance woulde haue liue honour god forbid saide zelmane euer cause yeeld touch pretend affection til time libertie might worke somthing seruice astonished sens would giue leaue would faine haue perswaded purpose pyrocles said philoclea miserable time gaine hath pamelaes example wrought mee captiue life much worth euer goe lip loue pyrocles shall tongue bee false traitor hart say loue pyrocles liue pamela sister pamela shoulde liue onely thy sake pyrocles would liue thee know well shall liue thee hath thy loue base allay pyrocles wish mee liue sor dissimulation pyrocles simplicitie haue hardly bene able keepe straight way shall doo crooked case meane dissimulation cunningest present answere required present performance vpon answere art thou terrible ô death pyrocles doo thanke thee soule thanke thee confesse loue thee heerein chiefest vertue trouble mee therefore deare pyrocles double death tormenting resolution since cannot liue thee dye thee onely remember deare pyrocles loue remembrance mee may craue much thee let thy last loue though worthy thee indeed art worthiest creature liuing yet remember loue worthy loue pyrocles ouercome sorrow wisdome vertue made iust excellent lady case full excellent kindnes word ashamed come forth knowing weak expresse mind merit therefore stayed deadly silence forsaken hope forsaking comfort till appointed gardians came see fruit zelmanes labour zelmane warned presence fell againe perswade though scarcely selfe could tell sum desirous delayes philoclea sweetly continuing constant end punishing importunity silence zelmane faine ende yet crauing time conference shee obtained diuers others till last cecropia founde purpose therefore determined follow owne way zelmane yet still desirous win meanes respit euen wasted sorrow vncertaine whether worse case presence absence able doo nothing philocleas succour submitting greatest corage earth fall feete see philocleas selfe hauing veile beautie ouer face still appeared aliue eye shine euen woont woont sometimes moued might well make beholder think death therein borowed beautie way disgraced death gouernment haue let poure mischiefes vpon mee see whether haue power make mee wrecthed excell haue prayed abhominable hande detestable deuill commaunded cursed light beheld light cursed mine eye haue amphialus grieued withall haue thee power without glory embrace thee without comfort often haue blest meanes might bring neere thee woe worth cause brings neere thee often ala often hast thou zelmane ready minde say stept vnto resolute stayednes void either anger kindnes disdaine humblenesse speake sort anaxius said fame haue bene ouerpartiall thee thou art man exceeding valour therefore doo call thee euen vertue make iudge v doo affirme eternall blot faire actes thou hast done thou doest weakely seeking without daunger reuenge death whose life daunger thou mightst perhapes haue preserued thou doost cowardly going death excellent lady preuent iust punishment hereafter power better father could make might lay vpon thee doost basely presenting thy selfe executioner vile office vpon men iust cause beyond degree vile worde vniust cause vpon lady lady therefore hangman say thou art vnworthy counted knight admitted companie knight neither say alleadge reason wisdome iustice onely demaund lady whome defende may liberty see combate zelmane began speech excellency beautie grace made little content heare besides new lesson read pamela already taught regard shee entered brauerie speech hee thought first mad railing humor possest till finding speech hold well together length come flatte challenge combat hee stoode leaning backe bodie head sometimes bent browes looking vpon one side sometimes beyonde maruell maruailing hee neuer heard speech knight shoulde thus rebuffed woman maruell made heare speech ended turned head brother zoilus said nothing onely lifting vp eye smiled zelmane finding minde anaxius said perchaunce thou disdaynest answere woman thou thinkest fitte bee fought tell thee haue beene trayned vp martiall matter good successe haue many time ouercome brauer knightes thy selfe wel knowen equall feates armes famous pyrocles slewe thy valiaunt vncle giant euardes remembraunce vncles death • hing netled answered thus indeed saide woman may bee valiaunt coward traytorly boy slewe vncle trayterously ranne plaine field fiue thousand could haue ouercome euardes falshood sought ouer asia following stil one conyholes another till comming countrie heard friend besieged came blow away wretch troubled wheresoeuer miserable boy flie heauen hell shall keepe harte torne handes thou lyest thy throate said zelmane boye euer went noble actes thy harte proude dare think much lesse perfourme please thee better presence tell thee creature neerer kinne selfe well loue woulde sorrier owne death mine begotten father amazon ladie therefore thou canst deuise reuenge thy self vpon killing thou darest doo manfullie doo otherwise thou harme incomparable lady felfe without daring fight protest knight heauen earth reueile thy shame thou art beggerliest dastardly villaine dishonoureth earth steppe thou lettest ouerliue blaze thee coulde moue anaxius onely said euill become terror world fight much worse skolde thee said death pointing princess grace giue life withall going pamela offring take chin minion saide hee yeeld gently shall onely liue liue happily hee would haue said pamela displeased wordes matter maner putting awaye faire hande proud beast said shee yet thou plaiest worse thy comedy thy tragedy part assure thy selfe since destiny moment life death stand equall balance rather haue thee thinke thee far fitter hangman husband pride anger woulde faine haue cruelly reuenged bitter answere alredy cupid begun make sport pull plume vnused waye courtesie put byas pride hee hastily went away grumbling himselfe foorth bloud deedes howe many despised excellent woman much bound woulde seeke summe speech like bestower desirer felicitie excellent pastime woulde delight play vertue see wittie ignorance shee forth inexpected reliefe said pamela shall longer flatter aduersity shoulde wee delight make selues longer ball iniurious fortune since owne parent content tyraunts ouer v since kinne content traitorously abuse v certainly mishap may bee comforte v wee lighted fellowes handes yet keepe v hauing cause miserable friend meanes nothing grieues noble ladie zelmane whome worlde might haue made v
