mind vnder colour friendship robbes chiefe force resolution vertuous faire ladie saide zelmane say true truth may wel make vp part harmonie noble thought yet time ought alwaies bee one tuned may bring foorth good doo barre selfe thereof bee time die nobly liue nobly earnestly shee persuaded referre themselues father consent obtayning wherof knew would bespent meanes temper mind prowde woers ende pamela yeelded spake reason philoclea yeelded reason spake againe sollicited little pleasing petition pamela forced selfe make answere anaxius father gaue consent shee would make selfe belieue heauenly determination since shee meanes auoide anaxius franke promiser selfe successe nothing doubted basilius consent rather assured selfe would bee oratour matter therefore hee chose officious seruaunt whome esteemed wise hee neuer found iust opinion willed embassadour basilius make knowe meant haue daughter safe happie desired himselfe haue sonne lawe woulde onely protect quiet course listed accept would giue monarchy worlde receaue anaxius neuer knewe pray thinge would make know power anaxius euery thing beyonde yet resisted power seruaunt smiling castevp looke desired god make memorie able containe treasure wise speach therefore besought repeate againe oftener hearing minde might better acquainted diuines thereof gratiously granted hee doubted carying conceit grace wherewith anaxius spake persuade rocky mind owne harme little doubted win basilius hee thought woulde make thinke heauens opened harde proffer thereof anaxius grauely allowed probabilitie coniecture therefore sent away promising hee shoulde haue bringing vp second sonne pamela messenger speede perfourmed lord commaundement basilius nature quiet superstition made doubtfull lothe take matter armes hande wherein already hee found slowe successe though philanax vehemently vrged thereunto making see retiring backe encourage iniuries basilius betwixt feare anaxius might passion loue iealousie estate perplexed notable determine tooke common course men flie onely deuotion want resolution therefore detaining messenger delay hee deferred directing course counsell apollo himselfe time coulde well go require hee entrusted matter best trusted philanax one obedience sufficient reason vnto wente diligence delphos entred secrete place temple hauing performed sacrifice vsuall spirite possest prohesying woman sacred fury attended demaund would argue incredulitie tolde darke wonted speech plainely bee vnderstood came hee returne basilius denie daughter anaxius brother reserued better beloued god doubte returne vnto safely speedily keepe solitary course til philanax basilius fully agreed vnderstanding former prophecie withall commaunding philanax thenceforward giue tribute oblation humane wisedome philanax finding reason cannot shewe selfe reasonable leaue reasoning thing aboue reason returnes lorde like one preferred trueth maintaining opinion hidde nothing thence foorth durste disswade founde celestiall prouidence directed hee selfe looking repayre gouernment much broken estate ciuill dissention hee might fortifying notable arte lodge almost made vnaprochable hee lefte basilius bemone absence daughter bewayle imprisonment zelmane yet wholly giuen holily obey oracle gaue resolute negatiue vnto messenger anaxius waited yet good termes desiring shewe selfe respect birth profession princely knight without forcing seeke waye force deliuer noble sorte lady vnto iniurie haue bene amphialus benefite messenger went backe answere yet hauing euer vsed sugre thing maister receaue tolde basilius first vnderstood desire ouerreach farre hopefull expectation thought great boldnesse harken man whome heauens interest without asking god counsell therefore sent principall counsailour delphos although kepte matter neuer secrete yet diligence inspired anaxius priuiledge ouer worldly thinges founde secrete hee shoulde presume marrie daughter one already enrolled among demiegods yet much lesse dare attempting take hand anaxius till made fortune creator force god nowe began finde wisedome aboue iudged rightly time seruauntes wayting basilius resolution brother courted lady whome vouchsafed haue wiues resolued dally longer delayes make violence oratour since hee found persuasion gotten nothing answeres intention opened brother hauing wanted nothing take way authoritie gaue spurres running vnworthy men neither feeling vertue themselues tendring others headlong make euill consort loue force anaxius worde tower descried company armed men marching towards towne wherefore gaue present order seruauntes souldiers goe gate walles leauing none within himselfe brother thought full intended pray marshis lowdest trumpet could scarcely haue awaked directing would haue done yongest brother zoilus glad commission went name anaxius tell sister since answere father brother licurgus haue sort pleased would graunt longer time presently determine whether thought honorable comfort compelled perswaded pamela made answere matter whereon whole state life depended wherein euer answered would lead follow parent pleasure thought reason either letter particular messenger vnderstand somthing thē selues haue beleef bound report partiall seruant therfore word sister euer simple true resolution vniust force god hoped would either arme liues take away liues well lady said leaue brother come vnto owne embassador part must selfe seruice turning vp mustachoes marching would begin pauen • e went toward zelmane zelmane hauing messenger basilius much keepe excellent lady seeking pasport death escape base danger wherevnto found themselues subiect still hoping musidorus would finde meanes deliuer thē therefore often owne example comfortable reason perswaded ouerpasse many insolent indignity proud suters thought sufficient fauour vttermost iniurie come againe streight feared either death dishonor heroicall courage would haue let bene beyonde herselfe amazed yet held vp wit attend vttermost occasion euen brought hairie forehead vnto zoilus smacking lippes prologue kisse something aduancing himselfe darling said let thy hart full ioy let thy faire eies counsell day thou shalt haue zoilus many haue lōged none shall haue zelmane oh much glory haue think race wil betwne v world heauēs world little would haue put arme necke withdrawing selfe lord said much good may thought may dissemble natiuitie cast one neuer failed prognostication haue bene assured neuer apt beare child since honor hie fauor must onely desire may performe vow made among countriwomen famous amazon would neuer marrie none one able withstand armes therefore make mine owne desire seruiceable must vouchsafe lend armor weapon least blow two sword may finde selfe periured selfe zoilus laughing hartie lowdnes went force embrace making answere since mind trie knighthood quickly know man armes without reuerence lady began struggle zelmane disdaine became wisdome anger gaue occasion abiding longer aboad matter put though disguised pyrocles farre fuller strong nimblenes tript vp feete fell downe withall meaning pursue begun puld sword ware could strike withall gat vp ranne faire chamber left two brother preparing themselues come downe mistress followed heeles euen came throw himselfe armes succor hit owne sword blow vpon waste almost cut asunder sundred soule body sending proserpina angry goddesse rauishers anaxius seing eye miserable end brother fuller despite wrath yet fuller wrath sorow looking wofull eye vpon brother lycurgus brother said strengthen therefore due commendation giuen conquere loue loue wisedome mee shall goodnes turne euill vngratefulnes bee token true harte pyrocles shall possesse principall seate soule name pyrocles shall helde deuout reuerence would neuer haue come cruell instant parting ilfaring word farewell zelmane sene farre olde basilius hauing perfourmed sacrifice apollo daughter principally mistresse happy returne since bene euery seeke nowe come within compasse discerning beganne frame loueliest coūtenance could stroking vp legges setting bearde due order standing bolte vpright ala said zelmane behold euill foretoken sorrowfull departure yonder see one fury doth daylie vexe farewell fare wel musidorus god make fortune waite thy vertues make mee wade lake wretchednes dorus burst floud teares resolued thēselues whatsoeuer fell vnto neuer vpon occasion vtter name cōseruing honour royal parentage keep name daiphantus palladius ben agreed thē tooke diuerse way dorus lodgward wher heauy eye might somthing refreshed zelmane towards basilius saying selfe skornefull smiling yet hath friendly fortune depriued pleasant companion hauing much searche come presence doubt desire bred great quarrel mind former experience taught doubt true feeling loue made doubt daungerous working desire ere long wonne fielde therefore submissiue maner behauiour could yeeld goddesse said hee towardes haue greatest feeling religion displeased shew deuotion haue made apollo since know thing knowes harte beares farre awful reuerēce self like deity wil euer deceaued answered zelmane wil make selfe competitor apollo neither blasphemy duty basilius tooke bosome certaine verse written kneling downe presented contained phaebus farewell sweeter saint serue high conceit thy heaunly wisedomes breed thought forget thought neuer swerue whome sowne freedomes seede whose eye dayly doome reede phaebus farewell sweeter saint serue thou art farre thy kingdome aboue heaun earth beauty doth preserue thy beames like cleare rayes loue thy force feare force still proue phaebus yeelde vp thy title minde doth possesse thy image defaste thy rage braue reuenge finde hath thy temple raste employ thy might fire may taste much worth surmounteth thee make much base louing hymne said left auncestors begone selfe temple wherin daylie songe soule sacrifice offer withall whatsoeuer zelmane euer thought shee founde speech ill taste medecine operation poyson would haue suffred disdainful looke haue bene onely witnesse good acceptation basilius began fresh lay many pittifull prayer ende conclude fully opinion onely vnfortunatenes place hindered prosperous course desire therefore since hatefull influence made embrace solitary life past ouer doubted iudgment philanax would agree late mishapes taught perillous commit prince state place weakely guarded enclined returne pallace mantinea hoped beter able shew much desired make al many honnie wordes penne growes almost weary set downe indeede neerely pierced zelmane good beginning shee obtained philoclea made desire continue trade till vnto perfecting desire come publike place • hee deadly feare lest maske many eye might sooner discouered hope stopped state ioyes endaungered therefore shee rested musing dayly chaunging labyrinth owne fortune selfe determined onely best keepe fauors make loue place fauors receiued disgrace made apte chaunge soyle therefore casting kinde corner looke vpon truely saide saide age cooleth bloud howe soone goodman terrified receaue hurte doe knowe daintines kindly vnto v hard obtayning excuse woman graunting yet speake though like obtaine graūt would haue imagin wonne courtely vanity esteeme man hath handsome men waite affraid liue without might haue seene basilius humbly swell lowly looke stand vpon tiptoe diuersitie word deliuered vnto hercules aunswered basilius afraide bloud cold boyle fournace care mee enioy presence place good bad pleaseth blesse curse let armed good grace defie whatsoeuer mee loue forcible age without vigoure zelmane thought good stomacke receaue surfet much fauoure therefore thinking enough time keepe sodaine remouing certaine gracious bowing downe heade towarde turned away saying would leaue time see temperately hee could vse bountifull measure kindenes basilius thought euery dropp flood bred refreshment durst presse ancient modestie left sweete repast owne fancy zelmane assoone departed went towarde pamelas lodge hope haue seene friende dorus haue pleased selfe another paynefull farrewell haue taken aduise touching owne estate whereof sorowe suffered thinke come euen neere lodge saw mouth caue made seeme nature despite arte fitly riche growing marble serue beautifie vawt first entrie vnderfoot ground semed mynerall yeelding glistering shewe golde say ryuer tagus caries sandie bed caue framed many goodly spatious roomes selfeliking men haue long learned delicacie founde easefull rann little sweete riuer lefte face earth drowne selfe smale waye darke pleasant mansion first shewe place entised melancholy minde zelmane yeelde selfe ouer flood owne thoughtes therefore sitting downe first entrie caues mouth song shee lately made shee gaue dolefull waye bitter affectes shee sunge effecte since stormy rage passion darcke passion darke made darke beauty light whith rebell force hath closde dungeon darke minde ere led foorth reason light since thinges giue mine eye light foster still fruites fancy darke windowes inward light serue make inward power darke since say minde sences darke hurt helpt piercing light light may shewe horror darke cannot make resolued darkenes lighte like place whereat least darke may keepe thoughtes thought wonted light steede instrument song accompanied wringing hand closing weary eye euen sometime cut swellinge hir sighes suffer voice haue free natiue passage musing vpon songe raising vp spirites something falne weakenes lamentation considering solitary complaint good whose helpe stand himselfe shee might far first heare whispering sounde seemed come inmost parte caue kept together close hollownes place truncke liberall accesse eares might perceaue voice deliuer selfe musicall tune base lyra giue foorth songe harke plaintfull ghostes infernall fury harke vnto woe hatefull heauens sende heauens conspird make vitall sparke wreched wracke glasse ruines ende seeing ala mightie power bende ireful shotte weake marke come caue become graue come death lende receipte within thy bosome darke life dayly dieng minde drawing breath sucke aire woe much sight make bodie blinde highest thought downeward headlong throw thus forme thus state finde death wrapt flesh liuing graue assignd pawsing little monefull melodie continued octaue like sicke folkes whome strange humor flowe taste sweetes sower onely please minde passion daylie growe whose fyrie chaines vppon freedome feaze ioies stranger seeme cannot bide showe brooke oughte el well acquainted woe bitter griefe taste best paine ease sicke death still louing disease venus saide zelmane well acquainted mee make liuely portracture misery surely spirit appointed haue care doth darke place beare parte complaint vnhappie charge heauens haue time measure wrathefull harmes surely many haue come blistlesse lot rest world hath small portion make cause wailefull lamentation saide whatsoeuer thou seeke thee thy musique well assures wee leasthand fellowe prentises one vngracious master raise shee went guiding selfe still playning voice till sawe vppon stone little waxe light set vnder piece paper verse verie lately seeme written howe sunn whose beames shining bright become cause darke ouglie night howe captiud darke plight bewaile case cause delight mangled mind huge horror still doe fright sense possest claimd reason right betwixt two haue fight wher wynns put selfe flight come clowdie feares close vp daseled sight sorrowes suck vp marowe might due sighes blowe sparkes ioyfull light tyre despaier vppon tyred sprite ende ende dulde penn cannot write masde head thinke faltring tongerecite hard vnderneath sonnet wordes written caue darke neuer light waxe doth waste selfe yet painelesse dye wordes full woe yet feele none darkned clearest sight waste harte still newe torment tryes plaine cause woe myne owne caue wasting waxe wordes griefe holde shew tell paine without reliefe long stay reade wordes farre stone shee might discerne darke corner ladie lieng face prostrate vpon ground could neither know knowen generall nature man desirous knowledge sorrow especially glad find fellowes went softely could conuey foot neere vnto heard word come vehement sobbing darkenes saide shee doest light somly think make see picture inward darknes since haue chosen thee secret witnesse sorows let receiue safe receipte thee esteeme tedious possible let vttering discharge ouerloaden breast ala sorrowe nowe thou hast full sack conquered spirit rest thy selfe set stil new fire thy owne spoiles accursed reason many eye thou hast see thy euills thou dimme nay blinde thou arte preuenting forlorne creature would might freely wicked since wickednesse doth preuaile foote steppe ouertroden vertue lie still bitter accusation vnto deuided selfe howe stande ouerthrowne selfe shall raise mee vice nurse new agony vertue diuorsed make hatefull comparison manyfest vertue either neuer shadow thee thou thy selfe art shadow soule abandoned power laide waste desire payned cannot hope hope came best shoulde bee mischiefe strange mixture humaine mindes onely much good lefte make v languish owne euills yee infernall fury late mee awake dead vertue place comforte angrie god yee infernall fury say aide one dedicates selfe vnto let rage bee satisfied since effecte fit seruice neither bee afraide make happie since nothing come appease smart guiltie cōscience desire asswage sweltring hellish longing deiected gynecia zelmane sooner heard name gynecia colde sweate ouer ben ready treade vpon deadly stinging adder would haue withdrawne selfe owne passion made yeelde vnquiet motion done comming perceaued gynecia sodainely risne vp deed ginecia gotten caue caue wherein dametas safelie kept pamela late vprore passe pang change place minde ranne still vpon zelmane piercing louers eye soone found seeing countenance flye away fell downe feete catching fast hold ala sayd whether whome doost thou flye awaye sauagest beastes wonne seruice flint may mollifyed gynecia vnworthie thine eye whome cannot aboundance loue make worthie thinke crueltie vngratefulnes flowe good minde weigh ala weigh thy selfe newe effectes mightie passion vnfit state vncomely sexe must become suppliant thy feete happie woman bare thee ioyes thy hart successe thy desire beseech thee turne thy selfe consideration rather shew pittie helping late repenting death hourely threatens zelmane imputing one continuall mishap thus haue met lady full weary countenance without doubt madame said desire may obtained partie well deseruing selfe must great excuse may well cullour deniall first motion carry direct impossibilitie must answere comfort without helpe sorrow party obtaining able graunt sayd gynecia good leisure haue frame scornefull answeres ginecia thus despised vile worme sight trust hard harted tigre actor tragedy since must fall presse downe others ruines since must burne spitefull neighbor shall feele fire doest thou perceaue diligent eye haue pierced clowdie maske thy desguisemēt haue told thee ô foole much foole know thou wouldest abuse v thy outward shew wilt thou still attend rage loue woman hart girle thy well chosen mistresse perchaunce shall defend thee basilius shal know thou hast sotted minde falsehood falsely sought dishonour house beleeue beleeue vnkind creature end misery notable example reuenge accursed cradle mine shal feele smart wound thou thy tiranny lastly confesse selfe mine owne work zelmane long doubted selfe discouered plainely finding prouerbe saith like hold wolfe eares bitten hold slaine loose held wonted termes sawe rage would make loue worke effect hate graunt vnto hart bounde vpon philoclea ben worse thousand death yet found necessarie come resolution gynecias sore could bide leasure discouered besides dāger philoclea desire euer vtterly stopped remēbred withall word basilius apt leaue life returne court great barre hope lastly considered dorus enterprise might bring strange alteration well liked fellowship encompassed instant difficulty bent spirit thinke remedie might saue serue accomplishment pursuite lastly determined thus way yeeld violence desire since striuing chafe following owne current length selfe would bring side burning desire meane diuided dorus long diuided betwene loue frendship loue diuided frō frend though indeed without preiudice frendships loyaltie doth neuer barre minde free satisfaction yet still cruell iudge ouer himselfe thought somewayes faultie applied minde amend speedie behouefull returne first studie get away whereto already pamelas consent confirmed concluded vnder name mopsa owne presence dorus taking way whatsoeuer would haue pamela would aske whether case best mopsa behaue selfe sort making mopsas enuie instrument enuie hauing passed ouer first feared difficultie busied spirites come haruest desire whereof faire shew therevnto hauing gotten leaue dayes maister damaetas accompted sonne lawe romed round desart finde vnknowne way might bring next sea port much might course passenger well succeeding hauing hired bark liues traffick prouided horsses carrie thither returned homeward come last point care goe beyond loathsome watchfulnes three vncomely companion therin wisely consider taken deale remembring particularity euery body mind fortune particuler aduantages held muddy mind damaetas found easily sturred couetousnes curst mischeuous hart miso apt tickled iealousie whose rotten brain could think wel body yong mistres mopsa could open eys vpon nothing bewonder thought curiositie fittest bait first damaetas dorus hauing imploid whole day work tenne mile lodge quite contrary way ment take pamela digging opening ground vnder auncient oke stood sort might longest hold damaetas greedy hope shewe comfort came master countenance mixt betwixt cherefulnes haste taking right hand great matter secrecie reueale vnto master said neuer thinke god appointed mind freely brought vp haue longing desire serue minded therby bring extraordinary frute one beloued honesty make think bindes euen conscience disclose perswade self alotted vnto fortune may equal ballance desert said would let damaetas play vpon bit vnderstanding word entended yet well finding caried euil news much desirous know matter free scope imagin measure good hap himselfe would therefore putting cap neuer done assuring haue mopsa though bene made cloath gold besought dorus hold long hope found thing hart able beare maister answered dorus haue satisfied promising vttermost desired blisse duty bound sufficiently rewarded therefore shall good hap conuerted fruite labor dedicated therewith told vnder auncient oke place made easily vnderstand sufficient mark gaue vnto found digging little depth scatteringly lying great number rich medailles percing ground met great stone hollow sound yeelded seemed couer greater vaut vpon boxe cypre name valiant aristomenes grauen vpon within box found certaine verse signified depth againe vnder treasure lay hidden time discord fell arcadia liued banished therwith gaue damaetas certaine medailles gold long kept asked thing much kept secret matter one man twenty houres might easily performe whether would haue go seeke bottome refrained till knew mind promising would faithfully bring found else himselfe would first beholder comfortable spectacle man need doubt part damaetas would choose whose fancie alredy deuoured great rich euen began grudge partenor saw owne share therefore taking strong iade loaden spade mattock ment bring back otherwise laden went speed thetherward taking leaue body desiring dorus would looke wel prince pamela promising mountaines owne labor neuerthelesse little ment performe like foole considering man moued part neglect whole thus away went damaetas hauing alreadie made image fancie pallaces would build sumptuously would fare among thing imagined money employ making coffer keepe money tenne mile seemed twise many league yet contrarie nature though seemed long wearysome many time curssed horse want consideration important matter would make greater speede many time wished back asse help carrie away new sought rich vnfortunate wisher aswell wished head bene graunted length come tree hoped beare golden akornes downe went instrument forthwith renting vp hurtlesse earth caught lime fewe promised medailles perfect pawne vnto expectation deemed great number howers well employed groping loggs great stone made cumbersome might till length sweatie browes came great stone stone god knowes full vnlike couer monument yet cipres box aristomenes grauen vpon verse written banisht man long bard desire inward letts state possest hid heere hope might aspire haue harmes wisdomes helpe redrest seeke see man esteemeth best labour hire liue wee finde rest hold fast greater wealth require looke shalt thou finde least baite fit hungr • e minded guest opened box great comfort read fresh courage went neyther minde body whereout might nourish quiet thought hauing long since hated thing else began hate sel • e sweete humourd dame dorus set himselfe framed towardes smiling countenance might seeme mixt betwene tickled mirth forced pittie miso whome cheerefulnes others euer sauce enuie selfe tooke quicklie marke behauiour looke full foreworne spite deuill sayd take villaynes neuer leaue grenning fayre mistresse mopsa see skipiacke lookes dorus occasion desired truly mistresse aunswered smiling deede must needes alittle accord countenance sport therewithall tooke armes rocking fro faith particuler exception dishonest secreacies reuealed especially whereby reuealing may eyther preuented least amended yet ballance iudgement wayes downe haue confidence vse know moderately rather take falling ground rampie • sunnes rage perceaue yong maid truly finest stamp beawtie made bewtie admirable arte added helping apparell shepheards daughter wont weare haire hoong downe free libertie clime tree mopsa said haue like cloake mine owne verie foole though keep commaundement others barre selfe rest onely extreemely perplexed hauing nothing worlde wish enioying fauour think much pleasanter conquest come owne consent haue charming force therefore choose since haue sorte shall haue neuer child desirons gay puppet mopsa tree therefore without squeamishnes promising woulde shee coniured precious loues might haue first possession wishing tree assuring enioying neuer neede clime farre dorus time precious made great ceremony helping vp top tree whence likewise could ill come three time till thirde time shee must wise aunswere shall need doubt cōming time said sure wish wisely shape soeuer come vnto speake boldly vnto wish shall haue certaine effecte haue desire enioy euident hope quieted part feare passed reason began renew shining hart make see self selfe weigh wing flew natiue contry vpon ground builte strange determinaciō loue fortified louers presence kept still hart ridde together hand vpon faithfull seruants shoulder sodainly casting bashfull eies ground yet bending self towards like clyent committes cause worth well trusted aduocate frō milde spirit enterprise spotted minde bee hable beholde vertues thus much onely must confesse neuer doe make worlde see haue chosen worthily since world worthy delightfull discourse kept iournye mayntaining harte right harmonie affection doth enterchangeably deliuer secret workinges soules till vnused trauaile princesse weary lighted downe faire thyckwood entise pleasantnes take rest pine tree whose brodeheades meeting togither yeelded perfit shade ground body gaue spacious pleasant roome walke sett perfet order euerie waye eye full yet way stopped euen middest many sweete springes loose themselues vpon face earth musidorus drew prouision fruites cates brought dayes repaste layde downe vpon faire carpet greene grasse pamela much pleasure walke vnder tree making barkes prettie knottes tyed togither name musidorus pamela sometimes entermixedly changing pammedorus musimela twentie flower trauiling fancy bounde selues greater restrainte could without much painewell endure one tree beholdinge rest entrusted treasure thoughtes verse disdaine ô streight vp raised pine wounding thee thoughtes thee graue since thoughtes streight streightnes thine smaller wound ala farr deeper haue deeper engraud salue time saue giune harte fore wounded eyne thus cruell selfe canst thou craue inward hurte spare thy outward rine • yet still fairetree lifte vp thy stately line liue long long witnesse chosen smarte barde desire barde selfe imparte growing barke growe verse myne harte worde worde hath giune harte giuer giun gifte shall neuer parte vpon roote tree earth lefte something barer rest wrat couplet sweete roote say thou roote desire vertue cladde constant loues attire musidorus seing fancy drawne vp pleasaunt contemplation accompanied made tree aswell beare badge passion • songe engraued testifie goodly pine still braue assent nature pride head heaunwarde heaue though besides grace earth hath lent late grace greater grace receaue blessed content faire hande tender barkes cleaue blessed hath sent pearcing wordes thought el conceaue yet yeeld graunt baser hand may leaue thoughtes sweete thoughtes spent would mistresse thought bereaue waiting thought seruice ment nay higher thoughtes though thralled thoughtes call thoughtes first ryne rente thought lonely thrall rysing lowe highest bente worth make highest ouer comming cannot downewarde fall pamela sitting downe vnder one making posie fayer vndergrowinge flower filled musidorus eares heauenly sounde musicke neuer heard seemed vnto new assaulte giuen castle hart alredye conquered signifie replie sweete noates hee sang kinde still rauishing tune fewe verse song replie followes pamela like diuers flower whose diuers beauty serue decke earth wellcolourde weede though priuate forme preserue yet ioyning formes one sight beautie breede right thought hart feede right inwarde partes outward glasse though possesse diuers working kinde yet well knit one faire end passe whome sondrie giftes binde still one owne doe finde musidorus still one owne finde borne worldes eye el make thing blinde sunne waxen winges flie force small force trye skill reach mortall minde call title hye holde longe suite signde none clayme selfe aright passe selfe vertues might bound gaged harte onely farr beyond desarte vertuous wantonnes suffering mindes descend tender enioying vnited thought pamela hauing tasted fruites growinge extreame sleepie hauing ben long kept perplexitie dangerous attempte laying head lappe inuited sleepe softly vttered verse locke vp faire liddes treasure harte preserue beames age onely lighte sweete sence sweete sleepe ease imparte sence weake beare spirit mighte ô sleepe thou closest vp sight sight loue forge fayrest darte ô harbour partes easefull plighte let strange dreme make fayre body start • yet ô dreame thou wilt departe rare subiect common right wilt thy selfe seate delighte take shape play louers parte kisse say vnto spirite till eye shine liue darkest night sweete hiding fairer eye seemed vnto sweete box mother pearle riche themselues contaning farre richer iewells cheekes coullour delicately mixed would haue entertained eye somewhile rose lippes whose separating wont bee accompanied wise speech nowe force drewe sight marke preatily lay one ouer vniting deuided beauty thorough eye fancy deliuered memorie lying ambush vnder lippes armed rankes armed pure white keeping precise order military discipline lest beautie might seeme picture excellent artificer fourth stale softe breath carying good testimony inward sweetnesse stealingly came seemed loath leaue contentfull mansion hoped bee drawne againe well cloased paradise tyrannize ouer musidorus affectes hee compelled put face lowe hee coulde sucking breath ioye determine himselfe ben life camaeleons might suffered enioye foode long hee suffered within interrupted comming company clownish vilaines armed diuers sortes weapon rest face apparell forewasted seemed beare great conformity sauages miserable themselues taught encrease mischieues body harmes came cry awaked pamela made musidorus turne vnto full violent rage looke shee tigree whelpes stolne away zelmane whome left caue hardly bestead hauing great wittes sturring passion deale make lend penne see dexteritie could put daungers hauing one instant resist rage goe beyond wisedome deale ladie witts wake euery thing helping owne hurte saw remedy case qualifie rage hope satisfie witt plainesse yet lest abrupt falling shoulde yeelde great aduantage vnto shee thought good come degree kind insinuation wise darke speech excellent lady wouen vp intricate maner know proportiō mine answere vnto thē prayer mixte threates shew loue hidden name reuenge natural effect mortal hatred seeme displeased opinion haue disguising yet bee disguised must needes much displeased hope succour perplexed mindes quite cut desire affection yet selfe thinke affection already bestowed pretend crueltie haue subiection iealous keeping yet haue gotten strangest iealousie vniustice loath come daughter deeme good vaynnesse since two diuers respect necessitie one fall barre neyther fancie mary must needes ende aspire neither neede maryeng keepe gratefull consideracion much honor loue vouchsafe beare gynaecia whome fearefull agony still liued made small repriuall sweete quickly finde word falling better way comfort therefore minde readie shewe nothing could make rebellious zelmane extreme tyrannie thus sayd ala much beloued zelmane thought outflowings minde tongue seruant thoughtes therefore maruaile word suffer contrariety since minde doth hourely suffer selfe whole armyes mortall aduersaries ala vse mine owne reason neede want finde selfe desperate mischiefe reason vanished haue likewise power correct vnreasonablenes therefore accept protection minde hath resting place driue vnregarded put selfe vnknowne extremity desire haue affection answered haue right reflection loue graunted assure selfe mine owne loue easily teach seeke contentment make thinke daughter meane price keepe still mine eye foode spirit take heede contempt driue despaire violent cause miserable effect zelmane alreadie sawe fruite last determined fancie farre came mollifyeng gynecias rage seeing way satisfye suspicion help open continuall prickes loue resolued plainnesse winne trust trust might deceyue greater subtletie therefore looking vpon relenting grace euer done pretending great bashfulnes could come confesse fault thus sayde vnto worthye ladye neuer thinke till pittie another coulde make betray selfe sounde wordes could ouerthrow wise body determinacion word thinke haue charmed grace bewitched compassion make open hart leaue vnharboured mine owne thought proofe disclose greatest secreate well might suspect neuer knowe haue wandring hope painefull wildernesse neither way able lodged perfect resolucion say vnwrappe hidden estate make iudge perchance director truth man nay say borne prince make vp youre minde vnderstanding mee since came place may denye haue sprinkling knowe good liking lady philoclea howe coulde euer imagine heauens woulde haue rayned downe much fauour vpon side shewe possible hope comfortable counsellor loue cause chaunged attyre iourney two yeares agoe made among amazon hauing sought trye vnfortunate valure met one countrey harde till ende presence queene marpesia hoping preuayle agaynst challenged olde woman fourescore yeares fight horssebacke vttermost hauing ouerthrowne sauing life made sweare goe like vnarmed amazon till comming beard discharge oath deliuer bondage zelmane ended comming full conclusion would see wrought gynecias minde hauing speech sought winne beliefe might disgrace selfe diminish gynecias affection first much preuailed gynecia whose ende louing fighting neyther could loue deepely grounded receiue diminishment besides seene herselfe sufficient proofes zelmanes admirable prowesse therefore sleightly passing ouer poynt fayned dishonor taking good hold confessing manly sexe shamefaste looke suitor hauing already obtayned much yet forced want demaunde put foorth sorrowfull suite word god sayd rewarde thee thy vertuouse pittie ouerladen soule yet hath receyued breath comfort finding thy confession maintayne possibilitie languishing hope ala seeke enrich themselues minerall industrie first labour finde myne cheerefull comfort founde vnlooked stop casuall impediment keepe getting desired vre much greeued late conceaued hope addes torment former wante falles mee happie happlesse woman pleaseth ordayne either receyue guerdon wofull labour returne wretched darkenes hauing glimmering blisfull sunne zelmane tread vpon soule lye vnder foote let abasing selfe make base eye iudge according haue bene let error made excusable immortall name loue vnder fayned rage tearing clothes discouered partes fayre body zelmanes harte bene fully possest place left new guest doubt would haue yelded gallant assault zelmane much arming determination sawe force threatened yet still remembring must wade betwixt constancie curtesey embracing gynecia twise kissing deare ladie sayd great enemy himselfe would refuse offer purchase man life blessedly bestowed nay euer yeeld due recompence excessiue fauour hauing nothing geue selfe take must confesse small free gift affection soeuer haue shall geue place great perfection working besides vppon bonde gratefulnes god forbid foolish see wicked remember much small desert ouerballanced vnspeakeable goodnes nay happye may well accompt mishap among amazon since dishonor hath bene true path greatest honor chaunging outward rayment hath clothed minde inwarde contentacion take therefore noble lady much comfort youre harte full commandement yeeld wipe faire eye keepe nobler seruices nowe presume thus much saye vnto make selfe sake ioyes new obtayned rich may accomplished let v leaue place least long missed henceforward quiet minde care much ioye take charge vpon within fewe dayes worke satisfaction felicitie thus much sayde withall led gynecia caue well sawe boyling minde gynecia easily apprehende fitnesse lonely place deede direct promise short space ioyned cumbersome familiar womankinde meane modestie stayed gynecias minde tooke thus much present good payment remayning paynefull ioye wearysome kinde comfort vnlike condemned prisoner whose minde still running vppon violent arriuall cruell death heares pardon promised yet signed sort issued obscure mansion gynecia already halfe perswaded selfe ô weakenes humane conceite zelmanes affection turned towards ala mould cast much loue beare selues beeing first owne flatterer wee easily hooked owne flattery easily perswaded others loue zelmane playe prize seeing waye thinges could long remayne state finding promise tyed tryall small compasse tyme began throwe thoughtes corner inuention howe shee might atchieue liues enterprise well shee knewe deceite cannot otherwise mayntayned deceite deceyue heedfull eye satisfye yet satisfye hopefull desire small skill thoughtes called themselues sight basilius lying downe daughter philoclea vppon fayre though naturall bed greenegrasse seeing sunne speede hee made leaue west doo office hemisphere inwarde mus made best musicke sing madrigall doost thou haste away titan faire giuer daie carry newes westerne wightes starres east appeare doost thou thinke heare left sunne whose beames thy place may vse yet stay well peruse giftes make equall thee bend thy light see earthly clothes enclosde heauenly sparke thy running course cannot beawties marke thy motion bee hastened v barre shadow darke thou author sight disdainst see thee staind others light hauing ended deere philoclea said sing something may diuerte thought continuall taske ruinous harbour obedient vnwilling disburden secret passion made sweete voice heard word stealing time subiect delaie delay racke vnreframd desire strange dessein hast thou hope staie hope mine owne aspire mine owne ô word whose sweete sound doth pray greedy soule gripe inward fire thy title great iustlie chalenge may since phrase faith attire time become chariot ioyes thou drawest let blisse draw neere moment lost part hap destroyes thou art father occasion deare ioyne thy sonne ease long annoys speedie helpe thanke worthie frends appeare philoclea brake song soone mother zelmane came neere vnto rising vp kindly bashfulnes ignorant spite mother bare stricken sight person whose loue made trouble seeme fayre flower deerest garlond nay rather trouble made loue encrease arriuall enemyes make towne fortifye selfe euer remaynes stronger man may say enemyes small cause townes strength minde fixed well pleased determinacion hope annoyance ouerthrowe doth teach knit together best ground perchance chaunceable purpose make vnchangeable resolucion philoclea see wonted signes zelmanes affection towardes thought sawe light eye bould carelesse looke vpon wont dazeled beawtie framing courtesyes rather ceremonious affectionate worst liked proceeded quiet setlednes rather threatned full purpose sodayne passion founde behauiour bent altogether mother presumed selfe discerned well acquainted face fancy turned another subiecte sawe mother worthines well knewe affection ioyning theyr diuers working power together minde yet prentise paynefull misterye passion brought philoclea newe trauers thoughtes made keepe carefull looke attentiue vppon zelmanes behauiour deede though much payne condemning selfe commit sacriledge sweete saincte liued temple yet strengthening herselfe beeing surest waye make gynecia bite baytes quite ouerrule wonted showes loue philoclea conuert gynecia parte played worke full liuely perswasion gynecia excessiue comforte beeing preferred riuall doth deliuer swelling desire delicate philoclea whose calme thoughtes vnable nourish strong debate gaue stinging hurt fainting vnder force inwarde torment withdrewe selfe lodge wearye supporting owne burden cast selfe vppon bed suffering sorrowe melt selfe abundance teares length closing eye eache thing sawe picture mishap turning vpon hurtside vehement panting summon consider fortune thus bemoned selfe ala philoclea price thy paynes rewarde thy giuen awaye libertye hath much yeelding bred crueltye greate acquaintance make mee helde straunger hath choosing companion made mee lefte alone doth graunting desire cause desire bee neglected ala despised philoclea diddest thou holde thy thoughtes theyr simple course content thy • elfe loue thy owne vertue would neuer haue betrayed thee ah sillie foole diddest thou looke truth owne mouth confest falsehood playne proceeding still go disguised say falsest men yet beare outward shewes pure minde euen outwardly beares badge treacherie hell wickednes must needes depth contayned ô wicked mouth mine darest thou thus blaspheme ornament earth vessell vertue wretch anger god dispraysing excellent worke fault could euer thinke high eye would looke lowe great perfection would stayne themselues vnworthines ala could see weake band tye heauenly hart fit limit infinite course wonderfull destenies euer like vpon philoclea thoughtes rest ah silly soule couldst please thy selfe • impossible imagination vniuersall happines flowe inueagled hope might marke minde thee wrong ô philoclea thee wrong thy weakenes fancie beames sonne giue light eye thine yet ô prince pirocles whome may well begin hate selfe neuer leaue loue thee triumph canst thou make conquest spoiles wilt thou carry away vndeserued ouerthrow could thy force finde fitter field feeble minde poore mayde first sight wish thee happines shall sayde mirrour mankinde hath bene employed destroy hurtlesse gentlewoman pirocles pirocles let yet call thee iudgement thine owne vertue let accepted plaintiffe cause concernes life need hadst thou arme thy face enchanting mask thy painted passion wht need hadst thou fortefy thy excellēcies exquisit cunning making art betray v needest thou descend far frō thy incomparable worthines take habit weake womankinde winne vndefended castle friend wonne thou wouldest raze could small cause allure thee vniust cause stop thee ô say case loue hate vertue deales wickedly wrong whose neuer accompt wrong sweet lady turning selfe vppon weary bed happly sawe lute vpon belly gynecia written song time basilius imputed iealous motion proceed doubt vntimely loues vnder vaile contented couer neuer ceassing anguish made lute monument minde philoclea neuer much marked till feare competitour sturred care mother verse lute thy selfe thy tune enclose thy mistresse song sorrow crie hand benumde fortune daylie blow minde amazde neithers helpe applie weare word mourning weede woe blacke incke becommes state wherein dye though mones musicke bound written greefes yet silent ground world doth yeeld ill consorted show circkled course wise stay trye childish stuffe knowes frendes foe better despisde bewondre gasing eye thus noble golde downe bottome go worthlesse corke aloft doth floting lye thus thy selfe least string loudest founde lowest stop doo yeeld hyest sounde philoclea read throwing downe lute legacie haue bequeathed kinde mother mine said bestow light vpon beare author buriall trim purchase haue made owne shame robbed daughter ruyne selfe bird vnreasonable yet vse much reason make nestes tender young one cruell mother turnes mine owne harbour ala plaint bootes case receaue helpe geue mee helpe shall flye parent murtherers shall goe already woon lost must need haue killed pittie ala bring new intercession know already shall come home againe self ô contemned wretch haue giuen away self poore soule beate breast bene guilty fault neither thinking reuenge studying remedy sweete creature gaue greefe free dominion keeping chamber day needing faine self sick feeling euen soule pang extreeme paine little gynecia reck neyther sawe goe awaye neyther found sicknes made hide faire face much fancye preuailed nature ô haue euer knowen tender euery motion loue make louers hart measure ioyes vpon contentment doth respectful eye hang al behauiour vpō eye iudg praye zelmanes troubled thought saw philoclea amazed kinde sorrow carrie awaye sweete presence easely founde happie coniecture vnhappie affection hath demeanour guiltie trespasse neuer foolish softe harted mother forced beate childe weepe first paine loath repent began finde ha • fe motion weake minde zelmane forced reason giue outward blowe passion lending small time seeke vsury desire vnkindnes conceaued philoclea might conceaue wound soule teare doubted spent drowned comforte sicknes death vnto often woulde shee speake image philoclea liued ruled highest inwarde parte vse vehement othes protestation vnto nothing shoulde euer falsifie free chosen vowe made often woulde desire would looke wel pyrocles hart shee interest bestow way ala woulde shee saye onely philoclea hast thou much feeling thine owne force knowe new conquerer preuaile thy conquestes euer daseled moone vsed eye beames sunne hee carried awaye greedie desire akornes hath sens rauished garden delightfull fruites philoclea philoclea thou mercifull princesse minde thou arte trewe possessour shal haue much cause gladnes thou hast cause misdoubting man owne harte gage debte man owne thought willing witness promise lastly man gaylour ouer himselfe little doubte breaking credit lesse doubt escape combat zelmanes doubtfull imagination ende reason well backed vehement desire bring matter soone desired hauen ouer rule boyling inward kindnes though say manifest strife basilius gynecias well wayting eye marked mus laboured deeper subiecte ordinarie likewise perceauing perceaued waking selfe thoughtes principally caring howe satisfie gynecia whose iudgement passion shee stood regarde bowing head attentiue eare madame saide practise thought haue found way contentment shall draw happines gynecia deliuering face thankfull ioyfulnes harte coulde holde saide time retire themselues rest riding abroade day late sitting vp egloges bodyes dearely purchased nightes quiet went home lodge zelmane framing side bountifull measure louing countenaunces eithers ioye neythers iealousie especiall comforte basilius whose weaker bowel streight full least liquour hope still holding hand sometimes tickling went gay conceates euer entred braines growing harted resolucion hee little respected gynecias presence lustier note wonted clearing voice chearing spirit looking still vpon zelmane whome moone beautifie shining almost full eye beene songe booke message minde singing verse vvhen two sunnes appeare say doth betoken wonder neare prince losse change two gleaming sunnes splendour like see seeing feele prince harte quite lost ruine strange nowe doth range ouglie cloke darke enuious night full guiltie spite liuing beames black seate assaile weake weaker sighte doth vaile say faire moone lighte shall barr wrong though preuaile like brother raise yet sende hurte face nothing amende time come lodge visited sweete philoclea much lesse naturall care parent much lesse wonted kindenes zelmane partie full fraught diuersly working fancy made pillowes weake proppes ouer loaden heades yet zelmanes braynes tormoyled troubled loue actiue passiue lastely especially care howe vse shorte limitted time beste purpose wise happie diuerting two louers vnwelcome desire zelmane hauing night onely councellour busie enterprise shee vndertake hauing time mused yet fully resolued howe shee might ioyne preuailing preuenting offēded day bould entrie chamber custome growne assured bringer euill newes taking citterne laye aurora chardge wel songe verse aurora thou shewst thy blushing light oft hope lay guilefull baite trust time finde way aright ease paine desire waite blush shame still thee light pensiue soules steede restfull baite care vpon care steede right ouer pressed brestes greeuous waight oh selfe whose woe neuer lighte tide stake doubt strange passion baite thy known course obseruing nature right sturres thinke danger lye waite mischeefes greate daye day doth showe make still feare thy faire appearing showe ala said runne strange gulfe faine loue hurt loue detest others please detest onely philoclea whose beautie matched nothing vnspeakeable beautie thy fayrest minde thou didst see vpon racke tormented soule set little would thinke scope leape new chaunge hastie hand got selfe vp turning sight euerie thinge chaunge obiecte might helpe invention went againe caue forthwith came head shoulde bee fittest place performe exploite kinde confused conceipte although set downe fancie meeting particularitie might fall painter doth first showe rude proportion thing imitates curious hande hee drawes representing lineament thought beating continually receaued ground plot deuise although parte shapte according full determination sorte hauing earelie visited morninges beautie pleasant desartes came king queene tolde performance certaine countrie deuotions onely exercised solitarines shee desire leaue shee might fewe day lodge selfe caue fresh sweetnes greately delight hot countrie smal space would otherwise trouble themselues visiting time would come waite vpon shoulde bee euerie daye certaine houres neither long shee would desire priuiledged absence whose mindes alredie taken lesson perfectly yeelde willing obedience desire consenting countenaunce made soone see pleasure lawe vnto indeede inwardlie glad basilius hoping deuiding selfe might yet giue freer occasion comming secrete vnto whose fauourable face lately strengthened fainting courage gynecia ioyous holding selfe assured prologue play promised thus flattering selues diuersly grounded hope rang bell serued call certaine poore woman euer lay cabin far houshould seruices lodge neuer came either called commaunded carry foorthwith zelmanes bed furniture chamber pleasaunt caue decke vp finelie possible soules rest might rest body best pleasing maner diligence performed zelmane alredie possession newe chosen lodging like one vestaes nunnes entertaind herselfe fewe dayes showe streightnes yet day comming doe dutie king queene seldomnes sight encreased vnquiet longing though somwhat qualified countenaunce decked either comforte wonted especially gynecia seing wholy neglecting daughter philoclea promisd selfe full possession zelmanes harte still expecting fruite happie hoped inuention basilius kept continuall watch precinct caue either bar hauing secret commoning zelmane meane time sweete philoclea forgotten father despised mother apparance lefte zelmane yeelded vp soule pray sorow vnkindnes raging conceite reuenge passed thorow stout wise harte mother kindly meeknes taking vpon weight owne woe suffering haue full course exceedinglie weaken estate bodie aswell cause shee could see zalmane without expressing shee woulde farr loue imprisoned extremitie sorrow bound selfe first limit chamber griefe breeding sicknes bed zelmane hauing full libertie cast euery way bring conceaued attempt desired successe ofte perplexed manifould difficultie sometimes would resolue force take way though death parent somtimes go away musidorus bring force winne lastly euen day musidorus feeding humor three loathsome gardiens stolne awaye prince pamela whether loue ment match euerie waie friendes example holpen inuention indeede zelmane forbare practise deuise till found friend passed daye saye shee resolued way rid lodge two combersome louers night carrie away philoclea vnto shee assured owne loue lesse sister woulde easely winne consent hoping although abrupt parting suffered demaund musidorus way ment direct iorney yet either good fortune finde course fayled yet might well recouer towne helotes neere frontie • e arcadia newly againe vp armes nobilitie shee knew would bee glad presence protection therefore hauing taken order thinges requisite going first put sleight vndersute man apparel purpose prouided curiously trimmed self beautif • ing beauty last triall might come vnto brauest armour putting kinde milde countenaunce doth encourage looker hope gentle answere according late receaued maner lefte pleasant darkenes melancholy caue goe take dinner king queene giue vnto pleasant foode seing owner desire euen persian aunciently wont leaue rising sun vnsaluted faire beames appeared clearer vnto thē wold hartely reioyce laying vpō great fortoken following fortune ther time zelmane encoūtred eies beloued presence bred kind burning deuotiō thē yet much glading gredy soules coūtenance cleared morefauour vnto thē determinatly framed greatest descēt kindnesse took hold infortunate louers like child aboute tender father along voyage returned louely childishnes hange yet simple feare measure countenance farr acceptes boldnes throwne seruiceable affection turning zelmanes eye strong sterne enough motion wending way inchaunting force guided hauing made light repaste pleasunt fruites countrye enterlarding foode manner generall discourse louers woont couer passion respecte thirde person keepes plaine particular earnest entreatie basilius zelmane first saluting mus base voyal hong hard sent ambassade versified musicke ill requited louers beautie hath force catche humane sight sight doth bewitch fancie euill awaked fancie feele encludes passion mighte passion rebelde oft • son strength hath shaked wondre though sighte sighte tainte though thereby fancie infected though yoked minde sicknes fainte reason weight passion ease reiected fitt past time hath giune leasure weigh due deserte requireth thought spronge dwelling dri • n wisdome wonted seate aspireth cry eye hope deceitefull proue thinges rightelie prizde loue bande loue songe eye accompanie sickly daughter philoclea rid time content graunt scope might haue like freedome gesture gouerned force passion making knee best supporter hee thus saide vnto yf either said ladie life deadly pangues coulde beare delaye first time manifested vnto woulde nowe maintaine still remembraunce misfortune without vrging reward time pittie might procure ala since martirdome lesse painefull manifest feele miserable daunger know assured trueth thereof shoulde tonge deny seruice harte feare breath word daylie feele flame workes embrace sweete consideration beseech miserie case acknowledge selfe bee cause thinke reason redresse effectes ala let certaine imaginatife rule whose trueth standes vpon opinion keepe wise mind gratefulnes mercie whose neuer fayling law nature hath planted v plainly lay death vnto death loues death whose life maye saue say absolute determination hope selfe paine ouer mastered feare resolue cruel yet speediest condemnation euills welcome zelmane fully set selfe traine would keepe yet knowing soonest meanes yeelde doth well make brauest parley keeping countenaunce alofte noble prince said wordes well couched come restlesse minde thanked god face threatens daunger death swelling speech giue vttermost name euerie trifle worth nothinge enammeled goodly outside loue truely loue verie vnlouely halfe fo deadly louers still liuing tearme thinke well may haue certaine childish vehemencie time one desire engage al soule long lasteth impacience selfe showe confesse hope paine thinke owne desire vnworthy would faine bee ridd ouermuch loue sue hard hastie refusall refusall cried basilius amazed al perced last assure self soeuer vse word diffinitiuely vndoubted dome approching death shall owne experience knowe mee soone spirites dryed vp anguish leaue performaunce ministerie whereupon life depēdeth ala crueltie tormēt think tormēt slighte terriblest tirants would say man killed dyed man punished escaped free ther least hope mercie acknowledging paine like crueltie wordes breathed flamy harte accompted messingers quiet mind speake nothing choake selfe way reliefe simplye neglected confusedly vnderstoode bending together inwarde power bring forth liuely expressing truly feele token forsooth thought much leasure thus silence desperate follie punished witt suspected indeed vaine say wordes bind beliefe lady say determine must confesse cannot beare battell minde therefore let soone know may accompt selfe hell dolour mind still doubt want resolution make resistaunce deed aunswered zelmane graunt request shew example selfe esteeme holy bande chastitie bee imaginatife rule tearmed truest obseruaunce nature moste noble commaundement mankinde haue ouer themselues indeede learning teacheth inward feeling assureth first shal zelmanes graue become marriage bedd soule shall consent owne shame leaue marke self vnredemable trespasse yet must confesse euer hart sturred hath ben manifest manifold shewes misery liue trueth nature giues v degenerate child general precepte one helpe one feele true compassion others mishappe yet neuer contented speake neuer ô basilius looke hand know howe auoyde wiues iealous attendaunce suspicion shall bring honour question basilius whose small sailes leaste winde fill forth farre gonne large promising selfe desire hee striken downe threatned deuill therefore bending browes though man take matter done saide hee shall wife become misteris thinke thus much time hath taught mee rule mewe gentlewoman till haue cast feather rouse selfe walked vp downe nodding head though mistooke much thought wiues maister zelmane seeing time conclude wisdome manhood sayd doubt sufficeth hardly • ame malicious toong impossibly barre freedom thought thing must witness honor iudges dishonor may see doo set light affection night wife assuredly asleepe whereof loue coniure haue precise care steale handsomely caue vnto graunt great proportion take free conference euer remembring seeke • shall deceyue selfe euer loose basilius olde inough know woman wont appoint secreat night meeting purchasing land holding himselfe alreadye vndoubted possessour desire kissing hand lifting vp eye heauen holdes raines minde soeuer doth euer eye best best continuall motion changing life turned thing thing againe becommeth best nature kinde suffring one superlatiue louer admits positiue sit still best conspiracie seuerall grace held best together make one perfect figure beawtie walke doubt best besides making happie place step sturring addes pleasing life natiue perfectiōs silent without comparison best since meanes vntroubled eye freely may deuoure sweetnes obiect speake take vpon death best quintessence worde beeing distilled downe affected soule example well seene giuen ouer pyrocles panting breath somtime sighes sorrowe restrayning inwarde partes doth make glad deliuer impacience delay vnsuretie neuer sure hope wont breath nowe doore one side hearing voice hee thought philosopher said true heauenly seuen sphered harmony represented farre surmounted hauing eye ouerfilled beautie king parting left chamber open time laye heate countrie wel suffer vpon toppe bedd hauing beauty eclipsed nothing faire smock wrought al flame ashcoullour silke golde lying vpō right side left thigh downe foote yeelded delightfull proportion full vew seene helpe ritche lampe thorowe curtaines little drawne caste forth light vpon moone doth shine thinne wood pyrocles saye stopped violence many dartes cast cupid altogether vpon quite forgetting selfe thinking therein alreadie best degree felicitie would haue lost much time much loue omitted enterprise vndertaken loue philocleas pittifull accusing forced bring spirites againe newe bias shee laying hand vnder faire cheek vpon priuilie tickle sweet droppes delightfull though sorrowfull teares made wordes waite vpon monefull songe hath cruell pyrocles saide shee deserued thus much sake lift vp voice best tune continually powring plainte make di • dayned oblacion shall soule still doe honour vnmercyfull tirranie lamenting losse show worthines weakenes heares thee simple philoclea heares thee harte grow harder find aduantage ala miserable constitution minde haue disdaine fortune yet reuerence disdaines accuse vngratefulnes haue vertue admiration yee deafe heauens would either iniury could blot myne affection affection could forget iniury geuing pittiful sweet shriche shee tooke againe lute beganne sing sonnet might serue explaining loue imprinted soule beauty seale vertue faire disguisde inward cry putt vp bitter role huge complaintes despisde thus thus loue wronge monstrous appeares long trueth receaued late wrong sturres remorsed greefe griefes deadly sore vnkindnes breedes vnkindnes fostreth hath ah hate thinke whome doe hate thinke matchlesse giftes deepely sinck breste loues renewed swimme medicin desease remoue loue draw hate hate engendreth loue pyrocles heard name accused haue robbed fellowes seruices hart fainted toung fayled sorte could bring forth one word referred vnderstanding eye language extremitie amazed see vndue season ashamed beautifull body made naked prospect drawing delicate lims weake guard bedd presenting face kinde pittifull anger might shew fault therfore former grudge vnto turning away face thus said vnto zelmane pyrocles whether name vse much skils one first deceiued betrayed strange motion guide thy cruel mind hither dost thou thinke day torment thou hast giuen sufficient thou doest enuie night quiet wilt thou giue sorrowes truce making see mine eye much haue lost offer due cause cōfirming plainte thy hart full rancour thou dost desire feede thine eye wretched spectacle thine ouerthrowen enemie satisfie full measure thy vndeserued rage receuing thy sight vnreleuable ruines desolate life pyrocles pyrocles thine vertues sake let misery musique vnto thee content take thy selfe coloure excuse thou didest knowe extremitie thy inconstancie rather falshood hath brought pyrocles euery sillable pronounced thunderboult hart equally distraught betwixt amasement sorow abashed se stop desire greued paine tormēted find author quaking lip pale cheere ala diuine lady said displeasure contrary deserte word farre beyond expectatiōs haue least abilitie haue need speake cause vpō life dependeth troth vndoubtedly cōstāt vnto hart assured witnes self vnspotted faith hauing one thing wherout sacriledg might arise haue likewise nothing direct thing say selfe sincere vehemēt protestatiōs truth may word spent probabilitie breed sids cōiectural allegatiōs perfect thing loue suffers questiō semes receiue iniurie additiō word vnto yf soule could haue ben polluted treachery woulde likewise haue prouided due furniture coullourable answeres vpō naked cōscience vntouched dutie must cōfes altogether vnarmed vniust violēce lay vpō ala let paine haue takē serue accoūted iniurious vnto let dāgerous cūning haue vsed pleasure demed treasō since haue deceued thē feare sake doe destroye mee sake without doe forwardnes counsell bring desired happines haue prouided whatsoeuer needfull going haue rid lodge none bee hinderers knower departure almightie power inuoke trier mine innocencie witness wel meaning euer thought receiue much fainting affection haue continually ardoure time time pursued possession sweetest fauour euer possession receaued either spott falshoode let horrible plague fall vpon let mine eye depriued light abase heauenly beames strake let falsified toung serue vse bee mine owne wretchednes let harte empoysoned detestable treason seate infernall sorrowe let soule endles anguish conscience become owne tormentor false mankind cried sweete philoclea impostumed heart yeelde forth reward louer true cke reuenge wrong suspecting husband read chafe enough till pacified desiring griefe bread word truely tried would letter show fault might goodnes know streight done many boistrous languisht discontent tell seely pipe may thee still betide clenly cloth thy moistnes wipe may cheries redd miras lipps diuide sugred selues kisse thy happy hedd may eares ledd eares musique liues wooll note time richly dide may part miras peticoate tell wolues throte haue cought thy deare damme thee staide thou straide canst thou poore lamme become anothers lamme rather till thou die still thy dam beawaymenting crie tell ô turtle true may fortune breed make thee thy betterloued rue may thy blessing swarme mira may thee feede hand mouth lapp brest keepe warme tell greedy arme fondly take hisse thinke well beast courage clad like senator harmeles empire whether others repine enuie harbreth feeblest harte chaunging encline euen beast dammes leaue chaunging partes multitude ioue suite
