industrie connie skill builde crane order storkes appearing holie camaeleon ease chaunge ducke ease yelde crocodile teares might falsely spilde ape great thing gaue though mowing stand instrument instrument hand ech beast likewise present brings drad prince ought want consented giue wing aye awe towards plant owne worke priuiledge graunt thenceforth eternitie beast freely speake onely thus man made thus man lord became first wanting hiding pride beastes best vse cunning frame water drinke herbes meate naked hide fellowlike let dominion slide saying saying meant lordship common seate rooted found skilld wend gan guiltlesse earth full many wound iron seeke gainst selfe bend teare bowel good corne send yet common damme none bemone though hurt neuer heard grone gan faction beastes breed helping weaker sort nobler beastes tygers leopard beares lion seed disdaind desert sought restes famine rauine taught hungrie chestes craftily forst ill done afterwards would kill murthers done neuer erst seene great beastes weakers good chose themselues guarders bene gainst might feare stood horse dogge great gentle blood blith common cattell fielde tho saw foen greatnes kilde spent made slender might quickly meaner cattell finde great beames gone house shoulder light horse faire bitt binde dogge coller taught kinde gentle bird like case might rewe faloon gossehauke saw mewe worst fell smallest bird meanest heard owne full like owne vsed yet first wooll fethers teard well vsde abused hungrie teeth flesh teeth brused length glutton taste kill last sport sillie liues spill yet ô man rage beyond thy neede deeme glorie swell tyrannie thou art blood ioy see thing bleede thou fearest death thinke loth die plaint guiltlesse hurt doth pierce skie poore beastes patience bide hell know strength shall well thus sing pipe eight sullen houres sheepe loue knowledge made heare fancy fit fortune balefull stowers homewards calld lambkin deare dimmed eye began appeare night growne old blacke head waxen gray sure shepherd signe morne soone fetch day according nature diuerse care diuerse iudgements streight followed praising voice others word fit frame pastorall stile others strangenes tale scanning meane old geron borne grudge euer since one eclogue taken vp ouerbitterly tooke hold occasion make reuenge sayd neuer saw thing worse proportioned bring tale knewe beastes sportmeeting rather song loue matter ioyfull melody brought forth said right conceipt young men thinke speake wiseliest cannot vnderstand themselues little melancholike shepherd regard either dispraise others praise set foundation honour despised therefore returning againe traine desolate pensiuenesse geron inuited histor answere ecloguewise indeed hauing bene long loue faire kala lalus ouergone growne detestation mariage thus geron histor geron faith good histor long delay holy marriage sweete surest meane foolish lust honest rule stay pray thee doo lalus sample leane thou seest friske iolly last day seemd could chew beane beleeue man greater blisse quiet ioy louing wife want halfe himselfe doth misse friend without change playfellow without strife foode without fulnes counsaile without pride sweet doubling single life histor doubt good chance betide finde pasture strawed golde foole bide would haue phoenix could humming waspe sting fly waspe accept would bad world golden fieldes doth bring phoenix one crowes million haue waspe seemes gay combrous thing many kalaes arcadia gaue lalus example would soone ensue thinke selfe sorrow saue wiues finde slender crew shrewdnes stirres pride puffes vp hart seldome ponder due meager lookes still smart puiling whimpring else scolding flat make home paine following cart either dull silence eternall chat still contrarie husband sayes praise dog like cat austere would honest playes game thinkes sheepe bid goe yet iorney stayes warre doth euer kinsfolke keepe make frembd friend nature enuying shallow toyes malice deepe forsooth come new found ware little coine sweating browes haue got must goe lowres care el nay faith mine lucklest lot euer fell honest woman yet wife hath man god wot speech sober wit doo let tongue shew well rage lord byword speake spite spit house made lothsome cage wherein birde doth neuer sing cry nothing asswage dearely seruants doo wage buy reuild ech small fault sometimes none better liue gaile doo lie let fowler spot away blowne seeke shame still thinkes better life lye alone geron ech fickle feare vertue shrinkes shall life embrace worthy thing mortall man cuppe suretie drinkes heauns doo good hap handful bring let v pike good much bad still little world may know king certainly long may glad doo nature doth require theuent neuer ought sad man oft plagde aire burnt fire water drownd • earth buriall shall therefore vse desire nature aboue thing requireth kind doo labour maintaine drawneout line doth hold humane blisse thy father iustly may thee complaine thou doo repay deed thee granting vnto grandsires gaine thy commonwealth may rightly grieued must immortall preserued thus thou murther thy posteritie hath deserued selfeconceipt forbeare whereby aye must conserued god forbid woman cattell paint well finde man doth speake aright speakes feare onely see ill worse blind fiftie winter maried haue beene yet finde fault womankind haue wife worthie queene well command yet obay ruling house well shees seene yet time betwixt v tway beare double yoke consent neuer past foule word dare well say louetoyes still spent lawlesse game loue much studie learne late repent well last day prince could blinde cupid workes wonder testifie yet roote abase would goe goe cupid applie thou thy cupid maist auowe thou shalt finde woman vertue lie sweet supple mindes soone wisdome bowe wisdomes rule directed forst fonde thraldome allow get framd spare made paine paine made cherish care abroad home haue care histor seeke within thy selfe flourish thy house thee must liue el gone shall name histor nourish rich child passe prince throne touch father hart secret ioy without shame saith mine owne marrie therefore marriage destroy passion youthfull head doo clime mother nurse vaine annoy spake wordes affection curious eye might easilie haue perceyued liked thyrsis fortune better loued person deede arise went woman spending day good part night dauncing carolling wassaling lastly left thyrsis long desired left many vnfayned thankes returned euerie man home hauing crosse way two lodge might see ladie making dolefull lamentation ouer bodie seemed dead vnto thinkes damaetas cry vnto come sooner comfort leaue golden worke hath alreadie cost much labour longing ende third booke fovrth booke covntesse pembroke arcadia almightie wisedome euermore delighting shewe world vnlikeliest meanes greatest matter may come conclusion humane reason may humbled willinglie geue place diuine prouidence first brought damaetas play part royall pageant hauing continued still actor thing growne ripe end made folly instrument reuealing far greater cunning sought conceale fell damaetas hauing spent whole day breaking vp cumbersome worke pastor dorus feeling labour paine much hungrie hope receiued stay hauing price much sweate wearinesse gotten vp huge stone thought haue golden lining good man great bed stone made founde nothing two verse written vpon broad piece velume hath hire hath well labour plast earth thou didst seeke store earth thou • inward discountenance maister damaetas finde hope wealth turned poore verse neuer cared much nothing describe either feeling one selfe state minde damaetas least bethinking midas fancie great pride conceiued made iudge betweene god rewarded ornament ass eares yet deepe apprehension receiued rich could sodainlie loose coullor throughlie died thicke braine turned tossed poore bowel innocent earth till comming night tediousnes frutelesse labor made content rather exercise discontentation home forced horse otherwise burthened digging instrument returne came part way foote grudging lamentation nobler minde would noblie make losse mistresse farre fed foolish soule expectation reputed felicitie lesse accompted himselfe miserable falne estate fancie embraced home againe went damaetas punished conceite conceite erred till founde himselfe fancied losse falne essentiall miserie entring house three houres within night steede lightsome countenance pamela gaue inwarde decking lodge prowdest pallaces might haue cause enuie gratefull conuersation dorus whose wittie behauiour made lonelines seeme ful good company steed loude scolding miso busie rumbling vp downe mopsa though shorte quite contrarie others praiseworthines yet farre filling house founde nothing solitarie darkenesse naturally breedes kinde irksome gastfulnes present terror remembring charge left behinde hee well knew imported lesse life vnto therefore lighting candle place mouse could haue dwelled quaking diligence sought saw hee could see nothing hee cared became hee right patterne wretch deiected feare cry howling knockinge head wall hee began make pittifull complaintes body coulde heare much dread recouer leaue consideration recouer length looking like goate cast kidd verie sorrow tooke owne behalfe lodge hee went running hard could hauing receiued verie forme hanging consideration thus running man would gladly haue runne himselfe foolish fortune espie glimring light moone yeelde one standing aloft among bowes faire ashe would haue asked counsell time dogg cast vp face tooth bene drawing much bending sight perceiued mistres mopsa fitly seated wit dignitie say ioye could tast ioy whose imagination falne pallace gallowes yet refreshing comfort hope learne better tidings began crie mopsa beloued chicken thine owne father damaetas neuer towardnes hanging thou canst helpe neuer word coulde eloquence procure mopsa indeed attending greater matter yet newe burthen poore damaetas thought worlde conspired therefore seely choler began another tune thou vile mopsa saide vengeance fatherly curse light ouerthwart thee thou doe streight answere neither blessing cursing coulde preuaile mopsa great childe expectation maygame hope long deliuered thirde time named followed damaetas rubbing elbowe stamping whining seing neither take place began throwe stone withall coniure name hellish mopsa named third time chime sodainly follow striking clocke shee verily thinking god vsed father voice throwing armes abroade considering muffled vpon high tree came fluttering like hooded hawke like enough haue broken neck tree full bowes tossed one bow another lastly well brused brought receiue vnfrindly salutation earth damaetas soone downe came running finding close wrapt pulled scarlet cloake good time sorenesse fall breath giuen deliuered foolish soule pluto damaetas began fresh desire daughter forget paine taken childhoode sure could remember tell pamela good apollo saide mopsa euer thou didest beare loue phaethon mother let haue king husband ala speakest thou phaethon saide damaetas thy circumspect meanes finde pamela thy father hanged morrow matter though hanged answered mopsa doe thou make dorus king let bee husband good apollo courage doth much pricke mee towarde ah mopsa cryed damaetas thy witt doest thou know thy father hast thou forgotten thy selfe aske witt thee mine owne god said shee see thou wouldest haue remember father indeede forget selfe good husband thou shalt haue thy fill husbandes saide damaetas doe answere question thanke thee saide mopsa withall harte hartely let bee kinges damaetas seing way preuaile fel downe knee mopsa mopsa saide doe thus cruelly torment already wretched enough ala either helpe tell thou canst woulde bee behinde apollo curtesie kneeled downe thother side wil neuer leaue tormenting thee said mopsa vntill thou hast satisfied longing proclaime thee promise breaker euen iupiter shall heare fostring thou hast receaued place saue life saide damaetas faire ash aunswered mopsa thou didest receaue great good turne graunt post haste burning fancie pamela saide damaetas lustie husband saide mopsa damaetas nowe verely assured himselfe daughter madd beganne vtterly dispaire life therefore amazedly catching armes see whether hee coulde bring selfe hee might feele weight greate cudgell light vpon shoulder first greeting hee knew wife miso voice calling ribaulde villaine asking whether coulde serue turne well charita miso hauing according dorus counsaile gone mantinea harboured selfe olde acquaintaunce house soone tenne clocke striken shee remayned closely thinke amiable cheare iealous iuno sate crosselegged hinder childbirth husband loue open mouth shee went magistrate appointed ouer matter scolding inuectiue rage rather eloquence could bring forth required ayde take damaetas lefte dutie kinge daughter cōmit adultery house charitas vncle ondemian streete neither name charita remembred streete knowne yet generall mislike men damaetas vnworthy aduancement euery man glad make himselfe minister might redounde shame therfore panike cry laughter suspected place cittie searched vnder title damaetas miso euer formost encowraging withall shamefull blasings demeanoure encreasing sporte hunting husband diligent barking till length hauing already done selfe much infamous shame tonge action might performe end able find thing mare wēt hauing neither suspition rage thing mitigated leauing behinde sufficient comedie tragicall fancy away homewarde came imputing finding husband chaunce rather innocencie harte apt receaue nourish bitter thought swallowed vp determinate condemnation verie anotomie spirit one haue found nothing diuelish disdaine hatefull iealousie sorte grunting mischeuous spite shee came tree euen damaetas making ill vnderstoode intercession foolish mopsa soone harde husband voice verily thought playe therefore stealing mare softely coulde shee came creeping halting behinde euen thinking daughter little witts quite lefte great nowle beganne take armes thinking perchaunce feeling sence might call mind partes vnto miso sawe nothing thorowe coulloure reuengefull anger established vpon foreiudgement trespasse vndoubtedly resoluing mopsa charita dorus tolde mumping hoarse chafe gaue wooden salutation hearde damaetas sensible thing blow turned vp blubbred face like great lowt newe whipte ala thou woman said hee hath thy poore husband deserued haue owne ill lucke loaden thy displeasure pamela lost pamela lost miso still holding course former fancie tellest thou mee naughtie varlet pamela doest thou thinke doth aunswere abusing lawes marriage haue brought thee child haue bene true wife vnto thee bee dispised mine olde age euer among shee woulde sawce speech bastonados poore damaetas beganne thinke either generall madding falne else vision vision smarte cudgell put fancie therefore againe turning wife knowing world ment miso said hee hereafter thou maiest examine doe tell become pamela first examine drabbe said withall let fall stafe hard could vpon mopsa still taking charita mopsa alredy angry thinking hindred apollo lepte vp caught throte like haue strangled damaetas condemned man faine become iudge part fayre picture rude discord two getting opportunitie falling holde himselfe suretie indeede veriest coward three renewed earnest demaund sporte see former conceites dorus printed imagination kept still dominion miso though shee founde felte daughter mopsa yet charita cōtinually passe thought vttered crabbed question damaetas hee possiblie conceauing parte doubt remained astonished astonishment encreased doubt mopsa first assuredly take apollo thought mother comming marre bargaine much talkinge fro deliuered much light mistie mould capacitie know father yet remayned footesteppes foretaken opinion shee thought verily father mother hasted thether gett first wishe therefore whatsoeuer asked would neuer answere embracing tree feared bene running awaye nay sayes shee haue first wish first vnderstoode damaetas miso ment charita till length much vrging indeede better able perswade meete hande hand either preuailed much bring lodge see losse necligence suffered indeed nere neighborhood bare themselues made leaue toyes look dangerous plight faln assone king know daughter escape wemen beganne fresh enter brawling whether faulte damaetas feare among euills thunderbolt storme would fall vpon shoulder slipte away maigre cheare might much sooner engender laughter pittie true arcadia would say tearinge haire bearde somtime much woe making vnweldie somerfaults darest thou beare vpon thee felonious traytor false harted tree woulde make noyse make vngratious departure known ah pamela pamela often whē brought thee fine posy coulored flower wouldest thou clappe cheek say thou wouldst day euen thy meaning bring euē paire gallows ah il taught dorus camest hither learne good maners euer teach thee make thy maister sweate hart nothing meane time run away thy mistres dun cow think sōe euil towards euer since last day thou didst run away held vp thy taile pitifully se eagle kil cuckoe plain fore token vnto pamela destructiō wife miso durst say thy face didst thou suspect thy husbād loueth peece chese better womā thou litle mopsa shalt inherite shame thy father death time thee clime tree shortly best buriall ô could liue without death die aware hart hast thou hand commaundement dispatch thee hand want hart kill villanie sorte inuey euery thing sometimes thinking haue away yet night included world within shepecote thought worse thē death sometime dread hanging hee ment hange himselfe finding deede feare farre paynfull cowardise death true courage finger nothing nimble action thing let inough thereto true louer himselfe without ryuall lastly guided farre greater constellacion owne remembred search lodge might pamela night retired selfe thether trembling hammes hee carried himselfe employinge double keye kinge speciall credit vnworthylie bestowed vpon hee found gate barred key could preuaile sauing onely one trapt doore went vault seller vnknowen pyrocles lefte vnregarded damaetas euer know buttery better place got way pasing softly philocleas chamber thought likely finde pamela doore left open hee entred light lampe might discerne bed although hee tooke bee pamela yet thinking suretie enough matter touchinge necke hee went heard bedside vnfortunate louers whoe time much breake day whether diuinely surprised bring whole matter destinied conclusion vnresistable force sorrowes ouerthrowne wakefull vse sens possessed mutuall sleep yet forgetting viny embracement giue eye perfect modell affection damaetas looking lampe hande neither face mind vpon excellent creature psyche vpon vnknowen louer giuing euery way freedome fearefull eye onely perceaue zelmane therefore much different lady hee sought zelmane differ zelmane hee others euer taken wherein chaunge apparell chiefely confirmed opinion satisfied thinking good awake sleeping lyon went downe againe taking pyrocles sworde wherewith vpon sleight vndersute pyrocles came onely apparelled thether sure leaue weapon chamber making doore fast hee coulde outside hopinge reuealing hee thought greater fault make owne lesse least iniurie would fill kinges head haue leysure chastice necligence like fool considering rage breed crueller punishment went first king chamber finding ranne downe cry open mouth kinge betrayde zelmane abuse daughter noise made man wordes ioyned yelping sound miso vnpleasant enheritrix brought together number shepheards without regard reseruing kinges knowledge • pattered bottom stomacke swearing neuer knew zelmane taken woman arrant man himselfe whereof hee seene sufficient signes token hee close butterflie ladie philoclea poore men iealous prince honour readie weapon haue entred lodge standing yet pause whether best first heare newes king himselfe sodaine comming shepheards astonished lookes ranne one crie griefes surcharged euil tydings king death turning therefore mind eye way ranne caue said lay dead sunne beginning send promise comming light making hast thinke bee spectator folowing tragedy basilius hauing past ouer night happie contemplation action hauing spirit sublymed sweete imagination embrasing desired zelmane doubting least caues darknes might deceaue dayes approch thought nowe season returne wedlocke bed remembring promise made zelmane obserue due order towards gynecia therefore departing departing without bequeathing wordes sealed many kiss full guifte loue life misconceaued bedfellowe went mouth caue apparel himselfe motion ioye coulde bee bridled vttering like wordes blessed thou night said hast thy sweete winges shrowded mee vale blisse thou art gotten childe time day hath bene vsurper vpon thy delightfull inheritaunce thou inuitest liuing thinges comfortable rest thou arte stop strife necessarie truce aproching battels therewith hee sange verse confirme former prayses night ease care pledge pleasure desire best meane harnest harte affected seate peace throne erected humane life quiet measure victor still phoebus golden treasure hath sight much sight infected whose light cause haue liues neglected turning nature course selfe displeasure stately starr shining face sinlesse sleepe silence wisdomes mother witnesse wrong thy helpe eased thou arte therefore desart place sure refuge thee soule bliste sence ioyde fortune raysed yet farther would ioyes needes breake foorth basilius sayde rest thy time hath bene dreame vnto thee onely thou beginnest liue onely thou hast entred way blisfulnes fancie marriage keepe paradise opinion know promise binde paying right duty nature affection woulde haue thought could haue bene difference betwixt woman bee iealous gynecia yeelde preheminence excellent guiftes supporte thy selfe marble pillers doth decke thy brest alablaster boule zelmane doth accompanied tittle perhapes thou maist recouer possession otherwise enclined loue ala gynecia thou canst shew euidence therefore thy plea vaine gynecia hearde hee saide cast zelmanes garment wherein came thether followed basilius caues entrie full inward vexation betwixt deadly accusation guiltines spitefull doubt shee zelmane abused one side finding king thinke zelmane libertie imagine might rather king owne vnbridled enterprise barred zelmane zelmanes cunning deceiuing shee shoulde heddilie seeke violent reuenge owne honour might bee much interessed zelmane endaungered fell determination first fine handling king settle perfect good opinion shee shoulde learne thing passed take selfe new deuised counsaile beinge first action hauing geuen vnlooked attendaunce king heard partiality prefer self saw much fancy doth onely darken reasō beguile sence shee foūd opinion mistres louers iudgement seruing good lesson good conceite went basilius setting selfe graue behauiour stately silence vntill first thinking much shadow could see bee zelmane beginning louing ceremony helped peeping light wherewith morning ouercome night darkenes knowe face error acknowledging starting back thus modest bitternes spake vnto ala lorde well wordes discipher minde well wordes confyrmed gesture verie loathsome must woman whome man hath cause goe backe little better liked wife whome husband preferrs hee neuer knewe ala hath faithfull obseruing parte duety made thinke selfe euer whit exempted hath claime gratefulnes bene cause contempt mother pamela become odious name vnto life hetherto ledde haue auoyded suspicion violated truth deseruing punishment refuse chastised cruell torment displeasure refuse misery purchased mine owne merite hard must needes saye although till neuer thought haue cause saye destinie womankinde tryall whose vertue must stande vpon louing employe theyr industrie beloued zelmanes young yeares much grauitie hidden vnder youthfull face graye heares haue bene visar vnfitting youthfulnes vicious minde brought fruites repentance gynaecia might haue bene much right basely despised basilius ashamed see himselfe ouertaken vulcan much cunning hee proued himselfe cuckolde beganne make certayne extrauagant excuse matter selfe hardly brooking purgacion suddainnes time barred good conioyned inuention made sometimes alledge one thing would bring contrarye one time flat denyall another time mitigating fault braue humble vse stammering defensiue gynaecia violence whose sore deede ranne another waye content thus fasten vp last stitch anger well well lorde sayde shall well become gouerne selfe may fit rather direct iudged rather wise maister vnskilfull pleader remember wrong haue done onely child whome mee countrey shall finde commaunded commaund owne vndecent appetite lastly selfe since paynes build vp house shame dwell moueable good nature wherewith fyrst youth royall parent bestowed vppon bearing child encrease yeares haue withdrawen consider pray cause one time hath left worke neuerfayling effectes truly truly sir vntimely fyres time v let reason enioye due soueraigntie let v plant anewe weedes nature course content fade basilius would rather life matter bene ended best rethorike flat demanding pardon swearing force apollo destenye caryed thus owne bias nowe like farre trauellers taught loue owne countrie lesson without booke affection vnto would repay debt error interest great deale true honour euer done neyther geue pardon lord sayd beare honour haue taken boldnes vnfayned loue owe vnto deliuer sorrowe vnto much care haue well selfe fancie well knowe good estate life mayntayned neyther would separate selfe fortune parte therefore clayme nothing may safest selfe life honor soeuer else shall shadow bodie much basilius owne shame found culpable alreadie euen soule read owne condemnacion much vnexpected mildnes gynaecia captiue harte vnto otherwise perchaunce would haue growne desperat carelesnes therefore embracing confessing vertue shined vice euen true resolued minde vowe vnto long vnworthie liue furthest onlie limit affection thanked destenies wrought honour shame made owne striuing goe amisse best meane euer hold right pathe thus reconciled basilius great contentacion began something marke himselfe owne doings hard hap guided eye cuppe golde wherein gynaecia put lickourment zelmane hauing fayled guest carrying home agayne whome perchaunce sorrowe perchaunce long disaccustomed paynes made extremely thirstie tooke handes although directly tolde whome effect little proofe seene thereof hiding nothing ment minister another pacient duke whose belly eares much drouthe kept desiring taster finding vnpleasant pallate dranke almost leauing little couer cuppes bottome within stomacke drincke deliuered principall vaynes noysome vapour first painefull stretching forced yawning darke yellownes dyeng skinne colde deadlie sweate principally temple bodie naturall course longing deliuer heauie burden earthly damme wanting force knee vtterly abandoned heauie fall gaue proofe whether operation vnknowne potion tended panglike grones gastly turning eye immediatlie limmes stiffened eye fixed hauing time declare case wordes gynaecia dye haue care much would haue spoken man tell gynaecia hauing well perceyued changing cullour euill signes yet looked sodaine ouerthrowe rather bethought selfe best sodainely sawe matter come periode comming neyther cryes getting worde possible meanes able bring liuing action height ouglie sorrowes horrible appeare amazed minde first distract power speech almost wit consider remayning quicke buried graue misery paynefull memorie streight filled true shape forepast mischiefes reason began crye filthye rebellion sinfull sense teare selfe anguish hauing made weake resistance conscience terrible witnes inwarde wickednes still nourishing debatefull fyre complaynte nowe hauing ende directed vnto something disburden sorrowe necessary downefall inwarde wretchednes sawe rigour lawes like lay shamefull death vpon action vndeserued made insupportable yet deapth soule deserued made miserable length letting tong goe dolorous thought guided thus lamentable demeanour spake bottomles pit sorrowe cannot conteyne selfe hauing fyrebrands furyes within still falling yet infinitenes neuer falne neyther ridde myselfe fettred euerlasting consideracion whether recommend protection dishonored fall earth hath life waite encreased reliques shamed carcasse men alwayes cruell neighboures faultes make others ouerthrowe become badge ill masked vertue heauens ô vnspeakeable torment conscience dare looke vnto sinne enter oh receipt polluted mindes whether wilt thou leade captiue thine ô snakye despayre ala ala freeholding power accursed poyson hath graunted vnto held surer depriue life folding mine armes promised fould nothing dead body mother mine deathfull sucke haue geuen philoclea philoclea well hath mother reuenged vppon vnmotherly hating thee zelmane whome yet least miserye fayle remayne sparkes detestable loue thou hast ala minde assures thou hast deceaued fayre stage prepared thee see tragicall ende thy hated loues worde flowed two riuers teares fayre eye drye remembraunce mischiefes dryed vp furious fyre selfe detestation loue according temper melting selfe briny token passion turning eye agayne vpon body remembred dreame night wherein thinking herselfe called zelmane passing troublesome passage found dead body tolde rest sooner caught holde remembraunce determining selfe directe vision foreappoynted ende tooke certayne resolucion embrace death assoone offred vnto way seeke prolonging annoyed life therefore kissing cold face basilius euen rest sayd ioyne faultye soule mine thee much angry god graunt mee shee plight sunne nowe climing ouer horizon first shepherd came seeing king case hearing noyse damaetas made lady philoclea ranne dolefull tidings basilius death vnto presently company came caues entrye king body lay damaetas parte glad hope priuate escape sorye publike losse countrie receaued prince misliked gynaecia nature preuayled aboue iudgement shame shee conceaued taken order ouercame instant former resolucion assoone sawe formost pastorall troupe wretched princesse ranne haue hid face next wood minde knewe almost selfe could wish grounde safetie damaetas sawe runne awaye zelmanes vpper rayment iudging thought certaynely spirit hell come play tragedie wood strange change sawe euery way king dead caues mouth queene hee thought absent pamela fledde away dorus wife mopsa diuers franzies thing zelmane conquered capacitie sodainly woman growne man lockt chamber gotten fieldes hee gaue rest quicklie vnderstande steede thing exigent required beganne make circle fantasticall defence hee euer hearde fortification diuells shepheards better wittes faith forthwith deuided themselues running gynecia esteeming running away great condemnation owne guiltinesse others going prince see seruice left eyther recouerie life honoring death went queene soone ouertaken whome nowe fyrst feares stayde resolucion dye repossessed place minde sawe queene whome besides obedient dutie owde state alwayes carried singuler loue courteous liberality wise vertuous partes filled people affection admiracion sodainely stopped beginning aske pardon followinge sorte desiring good ladie euer bene queene nowe thirsted ridde selfe whome hated aboue thinges assured countenance haue alreadie haue dispensed shame digested sorrowes death thus sayde vnto continue continue friend better excusing one argues assured faith want assurance loued prince able willing doo much good could requite doo publish gratefulnes shall seene world hope left leade vnto remember remember haue lost basilius prince defend father care companyon ioyes friend want loued shew hate author losse faithfull arcadian haue spoyled countrie protector none minister vnnaturall end cary therfore blood hāds testifie innocencie neither spare title sake consider entituled think benefit meanes thinke instrumēt spring stay ye shepheards whose great shepheard gone neede feare woman reuerence lord murtherer haue pittie hath pittie presented faire neck name others signes desired iustice world dutie good king honor themselues fauour poore men looked one vpon vnused arbiter prince matter falne great perplexitie betwixt prince dead princesse aliue might haue gone whether would thinking sacriledge touch person finding finding sufficiēt oratour perswade death hāds well said much time miserie part geue life much pleasure hence forward yeeld desire choise death since rest taken away yet let excell miserie leade therfore whether happy wretched neyther much would honest shepheards rather many teares bemoned encrease former losse till faine leade strange spectacle either princesse hand shepheards prisoner direct gardiens lastly either witnes accuser lady condemne selfe death monefull • arch went towards shepheards meane time left nothing vnassaied reuiue king bootles sorrowes encreased suffred hope vainly arise among trialls made know least cause end hauing espied vnhappy cup gaue little liquor left dogge damaetas within short time wrought like effect although damaetas much recouer loue life dasht braines togither hauing gynaecia among make selfe odious continuallie record mindes excesse losse yelded themselues ouer formes lamentacion dolefull image imprint honest ouer tender harte especially thinke rebound euill fall owne smart therefore auncient greeke maner remembring nobilitie birth continued like auncestors others shape though excellent yet fauour pittie drew thing highest point others peaceable gouernment thing pleaseth men resolued liue owne others liberalitie though cannot light vpon men yet men naturallie hoping may make amiable vertue calling question greatnes power encreased compassion see present change hauing dolefull memorie tempered familier curtesie among feele fruites see pompes greatnes one consent geuing sacred title good iust mercifull father people life countrie ranne body tearing beard garment sending cryes heauen inuenting perticular howling musicke manie vowing kill themselues day funeralls generallie geuing true testimonye men louing creature iniuries put naturall course howe easily thing prince succession deeplie sinke soules subiects liuely monument mausolus tombe hartie lamentacion dispersed among wood resounding shrike sunne perfectest marke time hauing gotten vp two howres iourney dayly changing circle voice helped answering echo came eares faithfull worthy gentleman philanax time comming visite king accompanyed diuers worthie arcadian lord visited place adioyning assurance basilius solitarines thing late mutinie vsually done since princess returne diligentlie continued hauing nowe likewise performed thinking well duty see king good purpose neare receyue direction accompanied aboue sayd morning comming vnto vnpleasant voice gaue minde vncertaine presage neere approching sorow saw bodie dearely esteemed prince heard gynecias lamenting turtlelike loue wont make euer ouersoone losse loued make curfings life detesting owne wickednes seeming therefore desire death would shew loue thing shepheards especially damaetas knowing second person aucthoritie gaue forthwith relacion vnto knewe proued dolorous spectacle besides accident child principally touched maisters losse lighting horse heauie cheare came kneeled downe finding could shepheards recouerie constancie minde surprised might call together best rule could refraine like word ah deere maister sayd change hath pleased almightie iustice worke place soone losse hauing liued long nature time longer well deserued glorie longest eternall mansion possesse soone say ruine haue left fraile barke estate word faithfull dutie deliuered vnto first entred solitarie course might haue wrought much perswasion • prang truth perchaunce seruaunt philanax nowe haue cause losse bewayle owne ouerthrowe therewith taking himselfe deede euill fitteth sayde let goe harte womanish complaint since prince vndoubtedly well rather shewes loue selfe make bewaile mine owne losse true loue must proued honor memorie must shewed seeking iust reuenge vpon vniust vnnaturall enemy farre honorable tombe haue blood murderer sprinkled vpon teares friendes soule looke downe vppon miserable earth doubt much rather death accompanyed well deserued punishment causers heaping sorrowes ende whome vouchsafed affection let lament haue wouen webbe lamentacion let theyr owne deathes make crye death author therewith carying manfull sorowe vindicati • e resolucion face rose vp looking poore guiltlesse princesse transported vniust iustice eye sufficient herauldes denounce mortall hatred whome fury loue firebrand conscience shame world miserable losse husband towardes whome nowe disdaine selfe bred loue remembrance vision wherewith resolued assuredly god appointed shamefull end resting place set mind way death vsed like speech philanax shepheards willing looke vpon woman monster princesse traytor prince basilius wife basilius murtherer tolde howe worlde required handes iust demonstration friendship hee nowe forgot prince hee shoulde shewe hee neuer loued hys fortune like vermine sucke liuing bloud leaue body assoone dead poore princesse needelesly seeking kindle deadly detest vttered bitter answere madame saide well hate selfe cannot hate worse creature though feele enough hellish disposition yet neede doubt counsell selfe much worse know feare shall long combred guided euell soule therefore prepare selfe possible may deliuer vp spirit much purer wash wickednes repentaunce hauing presently giuen order bringing mantinea great number tent receipt principall gentelman greate trust damaetas taking keyes lodge calling moth prince estate onely spot iudgement caused wife daughter bee fettered vp manye chaines clogges coulde beare euery thirde howre bee cruelly whipt till determinate iudgement giuen matter done hauing sent alredy comming quarter countrie seeke pamela although smal hope ouertaking went wel accompanied lodge two vnfortunate louers attending cruell conclusion long painefull late painefull affection damaetas clownish eye hauing ben onely discouerers pyrocles stratagem sooner taken full vewe sightes would rather haue bred thing accusing minde locked doore vpon two yong folkes made prisoner loue bene prisoner loue imediatly vpon going downe whether noyse damaetas made creeping light rather extreame griefe procured sleepe extreame care measured sleepe giuinge sences early salüe come themselues pyrocles awaked vp first euill hansell ill case wherein seeing himselfe depriued sworde neuer seperated himselfe occasion euen night first kinges bedd laid thought safe putting great parte trust well owne cowrage armed indeed confidence one self chiefe nurse magnanimitie confidence notwithstanding doth leaue care necessarie furniture therefore grecian homere doth euer make achilles best armed say first ill token perceaued prisoner arest doore lefte open made • fast outside force could employe vnto could vndo damaetas went windowes see waye escape deare lady vaine hee founde employment hauing might breake onely one barre wherin notwithstanding strained sinewes vttermost rather took vse seruice possibilitie escape euen damaetas hauing gathered together first comming sheepheards blabber hee ha • founde ladye philocleas chamber pyrocles markingly harkned damaetas said whose voice minde acquaintance taught sufficiently know assuredly perceaued lady philoclea fullie discouered follie malice rather malicious follie damaetas honour therein touched hiest degree remembring withal crueltie arcadian lawes without exception condemn al death foūd damaetas reported acte mariage without solemnitie mariage assuring himselfe besides law king queene woulde vse much hate daughter found themselues sotted harbour excellent wit strengthened vertue guided loue soone described himselfe perfect vision present condition wherein hauing presently cast resolute reckoning owne parte misery chiefe sole burthen condemne death deseruing voice troth neuer broken bond true liuing vertue often eye turned attractiue adamant often vnspeakable horror strike noble hart cōsider vnripe yeares fautles beautie mansion accuser damaetas speach found might iustly appeare either philoclea defending honour el dispaire atchieuing left carcase profe intent witnes clearenes hauing small staied vpon greatnes resolution loked furthest said valiant pyrocles neuer life better cause better end bestowed death follow death mine could make leaue vndon die iustly self must die fit executioner mine owne hand accessary killing shall suffer owne punishment arose ther new impediment damaetas hauing caried away thing thought might hurt tender man himselfe hee coulde finde fit instrument might geue finall dispatch length makinge haste leaste lady awake taking iron barre sharper something one end hoped ioynd willing strength might breake former threed mortallitie truely said fortune thou hast well perseuered mine enemie wilt graunt fortune vnfortunate let haue easie passage troubl thee said bar blessed thou hast done seruice chamber paragon life since thou couldest help make perfitter escape yet serue turne pray thee may escape selfe withall yet looking fetch last repast eye newe againe transported pittifull case hee lefte kneeling downe thus prayed great maker great ruler worlde saide hee thee sacrifice bloud mine suffer lorde error youth passe away therein let soule thee made euer bending vnto thee reiected thee neither offended abandon body gouernment thou hadst placed without thy leaue since cā know thy vnsearchable minde doe since thou hast taken meanes longer abide since difference stāds short time dying thou hast framed soule enclyned good howe smal space mine benefit much humane kinde preseruing thy perfittest workmanship chiefest honour iustice selfe howsoeuer thou determinest let excellent innocency bee oppressed let life pay losse lord geue signe may die comfort thorower passage barre troth blunt theffect although pearced skinne brused ribbes sore breath almost past noyse fall draue away sleepe quiet sences deere philoclea whose sweete soule earely salutation deede skummy remnant rebel whose naughty mind could trust much goodnes prince lay hangworthy neck vpō constancy promised pardon therfore whē rest shepe followed fellowes sheepishly submitted thēselues cōmitted safety thickest part desert wood constitution mindes little better beastes apt degenerate beastly kinde life hauing framed gluttonish stomackes haue foode wilde benefites nature vttermost ende drawe much could line tedious life sorte vagabonding vntroden place guided euerlasting iustice vsing themselues bee punishers theyr faultes making theyr owne action beginning chastizements vnhappely themselues light musidorus soone saw turned towards full well remembred accompanyed basilius come succour zelmane left among bloudie token valure pamela many time seene thus fyrst sturred vp rusticall reuenge desire spoyle helpe miserable want chiefly thinking way confirme owne pardon bring princesse backe vnto father whome sure would neuer haue sent farre sleightlie accompanyed without denouncing warre set altogither vpon worthy musidorus hand asmuch enflamed gaue braue welcome smart made rest stand cry prating like bad curres rather barking cloasing meane time placing trembling lady one pyne tree setting himselfe might shewe cause courage grewe himselfe effect employed defence villaines second proofe ill wordes sword turned course violence throwing dartes stone deede way ouermaister valure musidorus finding already touch fall neere chiefest life pamela ende one might happe doo vnsuccourable mischiefe setting hope despaire ranne lady among streight like many swyne hardy mastife set vpon dispersed themselues first ouertooke ranne away carying head farre maner running wont doo one blowe strake cleane falling betwixt handes body falling vppon made shewe though fellow great haste gather vp head agayne another speede made runne best game bare full butte agaynst tree tumbling backe brused face dreadfull expectation musidorus streight vpon parting sword one legges left make roaring lamentation mortertreading marred euer third finding feete slowe aswell handes weake sodaynely turned backe beginning open lippes mercye hee well entred rudely compilde oration musidorus blade come betweene iawes throate poore man rested euer euill mouthfull answere musidorus furious chafe would haue followed hatefull wretch heard lady cry helpe whome three villanous crue while musidorus followed fellowes compassing tree sodainly come vpon surprized threatning kill cried meaning conuey sight prince making bloudthirstie chase resolued worse thing could fall vnto depriued whome established comfort pittifull cry fetched eye vnto thinking many weapon thrust eye eye sawe bent made hartie speede succour one wiser companion set dagger alablaster throate swearing hee threwe away sword would presently kill neuer poore scholler hauing stede booke playing toy sodainly cast childfeared presence cruell scholemaister valiant musidorus discharged himselfe defence whē saw stood vpō instāt point lady life holding vp noble hand vnworthy audience arcadian haue done wrong princesse said shee neuer hurt see shee hath power vse choller vpō haue better deserued selues wrong doe hurte time place euer bee forgiuen yet trusted courtesie bad stande sword obediently farre loue aboue al thought call together rest fellowes though fewe yet according number posse • ed many place began sauage senator make consultation wishing spoile iewels let go iourney carried back sure haue least parte pray others preferring old home thing desired bring basilius pledge surety ther wanted cried safest way kill vnworthy thraldom great excellent personage brought part resisted killing princesse foreseing liues would neuer bee safe fact committed beganne wish rather spoyle death musidorus villaine legge cut came scrawling towardes helped one companie began growning voice disfigured face demaunde reuenge blood since hee spent defence reason suffered die discontented onely contentment required helpe hand might put murderer cruel death would faine haue cried musidorus much losse bloud helped vehemencie choked vp spirit life leauing make betwixt body soule ill fauoured partition seing fellow sorte die face swell newe mortall rage resolued kill nowe onely considering manner terrible death inuent thus agrement slaying broken disagrement manner extremitie cruelty grew time stop crueltie length resolued euery one haue pece become aswell hangman iudges pamela tearing heare falling downe among somtimes al sorte humble praiers mixt promise great good euill thought iustice god beginning paine copled thē together incessantly boyled brest al whē philanax hauing cloasely imprisoned lefte freely suffer fierbrands owne thought especially grewe darke nothing left little lampe whose small light perplexed mind might rather yeld feareful shadowes assured sight beganne heapes misery waye downe platforme iudgement beganne despaire laye ougly clawes vpon shee beganne feare heauenly power shee woont reuerence like childe like enemie neither kept herselfe blasphemous repyning creation god would crye make destruction loue goodnes geue good minde cannot haue without gifte doe plague mee resist mightines power would imagine sawe strange sight heard cry hellish ghostes would skritch succour man comming vnto shee woulde faine haue killed helfe knewe sometimes againe heauines imagination would cloase vp sens little sleepe dreames become tormentor one time would seeme vnto philanax haling heare head hauing put eye redy throw burning fornace another time would thinke sawe husband making complainte death pluto magistrate infernall region contending great debate eternal punishment allot long dreaming would hold woulde fall vpon zelmane shee would think cry mercy passe away silence without shew pittying mischief waking broken sleep yet wishing might euer haue slept new formes misery would seaze minde shee feared death yet desired death shee passed vttermost shame yet shame one cruellest assaulter hated pyrocles originall mortall ouerthrowe yet loue shee conceaued still hie authoritie passion zelmane would say knowing neere himselfe great daunger shalt thou glut thy eye dishonoured death thy enemie enemie ala enemie since thou haste wel shewed thou wilt haue accompt thee couldest thou aswel haue giuē determinate deniall disguise thy first diguising doble dissembling perchaunce bene vtterly hopelesse vertue might haue called together force haue beene led captiue monstrous thraldome punished wickednes would owne knowing good enflame new rage despaire becomming vnresisted lorde brest shee comforte death yet horror thought wearisome detesting selfe made long dayes approach time shee determined continue former course acknowledginge thing might hasten ende wherein although shee hope end torment feeling alreadye beginning hell agony yet according nature paine presente intollerable shee desired change put aduenture ensuing thus rested restlesse gynecia lesse sorrowfull though lesse ragefull mindes princesse pamela lady philoclea whose aduantages consented much euill greater peace themselues lefte alone might mutually beare parte others woe philanax regarding pamelas princely protestation force left vnder garde sister two sister matched aswell disgrace fortune beene best beauty nature thinges till bashfullnes mistrust made holde reserued one feare vnderminer determination necessitie victorious rebell lawes forced enterchaungeably lay open passion swelling woulde haue made auditor stone rather haue swallowed vp silence choking aduentures falne vnto truely hardest harte haue time thought woman teares matter sleight compassion imagining faire weather quickly followe would haue beene mollyfied bene compelled confesse fayrer diamond pittie shoulde receaue bleamish although doubte face rather beautifie sorrow sorrow coulde darken euen darkenes shine long affliction would suffer doleful ceremony bemoned father death sate downe together apparrelled misaduentures founde pamela iournying weedes nowe conuerted another vse philoclea onely night gowne thought bee rayment funeralls sweet mouth deliuered declaring passionate beginning troblesome proceeding daungerous ending neuer ending loues passed time entred prayses young prince long woulde haue exercised tonges memory feeles greater torment doth resist oppressour minde nobler set already embraced hyer thoughtes much repine repined helplesse wound gaue vnto selfe great part night passed ouer dolefull musicke sweete lady complaint leasure though strife brought pamela know eagle cage must thinke like eagle remembring themselues likely next day lord would proceed imprisoned imployed rest night writing vnto earnestnes matter required stile state thought apt fashion meane time pyrocles musidorus recommended strong guard might well see meant pay lesse prise liues getting place like men deede fortifying courage true rampier patience endure rather appeare gouernours necessitie seruaunts fortune whole summe thought resting vpon safetie ladyes care one wherein hart seeme receyue softnes sometimes musidorus would feele motion friend vnworthy case would fall kinde speech pyrocles would say vnhappy may thinke thessalia hath bene middle way euill estate bene brought vp sea haue power thus seuer deere father haue therefore complayntes time become man hart cause complayne since countrie receyued honor pyrocles educacion step ouerthrowe humane chance compted ouerthrowe stand vppon vertue oh excellent musidorus aunswered pyrocles howe teache rather fall selfe fortune since haue receyued good affliction vertuous mother tendrest yeares father greatest trouble sent succour learne sweete mystery phylosophy liuely example confirme learned lastly friendship vnhappines euer make saye hath made happy see desteny god knowe hath rewarded father sends away land whence come followed knowe loue first stayed heere therefore heauens euer held iust proportion feele smart blame heauens sweete pyrocles sayde musidorus course neuer alters nothing done vnreacheable ruler hath euerlasting reason saye truth thing deale vngratefully nature forgetfull receyuers giftes diligent auditor chaunces like haue liued haue liued good selues others soules put sturring earth bodyes haue atchieued cause hether cōming haue knowne honoured knowledge cause creation many men time place fortune lawfull v speake gloriously hath bene behouefull liue since eternitie coniunction lost separation time since hath ende come past nothing protracting nothing gotten labour care therefore wrong something yeares much desert fitter dye say haue brought euill since loue doth ouerballance bodely mischiefes cozen said pirocles complaine fortune seeme selues faultie hauing one hurt showe repentance loue beare matchlesse creature least doubt ouerdeerely bought part dare aunswere call god witnesse farre
